original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim gyis dpal kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim gyis dpal kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin te /
translated: The attainment of the state of glorious Samantabhadra by means of the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation is the ultimate purpose.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ston pa yin no //
translated: All of these are taught by the first verse.

original: 'di dag nyid ni slob dpon sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis phyag rgya chen po dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba yang dag par thugs su chud zin kyang sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par bzhed pas kun du bzang po zhas bya ba
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ni slob dpon sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis phyag rgya chen po dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba yang dag par thugs su chud zin kyang sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par bzhed pas kun du bzang po zhas bya ba
translated: These very [topics] were already perfectly realized by the master Buddhajñānapāda, who is called Samantabhadra, through the yoga of non-duality with the Great Seal, but he wished to benefit all sentient beings without exception.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rab tu byed pa rtsom pa na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rab tu byed pa rtsom pa na /
translated: When composing the means of achievement,

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: he states that paying homage to one's chosen deity comes first.

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the glorious... and so forth.

original: dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Glori-ous is the characteristic of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de gang la mnga' ba de ni dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de gang la mnga' ba de ni dpal ldan no //
translated: He who possesses that is the glorious one.

original: yang na dpal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na dpal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, glory is twofold:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / stobs kyis skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / stobs kyis skyes pa'o //
translated: innate and generated by power.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems so //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems so //
translated: Among them, the innate is the mind that is naturally radiant.

original: stobs kyis skyes pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis kun du bzang po mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis skyes pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis kun du bzang po mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The one generated by power is the universal good that is realized by the power of meditation.

original: de dag dang rnam par ldang ba'i gzi brjid mnga' bas mdzes pa'i 'jam dpal gang yin pa de la mngon par phyag bya ste /
analyzed: de dag dang rnam par ldang ba'i gzi brjid mnga' bas mdzes pa'i 'jam dpal gang yin pa de la mngon par phyag bya ste /
translated: The one who is beautiful with the splendor of those and of the emergence from meditative concentration is Mañjuśrī.

original: de mchod pa'i phyir cho ga zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i rim pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mchod pa'i phyir cho ga zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i rim pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: To worship him, I will explain the ritual, the stages of meditation.

original: gang gzi brjid gnyis po de dag nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gang gzi brjid gnyis po de dag nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
translated: The two kinds of splendor are clarified in the verse:

original: mi shes kun sbangs zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mi shes kun sbangs zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: He has abandoned all ignorance.

original: gang las mi shes pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can kun te /
analyzed: gang las mi shes pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can kun te /
translated: From what? From all ignorance, which is characterized by nescience.

original: ma lus pa spangs shing dor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa spangs shing dor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He has abandoned and discarded all of it.

original: 'dis ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: This shows that since the mind arises from the natural luminosity,

original: gzi brjid rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba nyid yin par bde sprod cing nyid kyi don phun tshogs pa mtshang ba med par ston to //
analyzed: gzi brjid rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba nyid yin par bde sprod cing nyid kyi don phun tshogs pa mtshang ba med par ston to //
translated: the splendor is naturally pure, and it shows the perfection of one's own aim without fault.

original: dpag med rigs kyi zhes bya ba la dpag tu med pa yang yin la /🔽rigs kyi sprul pa yang yin zhing /
analyzed: dpag med rigs kyi zhes bya ba la dpag tu med pa yang yin la / rigs kyi sprul pa yang yin zhing /
translated: The incalculable family emanations are incalculable and also family emanations.

original: rigs kyang yin la sprul pa yang yin pas na dpag med rigs kyi sprul pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyang yin la sprul pa yang yin pas na dpag med rigs kyi sprul pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are also family emanations, and they are also emanations, thus they are called incalculable family emanations.

original: de rnams @140b nyid kyis rab tu rnam par brgyan pa gnag yin pa de la ce dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams @140b nyid kyis rab tu rnam par brgyan pa gnag yin pa de la ce dag ces bya'o //
translated: They are adorned with those because they are adorned with those very things.

original: 'dis ni don dam par dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa kun tu bzang po gcig po'i rgyud du gtogs shing sdug pa nyid yin par ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam par dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa kun tu bzang po gcig po'i rgyud du gtogs shing sdug pa nyid yin par ston te /
translated: This shows that ultimately all the deities of the maṇḍala belong to the continuum of Samantabhadra alone and are dear.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: This is because the Bhagavān himself abides as the essence of all the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: de yang 'di ltar me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, the pure mirror-like intuition and so on are the essence of the Tathagatas Vairocana and so on.

original: sa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The pure elements earth and so on are the essence of the four goddesses Locana and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi rnam par dag pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi rnam par dag pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The pure six sense bases eye and so on are the essence of the six bodhisattvas Kshitigarbha and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa skye mched rnam par dag pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skye mched rnam par dag pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The pure six sense objects form and so on are the essence of the six goddesses Rupavajrī and so on.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa khro bo bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa khro bo bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The pure faith and so on are the essence of the four wrathful deities Yamantaka and so on.

original: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Wisdom and so on.

original: shes rab ni chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the essence of the thorough differentiation of all things as selfless.

original: yan lag ni thabs te snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni thabs te snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The limb is the means, which is great compassion.

original: de gnyis 'dus pa ni de bzhin nyid thams cad mngon sum du mdzad pas /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dus pa ni de bzhin nyid thams cad mngon sum du mdzad pas /
translated: The union of those two is the direct realization of all suchness.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i tshul gyis 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i tshul gyis 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don la zhugs pa'o //
translated: By the method of engaging in it naturally, one engages in the welfare of sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: nges 'bar ba ni yid du 'ong bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nges 'bar ba ni yid du 'ong bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The blazing is the pleasant feeling.

original: 'dis ni gzhan la phan pa'i thabs ma tshang ba med par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan la phan pa'i thabs ma tshang ba med par ston to //
translated: This shows the method for the welfare of others without incompleteness.

original: yang na shes rab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the seal of exalted wisdom.

original: yan lag ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dpal lo //
analyzed: yan lag ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dpal lo //
translated: The limb is the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī.

original: de gnyis 'dus pa ni dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pas /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dus pa ni dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pas /
translated: The union of those two is the union of the two organs.

original: chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: They become one, like water and milk.

original: des 'od gsal ba'i dga' ba chen po'i sgra las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs dang sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i dgos pa mdzad pa las 'jam zhing kun du bzang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpal gang ma mnga' ba de ni 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: des 'od gsal ba'i dga' ba chen po'i sgra las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs dang sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i dgos pa mdzad pa las 'jam zhing kun du bzang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpal gang ma mnga' ba de ni 'jam dpal te /
translated: He is Manjusri, the one who is gentle, who has the nature of being everywhere good, who is the glory of all the assemblies of Buddhas and sentient beings, who arises from the sound of the great joy of clear light, and who performs the purpose of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams ca kyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams ca kyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: He is the body of the pristine wisdom of all the Tathagatas.

original: de mchod phyir zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mchod phyir zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to worship him means in order to proclaim him.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du yin gyi /🔽'dir @141a * //
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du yin gyi / 'dir @141a * //
translated: It is in order to actualize him.

original: mchod pa'i sgra mchod pa nyid bya par ston pa'i tshig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa'i sgra mchod pa nyid bya par ston pa'i tshig ni ma yin no //
translated: Here the word worship does not indicate the act of worship.

original: yang na bsgom pa yang mchod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsgom pa yang mchod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Or, meditation is itself worship.

original: yang na ji ltar khyed nyid mchod pa'i cho ga 'chad /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar khyed nyid mchod pa'i cho ga 'chad /
translated: Or, how do you explain the rite of worship?

original: gal te rang bzor rtsom na 'di la mkhas pa su zhig gus par byed /
analyzed: gal te rang bzor rtsom na 'di la mkhas pa su zhig gus par byed /
translated: If you compose it on your own, what wise person would respect it?

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin na /
translated: Well then, if it follows the scriptures of the Transcendent Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di nyid kyi thugs rje chen po'i yan lag gis 'khyud par de dang de dag tu mang du nges par byas zin to zhes rtog na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di nyid kyi thugs rje chen po'i yan lag gis 'khyud par de dang de dag tu mang du nges par byas zin to zhes rtog na /
translated: then it is embraced by the very Transcendent Lord's limb of great compassion, and it is ascertained in many places.

original: de'i phyir dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says glorious, etc.

original: dpal dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshogs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: dpal dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshogs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The assembly of the glorious Buddhas is their gathering.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir gcig tu 'dus par mdzad pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir gcig tu 'dus par mdzad pas na dpal ldan 'dus pa'o //
translated: Since they gather together for the sake of sentient beings, it is the glorious gathering.

original: yang na aa'i padma las nges par 'khrungs pas na aa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aa'i padma las nges par 'khrungs pas na aa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, since it is definitely born from the lotus of A, it is born from A.

original: dpal ldan yang yin la aa las skyes pa yang yin bas na 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan yang yin la aa las skyes pa yang yin bas na 'dus pa'o //
translated: Since it is glorious and born from A, it is the gathering.

original: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The scripture that teaches that is also called that.

original: de las gsungs pa'i gzhung lugs dam tshig nyams su blangs pa la sogs pa ni dpal ldan 'dus pa'i gzhung lugs te /
analyzed: de las gsungs pa'i gzhung lugs dam tshig nyams su blangs pa la sogs pa ni dpal ldan 'dus pa'i gzhung lugs te /
translated: The system of the glorious Guhyasamaja is the practice of the pledges taught in that tantra.

original: des cho ga bstan cing bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des cho ga bstan cing bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: That is what is to be explained and taught by this ritual.

original: ci khyed la cho ga 'di gzhan gyis gsol ba ma btab par bshad dam /
analyzed: ci khyed la cho ga 'di gzhan gyis gsol ba ma btab par bshad dam /
translated: Is this ritual taught by you without being requested by others?

original: 'on te gsol ba btab ce na /
analyzed: 'on te gsol ba btab ce na /
translated: Or is it taught at the request of others?🔽Therefore, it says,

original: de'i phyir bshes gnyen dam pa yis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshes gnyen dam pa yis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Requested by excellent spiritual friends

original: gang la rnam par byang ba yod pa de ni bshes gnyen dam pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rnam par byang ba yod pa de ni bshes gnyen dam pa ste /
translated: Those who have purification are excellent spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de spun dang slob ma'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de spun dang slob ma'o //
translated: Those spiritual friends are brothers and disciples.

original: spun zla ni gsum ste /
analyzed: spun zla ni gsum ste /
translated: Brothers are three:

original: kodka na'i chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / ri bo ha sa ra'i gtsug tor rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kodka na'i chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / ri bo ha sa ra'i gtsug tor rdo rje'o //
translated: Kodakani, Dharmakosa, and Hasarimalocana.

original: slob ma'i cho ga ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: slob ma'i cho ga ni bzhi ste /
translated: Disciples are four:

original: mar me mdzad bzang po dang / rab tu zhi ba'i bshes gnyen dang / rdo rje bde ba chen po dang / sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po'o //
analyzed: mar me mdzad bzang po dang / rab tu zhi ba'i bshes gnyen dang / rdo rje bde ba chen po dang / sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po'o //
translated: Dipamkarabhadra, Prashantamitra, Vajramahasukha, and Rahulabhadra.

original: de rnams kyis bskul ba ni bsnyen bkur sngon du 'gro bas gsol ba btab pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bskul ba ni bsnyen bkur sngon du 'gro bas gsol ba btab pa ste /
translated: The request is the supplication preceded by service and honor.

original: des bdag spro bar bya ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des bdag spro bar bya ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the encouragement of oneself.

original: cho ga de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: cho ga de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the rite like?

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “for the sake of the complete fulfillment of the aims of all beings without exception,”

original: 'gro ba ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni don gyi mthar thug pa kun du bzang po mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni don gyi mthar thug pa kun du bzang po mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pas so //
translated: and so on. The complete fulfillment of the aims of all beings without exception is the ultimate aim, which is characterized by the realization of the universal vehicle’s perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyur @141b gyur pa ni byed par gyur pa'o //🔽'dis ni sems can rnam pa thams cad mgu bar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyur @141b gyur pa ni byed par gyur pa'o // 'dis ni sems can rnam pa thams cad mgu bar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: The rite is the cause of that.

original: snod du gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: snod du gyur pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the vessel is one who delights all beings in every way.🔽And that is as stated:

original: de yang / dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: de yang / dngos po gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: Whatever things there are

original: mi rnams yid ni mgu gyur pa //
analyzed: mi rnams yid ni mgu gyur pa //
translated: that delight the minds of men,

original: de dang der ni rnam ston te //
analyzed: de dang der ni rnam ston te //
translated: in all those things

original: sna tshogs nor bu ji bzhin no //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs nor bu ji bzhin no //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: he appears like a variegated gem.

original: da ni blo dman zhing mi mkhas pa rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni blo dman zhing mi mkhas pa rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to properly encourage those of lesser intellect and those who are not learned,

original: dal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “This leisure and endowment is very unsteady,” and so on.

original: kye bzhin bzangs rang gi don sems ni don dam par shes rab dang thabs bsgom par gzhol ba la 'bad par bya ste /
analyzed: kye bzhin bzangs rang gi don sems ni don dam par shes rab dang thabs bsgom par gzhol ba la 'bad par bya ste /
translated: “Oh, good people, you should strive to apply yourself to the cultivation of wisdom and method in the ultimate sense, thinking about your own aim.

original: gzhol ba ni de la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba ni de la brtson pa'o //
translated: “Application” is striving for that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dal 'byor 'di ni shin tu g-yo ba dang / zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dal 'byor 'di ni shin tu g-yo ba dang / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “This leisure and endowment is very unsteady,” and so on.

original: mi khom pa brgyad po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight leisureless states?

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / yul mtha' khob pa dang / lha tshe ring po dang / dbang po mtshang ba dang / las mtshang ba dang / las med par ston pa'i lta ba la slob pa dang / sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i 'jig rten du skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / yul mtha' khob pa dang / lha tshe ring po dang / dbang po mtshang ba dang / las mtshang ba dang / las med par ston pa'i lta ba la slob pa dang / sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i 'jig rten du skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be birth as a hell being, a hungry ghost, an animal, a barbarian, a long-lived god, someone with defective faculties, someone with defective views, someone who is born in a world where a buddha has not arisen, and someone who is born in a place where the teachings are not being taught.

original: de lta bu'i mi khom pa brgyad las thar pa 'di ni dal 'byor te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi khom pa brgyad las thar pa 'di ni dal 'byor te /
translated: This freedom from those eight leisureless states is leisure.

original: skal ba mnyam par gtogs pa'i sde pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam par gtogs pa'i sde pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi'i skye ba'o //
translated: the birth of a human being, which is included in the class of those who are fortunate, and which is characterized by the opportunity to practice.

original: de yang g-yo ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang g-yo ba yin te /
translated: And that is unstable,

original: rba ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang ba yin no //🔽dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa thob na yang 'jig rten na skye bo dam pa dang phrad pa ste /
analyzed: rba ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang ba yin no // dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa thob na yang 'jig rten na skye bo dam pa dang phrad pa ste /
translated: because of the many sufferings of birth, sickness, old age, death, separation from what is dear, and so on.🔽Even if one obtains the perfection of the opportunity of the leisures, it is difficult to find in the world a holy person,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: a spiritual teacher, with whom one can meet.

original: de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should rely on a spiritual teacher.

original: gzhol ba ni khyad par can gyi 'dod par bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba ni khyad par can gyi 'dod par bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: One should be devoted to the yoga of meditation on the special desire.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the verse that is made from the point of view of the two verses is stated:

original: de la sngags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the mantra practitioner, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yon tan dgar ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yon tan dgar ba'o //
translated: Therein means in the selection of the qualities.

original: sngags pa zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'i slob dpon te /
analyzed: sngags pa zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'i slob dpon te /
translated: The one called a mantrin is a master who practices the way of secret mantra.

original: de snying rje dang rab tu ldan zhing brtse ba phul du byung bas kam zhes pa bde ba /
analyzed: de snying rje dang rab tu ldan zhing brtse ba phul du byung bas kam zhes pa bde ba /
translated: He is endowed with compassion, and with the highest love, he is kam, bliss.

original: ru ne da ti ste 'gog par byed pas snying rje ste /
analyzed: ru ne da ti ste 'gog par byed pas snying rje ste /
translated: Runi means to stop, and ati means to generate, so compassion is the characteristic of aspiration.

original: smon pa'i mtshan nyid can skyed cing byang chub ste kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i @142a * //
analyzed: smon pa'i mtshan nyid can skyed cing byang chub ste kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i @142a * //
translated: In order to attain enlightenment, the state of Samantabhadra,

original: phyir ; gang gis khyad par can gyi sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ; gang gis khyad par can gyi sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: he generates the special mind.

original: de bzhin du stong pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis brgyan cing spud par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis brgyan cing spud par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Similarly, he is adorned and ornamented with the qualities of emptiness and so forth.

original: gtong ba ni rang gi nor rab tu ster ba'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni rang gi nor rab tu ster ba'o //
translated: Giving is the bestowal of one's own wealth.

original: sogs kyi sgras ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words and so forth include ethics, patience, diligence, and so forth.

original: zab mo'i tshul ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i tshul ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The profound way is the Great Vehicle.

original: de la lhag par mos pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la mngon par brtson zhing 'bad pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la mngon par brtson zhing 'bad pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Exceedingly devoted to that means that one is devoted to listening, reflection, and meditation, and is endowed with effort.

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa nyid kyis na stong pa chen po la sogs pa la lhag par mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa nyid kyis na stong pa chen po la sogs pa la lhag par mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes exceedingly devoted to the great emptiness, etc., by the adornment of the qualities of emptiness, etc.

original: de yang / tshul khrims yang dag blangs te de bzhin 'jug / sbyin pa gtong zhing snying rje'ang sten byed la //🔽bzod cing dge ba de yang 'gro ba 'di //
analyzed: de yang / tshul khrims yang dag blangs te de bzhin 'jug / sbyin pa gtong zhing snying rje'ang sten byed la // bzod cing dge ba de yang 'gro ba 'di //
translated: And that is as stated in the following: Having taken up morality, one practices it; one gives gifts and cultivates compassion.

original: grol zhing byang chub dam pa thob par byed //
analyzed: grol zhing byang chub dam pa thob par byed //
translated: One is patient and virtuous, and that leads to liberation and the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus byed cing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gus byed cing //
translated: One is respectful to the bodhisattvas,

original: rgya che zab mo'i tshul la rnam par mkhas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgya che zab mo'i tshul la rnam par mkhas // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and is skilled in the method of the vast and the profound.🔽And so on.

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The glorious, etc.

original: dpal ni rgyud thams cad las phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin la //
analyzed: dpal ni rgyud thams cad las phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin la //
translated: Glory is the characteristic of excellence in all the tantras.

original: dpal de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni dpal ldan te /
analyzed: dpal de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni dpal ldan te /
translated: He who is endowed with that glory is glorious.

original: rgyud kyi mthar thug 'dus pa yin //
analyzed: rgyud kyi mthar thug 'dus pa yin //
translated: The assembly is the culmination of the tantra.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽snying po len pas na dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // snying po len pas na dkyil 'khor te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽The mandala is the collection of the essence.

original: manda ni snying po la bya ste /
analyzed: manda ni snying po la bya ste /
translated: Mandala means essence.

original: mar dang zho'i snying po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mar dang zho'i snying po dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the essence of butter and curd.

original: der gang dbang bskur ba'i tshul gyis bya ba de dang ldan zhing bcas pa'o //
analyzed: der gang dbang bskur ba'i tshul gyis bya ba de dang ldan zhing bcas pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with and possesses that which is to be done by the method of empowerment.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang / bum pa'i dbang bskur ba dang po ste //
analyzed: de yang / bum pa'i dbang bskur ba dang po ste //
translated: the vase empowerment is the first,

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur gnyis pa ste //
translated: the secret empowerment is the second,

original: shes rab ye shes gsum pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes gsum pa yin //
translated: and the wisdom-knowledge empowerment is the third.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: As explained in this way,

original: slob dpon gyis slob ma la dbang bskur ba yang dag par rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis slob ma la dbang bskur ba yang dag par rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: the master should fully complete the empowerment conferral upon the disciple.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon mnyes par byas shing yon phul bas rjes su gnang ba byin nas /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon mnyes par byas shing yon phul bas rjes su gnang ba byin nas /
translated: According to the rite means that after pleasing the master and offering a gift, permission is given.

original: yang dag par bsgoms na 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgoms na 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one meditates correctly, one will attain the result.

original: rgyud gzhan las ni dbang bskur ba brgyad gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las ni dbang bskur ba brgyad gsungs te /
translated: In other tantras, eight consecrations are taught:

original: bum pa'i dbang bskur ba dang / phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba dang / cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba @142b dang ; ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba dang / de kho na nyid bstan pa dang /
analyzed: bum pa'i dbang bskur ba dang / phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba dang / cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba @142b dang ; ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba dang / de kho na nyid bstan pa dang /
translated: the vase consecration, the garland consecration, the hanging ribbon consecration, the diadem consecration, the name consecration, the vajra consecration, the teaching of reality,

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang / rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: the secret consecration, and the permission consecration.

original: 'di dag nyid 'di'i nang du 'dus pas rgyud 'dir dbang bskur ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid 'di'i nang du 'dus pas rgyud 'dir dbang bskur ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since these are included in this one, in this tantra three consecrations are taught.

original: bzhi pa yang ni zhes bya ba ni yang rim pa 'di nyid kyis slob dpon nyid du dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang ni zhes bya ba ni yang rim pa 'di nyid kyis slob dpon nyid du dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The fourth is also, which is the consecration as a master by this very process.

original: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la blo dang ldan pa ni shes rab chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la blo dang ldan pa ni shes rab chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The wise one, the wise one has great wisdom.

original: rang sngags mnyes par bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang sngags mnyes par bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should please one's own mantra means

original: bla mas bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa ni sngags te /
analyzed: bla mas bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa ni sngags te /
translated: the mantra is the sequence of meditation taught by the guru.

original: de mnyes par bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mnyes par bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: One should please it means one should realize it.

original: bsgom pa la bslab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa la bslab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to train in meditation,

original: las dang po'i gnas bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: las dang po'i gnas bstan pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: he taught the beginner's stage,

original: la lar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: saying in some places, etc.

original: ri bo mchog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: ri bo mchog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: In some supreme mountain,

original: 'jam zhing snyan pa'i gsung 'gro ba ma lus pa yid tshim par byed pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs mnga' ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam zhing snyan pa'i gsung 'gro ba ma lus pa yid tshim par byed pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs mnga' ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should accomplish the one who has a voice with sixty melodious tones, a voice that satisfies all beings with its gentleness and sweetness.

original: ri bo de yang dri ma med pa'i chu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ri bo de yang dri ma med pa'i chu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: That mountain is also endowed with pure water,

original: chu'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: with the combination of water.

original: shing mchog ni /
analyzed: shing mchog ni /
translated: The supreme tree

original: s'a la dang / ta la dang / ta ma la dang / 'bra go dang / aa mra la sogs pa shing gi mchog gi phreng bas rnam par brgyan cing mdzes par byas pa de lta bu dang / nye ba'i ri bo'i phyogs gcig gang yin pa der lha mnyes par bya bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: s'a la dang / ta la dang / ta ma la dang / 'bra go dang / aa mra la sogs pa shing gi mchog gi phreng bas rnam par brgyan cing mdzes par byas pa de lta bu dang / nye ba'i ri bo'i phyogs gcig gang yin pa der lha mnyes par bya bar rigs kyi /
translated: In that place, on one side of the mountain, the gods are pleased.

original: gzhan du na gal te 'brel pa med pa'i dngos po mthong na sems la phyin ci log nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te 'brel pa med pa'i dngos po mthong na sems la phyin ci log nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one sees a thing that is unrelated, a false idea arises in the mind.

original: de ltar rab bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus, one should accomplish, etc., up to: one should make manifest in the manner that will be explained below.

original: da ni bsgom pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the stages of engaging in meditation are stated:

original: dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: first, etc.

original: dang por mal nas langs la nang par te /
analyzed: dang por mal nas langs la nang par te /
translated: First, having risen from bed, in the morning,

original: snga dro'i thog mar snying ga'i bla ba'i dbus te dkyil du yi ge ma rnam par dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: snga dro'i thog mar snying ga'i bla ba'i dbus te dkyil du yi ge ma rnam par dgod par bya ste /
translated: at the beginning of the day, one should place the letter ma in the middle of the heart channel.

original: sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'i steng du mam las byung ba'i ral gri'i dbus na gnas pa'i 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i sa bon rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma la gnas pa'i zla ba'i steng du mam las byung ba'i ral gri'i dbus na gnas pa'i 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i sa bon rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine the seed of Mañjuvajra located in the middle of a sword arisen from the syllable maṃ on a moon situated on a variegated lotus.

original: ji lta bu zhen dri med 'od zer rab tu 'phro ba'i zhes bya ba @143a * //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhen dri med 'od zer rab tu 'phro ba'i zhes bya ba @143a * //
translated: What is it like? It is said to be “radiating stainless light rays.”

original: smos te / kha dog lnga pa'i 'od zer rtse mo las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nges par 'byung ba kun nas 'phro ba gang yin pa de ni de nyid ces bya ba sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par dag par byed cing /
analyzed: smos te / kha dog lnga pa'i 'od zer rtse mo las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nges par 'byung ba kun nas 'phro ba gang yin pa de ni de nyid ces bya ba sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par dag par byed cing /
translated: The light rays of five colors emanating from the tips of the sword are the Tathāgatas emerging all around. That which is “just that” purifies the desire, hatred, and ignorance of sentient beings,

original: don dam pa'i chos ston par mdzad par bsams nas /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ston par mdzad par bsams nas /
translated: and is imagined to teach the ultimate Dharma.

original: rang gi gdong bkru ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi gdong bkru ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should wash one’s face, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dkyil 'khor dang / mchod rten gyi las dang / dkon mchog gsum la bskor ba bya ba dang / phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pa thams cad bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dkyil 'khor dang / mchod rten gyi las dang / dkon mchog gsum la bskor ba bya ba dang / phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pa thams cad bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The word “and so on” means that one should do all the activities of the maṇḍala, stūpa, and circumambulating the Three Jewels, and all the outer offerings, and so on.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang snying rje chen pos yongs su gdung ba'i brtse ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa la rigs kyis gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang snying rje chen pos yongs su gdung ba'i brtse ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa la rigs kyis gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: All of these are engaged in by a mind endowed with the affection of being tormented by great compassion, but not by others.

original: yang na de nyid de /
analyzed: yang na de nyid de /
translated: Or, that itself is the family.

original: phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa dang ldan par grags pa de nyid la rigs te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa dang ldan par grags pa de nyid la rigs te /
translated: It is renowned as being endowed with the realization of reality.

original: gang gi phyir 'di nyid ni don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs te de bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di nyid ni don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs te de bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Because this is the ultimate wisdom and method, it is the cultivation of that.

original: dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par mthong ba lags so zhes gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par mthong ba lags so zhes gsungs pa yin la /
translated: In the Shriparamādya Tantra it says, “The tathāgatas are seen in the form of a moon maṇḍala in one’s heart.”

original: ye shes de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i nag nog ma lus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis 'od 'bar ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag tshim par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i nag nog ma lus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis 'od 'bar ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag tshim par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: It is blazing with light because it is free from all the stains of attachment and so forth, it is the nature that satisfies all migrating beings because it is the nature of the accumulation of all merit and wisdom,

original: dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i dgongs pa'i don bsgrub par nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor lo khyab pa nyid kyis mngon par mtho ba dang /
analyzed: dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i dgongs pa'i don bsgrub par nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor lo khyab pa nyid kyis mngon par mtho ba dang /
translated: it is endowed with the ability to accomplish the intended purpose of all realms of sentient beings through the emanations of glorious Manjushri and so forth, and it is exalted because it pervades the wheel of the directions that reaches the end of the realm of space.

original: nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu ma lus pa dang ldan pas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang 'dra bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu ma lus pa dang ldan pas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang 'dra bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: Because it is completely perfect, since it possesses all the results of definite goodness, it is like the form of a full moon.

original: de nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase just that.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa ston te /
translated: Now, the entry into meditative concentration is taught.

original: tsandan bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bzang po zhes bya ba ni shr'i khanda la sogs @143b pa tsandan bzang pos byugs pa'o //
analyzed: tsandan bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bzang po zhes bya ba ni shr'i khanda la sogs @143b pa tsandan bzang pos byugs pa'o //
translated: With the words anointed with excellent sandalwood, etc., excellent means that it is anointed with excellent sandalwood, such as Sharî Khanda, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The word etc.

original: gur kum dang / ga bur dang / gla rtsis byugs pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa dang / aa ka ru dang / tu ru ska la sogs pa'i bdug pas bdugs shing /
analyzed: gur kum dang / ga bur dang / gla rtsis byugs pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa dang / aa ka ru dang / tu ru ska la sogs pa'i bdug pas bdugs shing /
translated: indicates that it is beautified with anointment of saffron, camphor, and musk, and is perfumed with incense of agaru, turushka, etc.

original: san ta na dang / ba lu ka dang / tsam pa ka dang / dz'a ti dang / ma li ka dang / autpala la sogs pa me tog gi khyad par dri zhim pa rnams gcal du bkram pas mdzes par byas pa'i mchog gi cha ste /
analyzed: san ta na dang / ba lu ka dang / tsam pa ka dang / dz'a ti dang / ma li ka dang / autpala la sogs pa me tog gi khyad par dri zhim pa rnams gcal du bkram pas mdzes par byas pa'i mchog gi cha ste /
translated: baluka, campaka, jasmine, mallika, and utpala.

original: phyogs dam pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas zhes pa ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa'i gnas bde ba'i stan la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs dam pa'i bsam gtan gyi gnas zhes pa ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa'i gnas bde ba'i stan la gnas par bya ste /
translated: The “place of meditation” is a place for the equipoise of samādhi. One should sit on a comfortable seat.

original: btsos dang dar gyis g-yogs pa'i stan nang tshangs can 'jam po la sogs par ting nge 'dzin la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: btsos dang dar gyis g-yogs pa'i stan nang tshangs can 'jam po la sogs par ting nge 'dzin la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in samādhi on a seat that is covered with cotton and silk, soft, and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: What are the characteristics of that?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The buddhas of the three times…” and so on.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The buddhas of the past, future, and present are in the ten directions.

original: dmigs te zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs te zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsam pa'o //
translated: “Focus” means to visualize.

original: sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin rnams ni //🔽zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i zla ba'i ral gri'i 'od zer gyi sgra las byung ba'i mchod pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin rnams ni // zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i zla ba'i ral gri'i 'od zer gyi sgra las byung ba'i mchod pa /
translated: The clouds of various offerings

original: me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos dang / thol mo dang / glu dang / gar dang / gos dang / na bza' la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par can rnams ni shin tu mang ba'i phyir sprin dang 'dra bas na sprin rnams so //
analyzed: me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos dang / thol mo dang / glu dang / gar dang / gos dang / na bza' la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par can rnams ni shin tu mang ba'i phyir sprin dang 'dra bas na sprin rnams so //
translated: The offerings that arise from the sound of the sword's radiance on the moon at the heart are the special offerings of various kinds, such as flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, food, betel, song, dance, clothing, ornaments, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bstod pa dang ; sems can rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam bya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bdag dbul ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bstod pa dang ; sems can rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam bya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bdag dbul ba'o //
translated: The word etc. refers to the praise that precedes the offerings, the aspirational prayers that are made for the sake of caring for sentient beings, the supplications, and the self-offering.

original: blo ldan gyis zhes bya ba ni sems brtan pa ste /
analyzed: blo ldan gyis zhes bya ba ni sems brtan pa ste /
translated: The wise refers to those whose minds are stable,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from all distracting thoughts.

original: de ltar sngar bshad pa dang 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngar bshad pa dang 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, as explained above and below, one should confess evil deeds, etc. in the presence of the Buddhas.

original: dge ba rnams ni 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to increase the wholesome.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: dge ba rnams nye bar bsags pa'i phyir ro //🔽sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang @144a * //
analyzed: dge ba rnams nye bar bsags pa'i phyir ro // sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang @144a * //
translated: because the wholesome is accumulated.🔽The words🔽etc.

original: chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: include rejoicing in merit, going for refuge to the Three, arousing the Awakening Mind, and abiding in the path.🔽The explanation of this brief

original: mdor bstan pa 'di'i bshad pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa 'di'i bshad pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: teaching is stated

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽dang por sdig pa bshags pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te / dang por sdig pa bshags pa'o //
translated: beginning with Whatever.

original: de la gang zhig med ces bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdig pa'i rnyog pa nye bar bsags pa gang yin pa de thugs rjes thugs non pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan sngar bshags shing rab tu bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig med ces bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdig pa'i rnyog pa nye bar bsags pa gang yin pa de thugs rjes thugs non pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan sngar bshags shing rab tu bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: Here, whatever refers to the accumulation of the defilement of evil deeds from beginningless time. That should be confessed and proclaimed in the presence of the Buddhas, who are compassionate and compassionate.

original: de yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i chu klung dba' rlabs 'khrug pa'i dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su kun du rtog pa ma lus pas bsags shing nye bar bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi bag chags las byung ba'i sdig pa bgyis pa dang bgyid du stsal ba dang /🔽bgyis pa la rjes su yi rang ba de dag cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba slar yang mi byed pa sngon du 'gro bas thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i chu klung dba' rlabs 'khrug pa'i dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su kun du rtog pa ma lus pas bsags shing nye bar bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi bag chags las byung ba'i sdig pa bgyis pa dang bgyid du stsal ba dang / bgyis pa la rjes su yi rang ba de dag cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba slar yang mi byed pa sngon du 'gro bas thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in the river of existence of samsara, which is without beginning, in the states of hell-beings, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and so on, which are agitated by the waves of birth and death, I have accumulated and gathered all the afflictions that arise from the latent tendencies of the afflicted mind, and I have committed sins and caused others to commit them.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having confessed them all in accordance with the rite, that is, having made the preliminary of not doing them again, I confess all those sins that I have committed with my body, speech, and mind, and the natural sins and the sins that are proscribed.🔽The confession of sins is finished.

original: bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba gsungs pa ni rdzogs sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba gsungs pa ni rdzogs sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The praise of merit is stated with To the perfect Buddhas, and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa rnams la phul du byung ba'i bsam pas khyad par med par rjes su yi rang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa rnams la phul du byung ba'i bsam pas khyad par med par rjes su yi rang bar bya zhing /
translated: One should rejoice in all the roots of virtue without distinction with an exalted thought.

original: snying rjes yongs su bsgom pa'i sems kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing /
analyzed: snying rjes yongs su bsgom pa'i sems kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing /
translated: One should dedicate them to unsurpassed enlightenment with a thought that is thoroughly cultivated by compassion.

original: gzhan gyi don la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam du yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam du yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: And one should reveal them as the path that has the characteristic of engaging in the welfare of others.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams la dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams la dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Virtue is called “merit” because it purifies and cleanses the accumulations of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: su zhig gis byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig gis byas pa zhe na /
translated: Who does it?

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / 'phags pa ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / gzhan gyis zhes bya ba mu stegs dang so so'i skye bos byas pa yan chad do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / 'phags pa ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / gzhan gyis zhes bya ba mu stegs dang so so'i skye bos byas pa yan chad do //
translated: The perfect buddhas, the fully enlightened ones, and the noble bodhisattvas abiding on the ten levels, such as Avalokitesvara, and the noble ones, the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and others, refers to those composed by non-Buddhists and ordinary beings.

original: ji ltar na mu stegs pas byas pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya zhe @144b na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na mu stegs pas byas pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya zhe @144b na ;
translated: How can one rejoice in the merit created by non-Buddhists?

original: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab brgyad stong pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i le'u las bsdus pa dag snang bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab brgyad stong pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i le'u las bsdus pa dag snang bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is not contradictory, as it is summarized in the chapter on rejoicing in the Bhagavati Prajnaparamita in 8,000 lines.

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni yid kyi rol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni yid kyi rol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Taking refuge in the Three Jewels is stated in three verses beginning with The mental engagement...

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i khyad par las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi dra bas 'brel ba'i yid kyi rol pas 'khrul pa nyid ni dri med zla ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i khyad par las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi dra bas 'brel ba'i yid kyi rol pas 'khrul pa nyid ni dri med zla ba ste /
translated: The light rays that arise from the special power of samadhi, the mental display that is connected by a network of light rays, is the stainless moon.

original: sems kyi zla ba des bsgrubs shing rdzogs par byas pa'i 'gro ba'i don tshad med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi zla ba des bsgrubs shing rdzogs par byas pa'i 'gro ba'i don tshad med pa /
translated: The limitless benefit for beings that is accomplished and perfected by that moon of mind

original: snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi thabs kyis bsgrubs pa'i dgos pa'i don mnga' ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi thabs kyis bsgrubs pa'i dgos pa'i don mnga' ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: is the purpose that is accomplished by the method that has the nature of great compassion. I go for refuge to the Bhagavan Buddhas who have that purpose.

original: ci zhig ston ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ston ce na /
translated: What is being taught?

original: kun du bzang po nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can ma lus pa'i dgongs pa mdzad pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir sems can ma lus pa'i dgongs pa mdzad pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Because of being the nature of Samantabhadra, the nature of the dharmakaya, he is skilled in accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings without exception.

original: rang gi yid la gnas par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: rang gi yid la gnas par gyur pa yi //
translated: Abiding in one's own mind

original: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: means that because it is the nature of one's own awareness,

original: don dam par rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par byas pa yin gyi /
translated: It is realized in the ultimate sense by the direct perception of the yogi.

original: phyi rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not external.

original: rtog pa ma lus pa las nges grol zhing //
analyzed: rtog pa ma lus pa las nges grol zhing //
translated: It is completely liberated from all conceptual thoughts.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: chos de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: I take refuge in that Dharma.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rtog pa ma lus pa las nges par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ma lus pa las nges par grol ba ste /
translated: It is completely liberated from all conceptual thoughts.

original: mi bden pa'i rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from all the stains of unreal conceptual thoughts.

original: sems dpa' dam pa ni chos kyi ngang tshul can gyi dam pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems dpa' dam pa ni chos kyi ngang tshul can gyi dam pa rnams so //
translated: The best of beings are the best of those who have the nature of Dharma.

original: de rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Their perfection has the characteristics of high rebirth and the auspicious state of liberation.

original: de'i gzhi ni rten no //🔽dngos po thams cad ro gcig ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni rten no // dngos po thams cad ro gcig ngo bo nyid //
translated: The basis of that is the support.🔽All things have a single taste in their nature.

original: ces ba ni so sor snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ma lus pa'i ro gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: ces ba ni so sor snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ma lus pa'i ro gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: All things that have the nature of mere individual appearances have a single taste in their nature, which is emptiness.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos ni ci yang med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos ni ci yang med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: Because there is no dharma whatsoever that is not included in the dharmadhātu, emptiness has the characteristic of being all-pervading.

original: 'ching ba rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to “from the bonds” and so forth,

original: brtul zhugs dang ldan pa rnams kyi dbang po yin pas na brtul zhugs dbang po ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs dang ldan pa rnams kyi dbang po yin pas na brtul zhugs dbang po ste /
translated: since it is the faculty of those who possess discipline, it is the faculty of discipline.

original: brtul zhugs can ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams so //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams so //
translated: Those who possess discipline are the śrāvaka arhats.
That

original: rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa bar gyur pa gzhan gyi don la brtson pas dbang po ste bdag po'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa bar gyur pa gzhan gyi don la brtson pas dbang po ste bdag po'o //
translated: is their faculty, which is the root of great compassion, the faculty that is the master of those who strive for the benefit of others.

original: de rnams kyi tshogs ni mang po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshogs ni mang po ste /
translated: Their assembly is a multitude.

original: de la bdag skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: I go for refuge to that.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / 'ching ba rnams las yang dag grol gyur cing //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / 'ching ba rnams las yang dag grol gyur cing //
translated: What is it like?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “who are truly liberated from the bonds” and so forth.

original: gang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'ching ba las yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par bstsal zhing grol bar gyur pa /
analyzed: gang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'ching ba las yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par bstsal zhing grol bar gyur pa /
translated: The one who is completely and unmistakenly liberated from the bonds of cyclic existence, which are characterized by the afflictions of desire, anger, pride, ignorance, and so forth, as well as the bonds of the obscurations to omniscience,

original: snying rje'i mchog ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i mchog ste /
translated: is the supreme one endowed with compassion.

original: snying rje chen po'i shugs kyis bskrun cing bstabs pa'i dpal sems can thams cad la chos ston pa'i bdag nyid can gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs shing ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu la bzhugs🔽pa'i dge 'dun la bdag skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i shugs kyis bskrun cing bstabs pa'i dpal sems can thams cad la chos ston pa'i bdag nyid can gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs shing ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i dge 'dun la bdag skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: The one who, through the force of great compassion, has perfected the ten perfections and accumulated the collection of wisdom, and who teaches the Dharma to all sentient beings, the one who is the very embodiment of the glorious [Buddha], who resides on the ten grounds such as the Joyous,🔽I go for refuge to the Sangha.

original: nyan thos rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: [I go for refuge] to the Sangha, but not to the Shravakas.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gsungs pa ni /🔽bsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gsungs pa ni /🔽bsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: [The text] states the generation of the mind of enlightenment:🔽With the thought I will liberate those who are not liberated,

original: bsam dang rnam par smin pa dag gyur pa //
analyzed: bsam dang rnam par smin pa dag gyur pa //
translated: And the resolve and the full maturation are purified.🔽This is the generation of the resolve for perfect enlightenment, which has the characteristic of the fulfillment of ones own goal and the fulfillment of the goals of others.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid can yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yid yang dag par bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ste /🔽thog ma tha ma med zhi ba //🔽dngos dang dngos med mi zad gtso //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid can yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yid yang dag par bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ste / thog ma tha ma med zhi ba // dngos dang dngos med mi zad gtso //
translated: It is said to be the enlightenment resolve,🔽which is the nondual union of emptiness and compassion,🔽the supreme imperishable reality,

original: stong dang snying rje mi phyed pa //🔽byang chub sems zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: stong dang snying rje mi phyed pa // byang chub sems zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: peaceful, without beginning or end.

original: ces bya'o // ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: lhag par mos pas rnam par brgyan pa yi //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhag par mos pas rnam par brgyan pa yi // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is adorned with the ornament of superior aspiration.

original: 'dis lhag par grol bas na lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis lhag par grol bas na lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: It is superior aspiration because it is superior to the other two.

original: sems kyi 'dod pa'i de nyid ni rgyan de des rnam par brgyan cing spud pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod pa'i de nyid ni rgyan de des rnam par brgyan cing spud pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with that ornament, that is, it is embellished by the reality of the mind's desire.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: bsam pa dang rnam par smin pa dag par gyur pa ste /🔽bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni smon pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang rnam par smin pa dag par gyur pa ste / bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni smon pa'i sems so //
translated: The resolve and the full maturation are purified.🔽The pure resolve is the aspirational resolve.

original: rnam par smin pa dag pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dag pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The pure full maturation is the engaged resolve.

original: de la gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa ni smon pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa ni smon pa'i sems so //
translated: The aspiration thought is the desire for perfect enlightenment for the sake of others.

original: gang nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang nas brtsams te /
translated: From what point does one have the aspiration thought?

original: sdom pa blang ba sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la @145b sogs pa'i tshogs bsags pa la rjes su 'jug pa de ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sdom pa blang ba sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la @145b sogs pa'i tshogs bsags pa la rjes su 'jug pa de ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The engagement thought is the engagement in the collection of merit, such as generosity, preceded by the taking of the vow.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa dang rnam par smin pa dag pa rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa dang rnam par smin pa dag pa rgyur gyur pa /
translated: Such an aspiration and the cause of its pure maturation🔽are obscured by all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa kun gyis zhes bya ba 'dis dge ba'i chos thams cad la bsgribs pa pa na sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyis zhes bya ba 'dis dge ba'i chos thams cad la bsgribs pa pa na sgrib pa ste /
translated: Here, obscuration is the obscuration of all virtuous dharmas.

original: sgrib ba ni bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib ba ni bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: It is an obscuration because it obscures.

original: de yang kun te 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang kun te 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa ste /
translated: It is all, that is, the nine afflictions: attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, holding a view to be paramount, holding morality and asceticism to be paramount, doubt, sleep, and lethargy.

original: nyon mongs pa dgus sgrib par byed pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgus sgrib par byed pas na /
translated: It obscures because it obscures with the nine afflictions.

original: thams cad kyang sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are called obscurations.

original: de rnams kyi bag chags ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bag chags ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Their latent impressions are improper mental activity.🔽The mind that precedes them is the one that engages in them.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis 'jug pa de yang dag par 'byin cing yang dag par gcod par byed la /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis 'jug pa de yang dag par 'byin cing yang dag par gcod par byed la /
translated: It is the one that gives rise to them and cuts them off.

original: yang dag par 'joms pa'i ngang tshul can ni yang dag 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'joms pa'i ngang tshul can ni yang dag 'byin pa'o //
translated: It is the one that has the nature of completely destroying them.

original: lam la gnas pas bsgoms pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lam la gnas pas bsgoms pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The cultivation that is based on the path is stated

original: bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: with “the path of the Sugatas,” and so forth.

original: da ni byang chub kyi chos la gnas shing brten par bgyi'o //
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi chos la gnas shing brten par bgyi'o //
translated: Now, one should abide in and rely on the dharmas of enlightenment.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The sons of the Sugatas are the bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi lam gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lam gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the sole path of the bodhisattvas, the one that is not a second.🔽In that case, why is the division of the path presented?

original: de ltar na ci'i phyir lam gyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag par mdzad ce na de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ci'i phyir lam gyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag par mdzad ce na de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That is stated

original: chos dbyings dbye ba ma mchis pas //
analyzed: chos dbyings dbye ba ma mchis pas //
translated: with “Since the dharmadhatu is undifferentiated,” and so forth.

original: gtso bo theg dbye yod ma yin //
analyzed: gtso bo theg dbye yod ma yin //
translated: The principal one is not a division of vehicles.

original: sems can rnams ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of engaging sentient beings,

original: khyed kyi theg pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed kyi theg pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: you taught three vehicles.

original: zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du sbyin sogs rnam bcu dkar po'i yon tan tshul zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang /🔽ye shes zhes bya ba gang dkar po'i yon tan gyi tshul te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin sogs rnam bcu dkar po'i yon tan tshul zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang / ye shes zhes bya ba gang dkar po'i yon tan gyi tshul te /
translated: Similarly, the “way of the ten white virtues” beginning with generosity is generosity, ethics, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, power, aspiration, method,🔽and knowledge.

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa rdzogs sangs rgyas //🔽zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid can yin zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa rdzogs sangs rgyas // zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid can yin zhing /
translated: The “way of the white virtues” is the nature of the perfect Buddha.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dngos po'i don ma lus pa'i rnam par dag pa don @146a * //🔽dam pa'i tshul can gang yin pa des //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dngos po'i don ma lus pa'i rnam par dag pa don @146a * //🔽dam pa'i tshul can gang yin pa des //
translated: The nature of the perfect Buddha is the nature of the dharmadhātu, suchness, the complete purity of all things,🔽the way of the ultimate.

original: da ni zhes bya ba skad cig mas 'di nas brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba skad cig mas 'di nas brtsams te /
translated: Now, from this moment on,

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du gnas par bgyi'o zhes so //🔽de ltar dag pa'i tshul la gnas nas bsgom pa'i snod du gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du gnas par bgyi'o zhes so // de ltar dag pa'i tshul la gnas nas bsgom pa'i snod du gyur te /
translated: I will abide until the essence of enlightenment is reached.

original: de yang / tshul gnas thos dang bsam par ldan //🔽bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyar //
analyzed: de yang / tshul gnas thos dang bsam par ldan // bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyar //
translated: Thus, having abided in the way of purity, one becomes a vessel for meditation.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is explained as:🔽Abiding in the way, endowed with hearing and reflection,🔽one is well-applied to meditation.

original: da ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi bsgom pa gsungs pa ni /🔽snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi bsgom pa gsungs pa ni / snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Now, the meditation of the nature of wisdom and method is stated:

original: snying rje chen pos gdungs pa'i yid kyis 'gro ba'i 'jig rten 'di ma lus par lta ba'i dra bas kun nas bcings shing bsdams par dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos gdungs pa'i yid kyis 'gro ba'i 'jig rten 'di ma lus par lta ba'i dra bas kun nas bcings shing bsdams par dmigs par bya ste /
translated: With a mind tormented by great compassion, one should observe this entire world of migrating beings, completely bound and fettered by the net of views.

original: de la lta ba nyid ni 'ching bar byed pas dra ba ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba nyid ni 'ching bar byed pas dra ba ste /
translated: There, the net is the fetter, since the view itself binds.

original: ji ltar dra bas bsdams pa'i bya rnams ni shugs kyis nam mkha' la 'gro bar nus su zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar dra bas bsdams pa'i bya rnams ni shugs kyis nam mkha' la 'gro bar nus su zin kyang /
translated: Just as birds bound by a net are able to fly through the sky with force,

original: lus las su mi rung zhing bems po lta bur gnas par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: lus las su mi rung zhing bems po lta bur gnas par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The body becomes unfit and remains as if it were dead.

original: / de bzhin du sems can 'di dag lta ba gsum gyis bcings pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: / de bzhin du sems can 'di dag lta ba gsum gyis bcings pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, these sentient beings are unfit to attain nirvāṇa because they are bound by the three views.

original: lta ba gsum ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / bdag tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba gsum ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / bdag tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: The three views are the view of the transitory collection, the view of holding a view as paramount, and wrong views.

original: de ltar phas bu la bya ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa snying rje chen pos gdon pa'i phyir dmigs la /
analyzed: de ltar phas bu la bya ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa snying rje chen pos gdon pa'i phyir dmigs la /
translated: Thus, like a father for his son, one should focus on the realm of sentient beings without exception in order to rescue them with great compassion.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems mnyam pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems mnyam pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
