translated: One should cultivate the incomparable thought of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The so-called incomparable is the essence of great compassion.

original: de ltar bya zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis te /
analyzed: de ltar bya zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis te /
translated: The phrase “in this way” refers to this aspect.

original: kye ma gti mug gi mun pa gang gis sems can 'di dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang bdag nyid kyis rtogs par ma gyur na /
analyzed: kye ma gti mug gi mun pa gang gis sems can 'di dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang bdag nyid kyis rtogs par ma gyur na /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings, although they are by nature in nirvāṇa, do not realize this by themselves because of the darkness of delusion.

original: ji ltar ni 'di dag khong du chud par bya zhes rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: ji ltar ni 'di dag khong du chud par bya zhes rnam par bsams la /
translated: How should I understand this?

original: de'i bdag nyid can nyid du 'gro ba thams cad dmigs na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis snying rje chen por skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can nyid du 'gro ba thams cad dmigs na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis snying rje chen por skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: When one observes all beings as having that nature, great compassion arises in the manner of non-apprehension.

original: bdag nyid kyang de lta bu'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang de lta bu'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: And one should consider oneself to have that very nature,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: the nature of all things.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems rnam par bsgoms nas sngags par 'gyur zhing ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems rnam par bsgoms nas sngags par 'gyur zhing ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Having thus contemplated the thought of awakening, one becomes a mantra practitioner and has the nature of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar @146b du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar @146b du'o //
translated: up to becoming endowed with the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dris pa sngags kyi tshul thams cad du shes rab dang thabs bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig dang ldan na /
analyzed: dris pa sngags kyi tshul thams cad du shes rab dang thabs bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig dang ldan na /
translated: When the question is endowed with the words one should cultivate wisdom and means in all mantra systems,

original: ji ltar na thabs bsgom pas shes rab bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan bcos rtsom pas 'brel pa med par byas la rtog pa dag gi lan ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na thabs bsgom pas shes rab bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan bcos rtsom pas 'brel pa med par byas la rtog pa dag gi lan ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One may say: But how can one cultivate insight by cultivating means? By composing the treatise, one has made it irrelevant. The answer to the thoughts of the doubters is to be seen in the Introduction to Reality.

original: de yang / dngos kun rang bzhin bdag med du //
analyzed: de yang / dngos kun rang bzhin bdag med du //
translated: And that is explained as follows: All entities are by nature devoid of self-existence.

original: rnal 'byor bdag nyid can gyur pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag nyid can gyur pa //
translated: The yogi himself,

original: bsgom pa'i rigs kyis phyin nas ni //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rigs kyis phyin nas ni //
translated: having arrived by the means of meditation,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i bdag can 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //🔽thabs bsgoms nas shes rab bsgom pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i bdag can 'gyur // zhes bshad pa yin no // thabs bsgoms nas shes rab bsgom pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: becomes the possessor of the great seal.

original: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The statement that insight is cultivated by cultivating means is as follows: By nature, etc.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
translated: Thus, entities are empty by nature,

original: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin can no //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin can no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: they are of the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is that? Because of the absence of nature.

original: don dam par dngos po thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, all entities are devoid of the nature of one and many.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of non-entity.

original: de yang yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: de yang yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: Moreover, the Perfection of Wisdom Mother says:

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong par byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong par byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Subhuti, all phenomena are not emptied by emptiness,🔽but rather phenomena themselves are empty.

original: gzhan du na chos rnams nyid stong pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan du na chos rnams nyid stong pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: ji ltar me long dag la gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar me long dag la gzugs //
translated: Just as a reflection in a clear mirror

original: gcig dang du ma rnam bral bar //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma rnam bral bar //
translated: Is free from being one or many,

original: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
translated: Though it appears, it does not exist there.

original: de bzhin dngos po dngos nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po dngos nyid do // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: So it is with things and their nature.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams ni mtshan ma nye bar gzung ba med pas mtshan ma med pa yin pas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams ni mtshan ma nye bar gzung ba med pas mtshan ma med pa yin pas te /
translated: Thus phenomena are signless because they are free from the signs of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang bral bas zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu med pas don dam par mtshan ma dang bral ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang bral bas zhes bya ba smos te / gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu med pas don dam par mtshan ma dang bral ba yin gyi /
translated: It says “because they are free from causes.”

original: kun rdzob tu ni ma yin to /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ma yin to /
translated: Since they are not caused by other things, such as an almighty creator, ultimately they are free from signs, but not conventionally.

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par ni //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par ni //
translated: It is not always existent or nonexistent,

original: rgyu gzhan la ni ltos pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ni ltos pa yin //
translated: but depends on other causes.

original: zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,🔽Like a dream, like an illusion,

original: rmi lam sgyu ma ji bzhin dang // dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: rmi lam sgyu ma ji bzhin dang // dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: like a city of gandharvas,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: so is arising, so is enduring,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jig par gsungs //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jig par gsungs // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: and so is ceasing taught.

original: kun rdzob tu ni dngos po rnams rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dngos po rnams rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: Conventionally, things arise from the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo yis rnam par brtags na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par brtags na ni //
translated: When examined by the mind,

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //🔽de bas de ni brjod med @147a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med // de bas de ni brjod med @147a * //
translated: its essence is not apprehended.🔽Therefore, it is taught to be inexpressible

original: dang ; / dngos po med par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dang ; / dngos po med par bstan pa yin //
translated: and nonexistent.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu rgyu med par brtags na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu rgyu med par brtags na /
translated: If one imagines that conventionally there are no causes,

original: de'i tshe nyes pa 'di yod par bstan gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa 'di yod par bstan gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: then this fault is demonstrated, but not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du dngos po rnams ma lus par smon pa las nges par grol zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rnams ma lus par smon pa las nges par grol zhing /
translated: In the same way, all things are completely liberated from desire

original: de dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang bral ba yin te /
translated: and are free from that.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir smon lam dang / smon par bya ba dang / smon pa po dang bral ba yin yang bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis snang ba'i dngos po rnams ni sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir smon lam dang / smon par bya ba dang / smon pa po dang bral ba yin yang bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis snang ba'i dngos po rnams ni sgyu ma dang /
translated: Because they are empty of intrinsic reality, they are free from aspirations, the object of aspiration, and the one who aspires.

original: smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam lta bu ste yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam lta bu ste yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: However, due to the power of the latent tendencies of the defiled mind that conceives of “I” and “mine,” things appear as if they exist, but they are like illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and dreams.🔽They do not exist.

original: de bas na gsol bar bya ba dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba po'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa yin pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gsol bar bya ba dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba po'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa yin pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of the one who makes the request, the request, and the request itself are empty, they are wishless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog pa rnams dang bral phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtog pa rnams dang bral phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “because they are free from conceptual thoughts.”

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are free from conceptual thoughts,

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ci yang nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ci yang nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: no things whatsoever, whether moving or unmoving, can be observed.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis yod par rtog ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis yod par rtog ste /
translated: However, due to the power of beginningless latent propensities of ignorance, it is conceived to exist.🔽Moreover, it is as stated:

original: de yang / gang gis skye ba 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: de yang / gang gis skye ba 'byung ba ni //
translated: The arising of birth

original: dngos po gang la'ang rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po gang la'ang rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: is not found in any entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo la //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo la //
translated: In the nature of non-entity,

original: byis pa rnams ni 'byung bar 'dod //🔽ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni 'byung bar 'dod // ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: the childish conceive of arising.

original: 'di ni gnas gyur pa'i rnal 'byor te /🔽nang gi bdag nyid stong par mthong //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas gyur pa'i rnal 'byor te / nang gi bdag nyid stong par mthong //
translated: This is the yoga of transformation.🔽Seeing the inner nature as empty,

original: phyi rol gtogs pa'ang stong bar mthong //
analyzed: phyi rol gtogs pa'ang stong bar mthong //
translated: seeing the external as empty,

original: de la ci yang mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: de la ci yang mi dmigs pa //
translated: nothing is observed there.

original: bsgom pa gang yin stong pa nyid //
analyzed: bsgom pa gang yin stong pa nyid //
translated: That meditation is emptiness.

original: ces bya ba'i bsgom pa 'dis //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bsgom pa 'dis //
translated: By this meditation,

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa mi snang bar byas nas /🔽dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa mi snang bar byas nas / dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas /
translated: attachment to external objects is made to disappear.🔽The yoga of the pure intermediate state,

original: srid pa bar ma'i rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa ni /
translated: as taught in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra,

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: is stated by Om and so forth.

original: aom zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Om is the ascertainment.

original: sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: Shunyata is the indication of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag rnal 'byor bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag rnal 'byor bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: These three doors of liberation should be cultivated by the yogi in sequence.

original: de yang sngags aom gyi gzugs ni dkar po //
analyzed: de yang sngags aom gyi gzugs ni dkar po //
translated: Moreover, the form of the mantra Om is white,

original: a'a:'i gzugs ni dmar po /
analyzed: a'a:'i gzugs ni dmar po /
translated: the form of Ah is red,

original: @147b h'um gi gzugs ni nag po'o //
analyzed: @147b h'um gi gzugs ni nag po'o //
translated: and the form of Hum is black.

original: badzra zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /🔽rdo rje ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi ri bo rnam par 'jig pa'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i sa bon /
analyzed: badzra zhes ci'i phyir smos she na / rdo rje ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi ri bo rnam par 'jig pa'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i sa bon /
translated: Why is vajra mentioned?

original: dzny'a na sva bh'a ba ste ;
analyzed: dzny'a na sva bh'a ba ste ;
translated: The seed of the vajra body, speech, and mind, which has the nature of the three doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, which destroys the mountain of afflictions like a vajra,🔽is the essence of wisdom.

original: bdag ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo nyid du gdong ma nyid nas gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo nyid du gdong ma nyid nas gyur pa yin no //
translated: I am by nature the essence of gnosis.

original: 'di dag gis ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du ston to //
translated: These [verses] show that the mind is naturally luminous.

original: ci'i phyir 'dis skad cig ma nyid kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam pa yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dis skad cig ma nyid kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam pa yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Why, having taken on the form of Vajrasattva and so forth by means of momentariness,

original: sems can gyi don mi byed par yi ge lnga'i gzugs su gnas par byed ce na //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mi byed par yi ge lnga'i gzugs su gnas par byed ce na //
translated: does it not perform the welfare of sentient beings, but rather remains in the form of the five syllables?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: 'khor ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Samsara has the nature of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de'i gnyen por lhag par mos pas slob dpon gyis sgrub pa'i thabs 'di bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por lhag par mos pas slob dpon gyis sgrub pa'i thabs 'di bstan pa yin la /
translated: The master, with superior aspiration, has taught this method of practice as its antidote.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa gsum du gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has taught three existences:

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: the existence of death, the intermediate existence, and the existence of birth.

original: de la 'chi ba'i srid pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba'i srid pa ni /
translated: Among them, the existence of death🔽is the continuum of the aggregates at the time of death.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of the complete transformation of the basis is the yoga of the bodhisattva.

original: srid pa bar ma ni yi ge lnga po'i sngags kyi rnam par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni yi ge lnga po'i sngags kyi rnam par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The intermediate existence is the meditation on the form of the five seed syllables.

original: slar skye ba'i srid pa ni 'dzam pa'i rdo rje yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: slar skye ba'i srid pa ni 'dzam pa'i rdo rje yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The existence of rebirth is the complete transformation into Vairocana.

original: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called intermediate existence?

original: 'di ni 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du gang zhig 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du gang zhig 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is that which occurs between death and birth.

original: 'chi ba'i srid ba dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du bdag nyid kyi dngos po mngon par byung bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bshad la //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid ba dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du bdag nyid kyi dngos po mngon par byung bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bshad la //
translated: The existence that occurs between the death existence and the birth existence is called the intermediate existence.

original: de yang sems kyi ngo bo zla ba lta bu'i gzugs can dbang po thams cad kun du rdzogs pa /
analyzed: de yang sems kyi ngo bo zla ba lta bu'i gzugs can dbang po thams cad kun du rdzogs pa /
translated: It is the form of the moon of the nature of mind, complete with all the faculties.

original: dbang po lnga rigs mthun pas mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga rigs mthun pas mthong ba ste /
translated: It is seen by the five faculties of the same type.

original: aom a'a: h'um dang / yi ge ho: seng bo 'od 'phro ba gnyis kyi bar du chud pa /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um dang / yi ge ho: seng bo 'od 'phro ba gnyis kyi bar du chud pa /
translated: It is the syllable Om, the syllable Ah, and the syllable Hum, with the syllable Hoh in the middle, between two shining lions.

original: ji srid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros kyi bar du 'dug pa yin la /
analyzed: ji srid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros kyi bar du 'dug pa yin la /
translated: As long as the wheel of the mandala of glorious Vajrasattva is emanated, it abides.

original: 'di ni ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste /🔽ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste / ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: This is the complete purity of ignorance,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained that ignorance is the affliction of the prior state.

original: thams cad du nyes pa dang bral ba nyid dang / yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang // 'dod pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa zhes bshad @148a * //
analyzed: thams cad du nyes pa dang bral ba nyid dang / yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang // 'dod pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa zhes bshad @148a * //
translated: It is explained that complete purity is the freedom from all faults, the nature of all good qualities, and the nature of desire.

original: do ; / dang po'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni de 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: do ; / dang po'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni de 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The statement from the perspective of the initial application is the statement beginning with “after that. ”

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rjes thogs la chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa'i bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas kyi rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rjes thogs la chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa'i bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas kyi rgyu yin zhing /
translated: The activity of meditating on the seal of the source of phenomena after the state of complete transformation is the cause of the place of birth,

original: 'khor ba'i chos ma lus pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos ma lus pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: and it is the nature of giving rise to all the phenomena of cyclic existence.

original: gang du sgom zhe na /🔽h'um gis rdo rje byas pa'i sar //
analyzed: gang du sgom zhe na / h'um gis rdo rje byas pa'i sar //
translated: Where is it meditated?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The statement “in the place made of vajra by hūṃ” is stated.

original: yi ge h'um rdo rje ltar shin tu brtan par byas pa'i sa gang yin pa der ro //
analyzed: yi ge h'um rdo rje ltar shin tu brtan par byas pa'i sa gang yin pa der ro //
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?

original: de gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: de gang las byung zhe na /
translated: It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?

original: kun du bzang po las byung bar //
analyzed: kun du bzang po las byung bar //
translated: It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.

original: rang gi mtshan ma las yang dag par byung ba'i kun du bzang po yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan ma las yang dag par byung ba'i kun du bzang po yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?

original: bsam pa ni zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su de la dmigs pa'i sems bsgoms pas brtan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa ni zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su de la dmigs pa'i sems bsgoms pas brtan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.

original: kun du bzang po ni sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag dpal bde ba chen po dang 'dra ba sna tshogs rdo rje de yang sna tshogs padma rgyas pa'i steng na gnas pa'i h'um las byung bar bsam mo //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag dpal bde ba chen po dang 'dra ba sna tshogs rdo rje de yang sna tshogs padma rgyas pa'i steng na gnas pa'i h'um las byung bar bsam mo //
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?

original: chos 'byung ba de ji lta bur bsam zhe na /
analyzed: chos 'byung ba de ji lta bur bsam zhe na /
translated: It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.

original: ston ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ston ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it.🔽From what does it arise?🔽It arises from Samantabhadra.🔽The syllable HŪṀ is the vajra, and the earth is made firm by it

original: ston ka'i yar gyi zla ba ltar rab tu dkar zhes shin tu dang ba'i rang bzhin can mtha' yas pa'i phyogs na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ston ka'i yar gyi zla ba ltar rab tu dkar zhes shin tu dang ba'i rang bzhin can mtha' yas pa'i phyogs na gnas pa ste /
translated: It is very white, like the waxing autumn moon, and it is infinite in extent.

original: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par khyab pa nag po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i mdog can gyi 'od sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par khyab pa nag po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i mdog can gyi 'od sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with various lights, blue, yellow, red, white, and crimson, and it pervades the entire realm of space.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi mdog ni dkar ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi mdog ni dkar ba nyid yin no //

original: de yang / zur bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: de yang / zur bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //

original: rta babs bzhis ni rnam par mdzes //

analyzed: bhr'um las 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'am //

original: bcu gnyis pa ser po /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ser po /

analyzed: de'i yan lag yongs su gyur pa las khag pa brtsegs mar rnam par bsam par bya'o //

original: gzhal yas khang yongs su bskyed pa bshad nas /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang yongs su bskyed pa bshad nas /

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo mdzes par bstan pas ;
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo mdzes par bstan pas ;

translated: The purity preceded by the nature of cause and effect is stated by “uneven” and so forth.🔽The four corners

original: grva bzhi po de mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: grva bzhi po de mnyam pa'o //
translated: of that are even.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rgyu ni mi mnyam pa dag med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni mi mnyam pa dag med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Because the cause is the absence of inequality.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su //
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su //
translated: In the past, when he was a bodhisattva,

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i thugs kyis 'gro ba kun la dmigs par mdzad pa de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni zur bzhi pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i thugs kyis 'gro ba kun la dmigs par mdzad pa de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni zur bzhi pa nyid do //
translated: he focused on all beings with a loving mind. The result that is in harmony with that cause is the four corners.

original: 'dir yang mi mnyam pa med pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi mnyam pa med pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Here, the absence of inequality is the cause,

original: zur bzhi pa nyid ni 'bras bu'o //🔽dran dang dbang po mchog @149a * //
analyzed: zur bzhi pa nyid ni 'bras bu'o // dran dang dbang po mchog @149a * //
translated: and the four corners is the result.

original: bzhi sgo rnams yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bzhi sgo rnams yin // zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The four doors are🔽the supreme mindfulness and faculties.

original: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sgo bzhi po de rnams ni dran pa dang / dbang po mchog rnams kyi phul du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sgo bzhi po de rnams ni dran pa dang / dbang po mchog rnams kyi phul du byung ba yin no //
translated: The four doors in the east, south, west, and north are the supreme mindfulness and faculties.

original: dran pa dan dbang po dang zhes thog ma dang tha ma smros pas /
analyzed: dran pa dan dbang po dang zhes thog ma dang tha ma smros pas /
translated: Since the beginning and end are mentioned with “mindfulness and faculties,”

original: dran po nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: dran po nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga rnams la bya ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, and the five faculties.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness, etc., are the causes.

original: sgo bzhi ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sgo bzhi ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The four doors are the results.

original: de la 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: Herein, the foundation of mindfulness of the body is as follows:

original: rigs kyi bu lus la 'di ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu lus la 'di ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog ste /
translated: Son of good family, you should establish mindfulness in this way with regard to the body:

original: lus 'di ni bdag po med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni bdag po med pa'o //
translated: This body is without an owner.

original: lus zhes bya ba dang / phung po zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad du brjod pa nad brgya stong gi tshang /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba dang / phung po zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad du brjod pa nad brgya stong gi tshang /
translated: What is called a body and what is called a collection is conventionally expressed by the adventitious convention of a hundred thousand diseases,

original: skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dan /
analyzed: skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dan /
translated: hair, body hair, nails,

original: so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / tshil dang / rkang dang / bshad pa dang / gci ba la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs pa la 'dir lus gang zhig yin /
analyzed: so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / tshil dang / rkang dang / bshad pa dang / gci ba la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs pa la 'dir lus gang zhig yin /
translated: teeth, bones, skin, fat, sinews, excrement, urine, and so on. Here, what is a body?

original: des na lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, this body is equal to space. This is called the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di ltar tsher ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di ltar tsher ba skyed par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas generate the following understanding:🔽“The nature of the impermanent is that of the impermanent; the nature of suffering is that of suffering; the nature of the selfless is that of the selfless; the nature of the impure is that of the impure.”

original: mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can dang / sdug bsngal ba la sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang ba'o zhes tshor ba po nye bar ma mthong la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can dang / sdug bsngal ba la sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba la mi gtsang ba'o zhes tshor ba po nye bar ma mthong la /
translated: They do not see a feeler,

original: de ma mthong bas tshor byang nye bar ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de ma mthong bas tshor byang nye bar ma mthong ste /
translated: and not seeing that, they do not see anything to be felt.

original: nang na ma yin phyi rol na ma yin //
analyzed: nang na ma yin phyi rol na ma yin //
translated: It is not within, nor is it without.

original: gnyi ga'i bar na nye bar mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bar na nye bar mi dmigs pa /
translated: It is not perceived between the two.

original: 'di ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the application of mindfulness to feeling.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi bu sems la 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi bu sems la 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su lta ste /
translated: “Noble son, the bodhisattvas also correctly observe the mind in the following way:

original: sems zhes bya ba ni ming tsam gzugs med ba ltar med /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni ming tsam gzugs med ba ltar med /
translated: The so-called mind is merely a name. It is not real, like a form.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: It is naturally luminous.

original: glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis ma rung bar byas pa dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam lta bu'o zhes sems la dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
analyzed: glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis ma rung bar byas pa dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam lta bu'o zhes sems la dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
translated: He establishes mindfulness in his mind that all phenomena are like a city of gandharvas, like an illusion, like a mirage, like a reflection of the moon in water, like a dream.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi bu chos thams cad la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni phra rab tsam gyi chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi bu chos thams cad la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni phra rab tsam gyi chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: “Noble son, when one observes phenomena in this way, one does not see even the slightest phenomenon.

original: de la chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is a phenomenon?

original: @149b bdag med pa'i don dang / 'byung ba med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / chad pa med pa'i don dang / rtag pa med pa'i don dang / chos thams cad stong pa'i bar du mthong ba 'di ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: @149b bdag med pa'i don dang / 'byung ba med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / chad pa med pa'i don dang / rtag pa med pa'i don dang / chos thams cad stong pa'i bar du mthong ba 'di ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is the meaning of selflessness, the meaning of non-arising, the meaning of non-sentience, the meaning of non-life, the meaning of non-severance, the meaning of non-permanence, up to the meaning of the emptiness of all phenomena. This is the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the four right efforts?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom la /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom la /
translated: and fully engages his mind in order to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous qualities that have not yet arisen.🔽He generates enthusiasm, exerts effort,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa dang / sdig pa skyes pa rnams 'jig pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dun pa skyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom la sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa dang / sdig pa skyes pa rnams 'jig pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dun pa skyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom la sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: and fully engages his mind in order to destroy the nonvirtuous qualities that have arisen, in order to maintain the virtuous qualities that have arisen, in order to increase the virtuous qualities that have arisen, and in order to give rise to the virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the four bases of supernatural powers?

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: They are the bases of supernatural power that are attained through enthusiasm, effort, intention, and investigation.

original: de la 'dun pa ni gang chos 'di rnams mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni gang chos 'di rnams mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: “Here, enthusiasm is the desire to actualize these qualities.

original: brtson 'grus ni gang chos 'di rnams rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gang chos 'di rnams rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Effort is the completion of these qualities.

original: sems ni gang chos 'di rnams la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni gang chos 'di rnams la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Intention is the discernment of these qualities.

original: dpyod pa ni gang chos 'di rnams la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni gang chos 'di rnams la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Investigation is that which is skilled in these dharmas.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa la gnas pas rdzogs par byed pas /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sogs pa la gnas pas rdzogs par byed pas /
translated: It is perfected by abiding in the bases of supernatural power, etc.

original: des na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the base of supernatural power.

original: de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faculties?

original: lha'i bu gang chos thams cad ma skyes par dad par byed pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis don 'pho ba med par shes pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu gang chos thams cad ma skyes par dad par byed pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis don 'pho ba med par shes pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Divine son, the faculty of faith is the faith that all dharmas are unborn and the understanding that, because they are unborn, their meaning is naturally without transition.

original: gang thag ring ba dang nye ba'i 'du shes dang bral bas chos thams cad la sems gtong bar mi byed pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang thag ring ba dang nye ba'i 'du shes dang bral bas chos thams cad la sems gtong bar mi byed pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of diligence is the mind that does not let go of any dharma because it is free from the notions of far and near.

original: gang chos thams cad yid la mi byed cing dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar mi 'jog pa 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad yid la mi byed cing dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar mi 'jog pa 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the mindfulness that does not focus on any dharma and does not attend to any reference point.

original: gang chos thams cad nye bar mi sogs shing /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad nye bar mi sogs shing /
translated: The faculty of concentration is the concentration that does not engage with any dharma.

original: chos thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration is the non-apprehension of all dharmas.

original: gang chos thams cad bskyed pa dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad bskyed pa dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ba 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //

translated: The result of that concentration, which was previously cultivated in the bodhisattva stage, such as the Heroic, the Sky Treasury, the Stainless, the Lion Play, and so on, is the rims. This is the meaning.

original: kha khyer der legs brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: kha khyer der legs brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: Well-established on that rim, and so on.

original: kha khyer der zhes bya ba ni kha khyer bzhi po de rnams su legs par brten zhing gnas pa'i mchod pa dam pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi tshogs gang yin pa'i gzungs ni don dang / gzhung dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / thams cad de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /

analyzed: de dag nyid ni mchod pa 'dzin par dkyil 'khor du bsam par bya ste /

analyzed: glu dang / rol mo dang / gar dang / bstod pa smra ba la sogs pa dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos la sogs pa la longs spyod pa'i khyad par thams cad 'dzin cing /

analyzed: sgeg pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rnam pa dang bcas shing /

analyzed: 'dul ba smos pas chos mngon pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is also included by the mention of the Vinaya,

original: mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / de lta bu byung ba dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab yin la /

translated: because the scriptures of the Bhagavat are called the sutra, geya, vyakarana, gathd, udana, itukavrttika, jataka, vaipulya, and adbhutadharma.

original: de las mdo tsam du ston pas mdo'i sde ste /
analyzed: de las mdo tsam du ston pas mdo'i sde ste /
translated: The sutra is that which teaches in brief.

original: gsung rab ma lus par mdor ston pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab ma lus par mdor ston pa'o //
translated: It teaches in brief the entire scripture.

original: yang na skal ba ji lta bar skyes bu'i don ston pas na mdo'i sde'o //
analyzed: yang na skal ba ji lta bar skyes bu'i don ston pas na mdo'i sde'o //
translated: Or, it is the sutra because it teaches the meaning of the person according to his fortune.

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The geya is that which is endowed with the sixty branches of melodious speech.

original: bstod pa smra ba dang / chos ston pa la sogs par 'dis lung ston pas na /
analyzed: bstod pa smra ba dang / chos ston pa la sogs par 'dis lung ston pas na /
translated: The vyakarana is that which teaches through the prediction of the future, such as the prediction of the future Buddhahood of Katyayana and of Shariputra.

original: lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: lung ston pa ste /
translated: The gathd is that which is composed in metrical feet.

original: las kyi khyad par gzigs pas ma 'ongs pa'i cha nye bar ston par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: las kyi khyad par gzigs pas ma 'ongs pa'i cha nye bar ston par mdzad pas so //
translated: He shows the future by seeing the particularities of karma.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni tshigs su bcad par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni tshigs su bcad par sbyar ro //
translated: The verse is connected with the verse.

original: ched du brjod pa ni sngon ma byung ba'i yang dag pa'i don bzang po thob pas yongs su mgu ste /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa ni sngon ma byung ba'i yang dag pa'i don bzang po thob pas yongs su mgu ste /
translated: The expression of joy is the expression of complete satisfaction in obtaining the excellent, true meaning that has not been obtained before.

original: ae ma ho sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar smra zhing legs so zhes bya ba ston to //🔽de lta bu byung ba ni sangs rgyas nas 'das pa'i skye ba gzhan dag ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma ho sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar smra zhing legs so zhes bya ba ston to // de lta bu byung ba ni sangs rgyas nas 'das pa'i skye ba gzhan dag ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of Excellent! with the expression Oh! The Buddha! and so forth.🔽The Thus have I heard shows the other lives of the Buddha after his enlightenment.

original: skyes pa'i rabs ni sangs rgyas kyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i sku tshe blangs pa ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs ni sangs rgyas kyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i sku tshe blangs pa ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Jataka Tales show the lives of the Buddha in the past and so forth.

original: shin tu rgyas pa ni dngos po gcig dbye ba tshad med pas nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa ni dngos po gcig dbye ba tshad med pas nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Vaipulya shows the presentation of one thing with immeasurable divisions.

original: rmad du byung ba ni las chung du la yang las kyi rnam par smin pa tshad med pa nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni las chung du la yang las kyi rnam par smin pa tshad med pa nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Adbhutadharma shows the immeasurable ripening of karma even from a small karma.

original: de lta bu @151b ni dam pa rnams kyi chos yin pas na dam pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de lta bu @151b ni dam pa rnams kyi chos yin pas na dam pa'i chos te /
translated: Since such is the Dharma of the holy, it is the holy Dharma.

original: mkhas pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be known by the wise.

original: dam pa'i chos de ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos de ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That holy Dharma is called all-pervading,

original: tshul gsum la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum la khyab pa'o //
translated: pervading the three modes.

original: de yang gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la yan lag dgu dang 'dres pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi gsung rab ston par mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la yan lag dgu dang 'dres pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi gsung rab ston par mdzad pa yin la /
translated: And it is because he teaches the scriptures of the holy Dharma, which is mixed with the nine limbs, to all sentient beings.

original: rgyu des na rlung gis bskyod pa zhes bya ba rlung gis bskyod cing g-yo bar byas pa'i ba dan gyi mtshan ma'i phreng ba dang / de'i dril bu ste g-yer kha de las byung ba'i sgra sgrogs shing /
analyzed: rgyu des na rlung gis bskyod pa zhes bya ba rlung gis bskyod cing g-yo bar byas pa'i ba dan gyi mtshan ma'i phreng ba dang / de'i dril bu ste g-yer kha de las byung ba'i sgra sgrogs shing /
translated: For that reason, it is called “moved by the wind,” a garland of banners moved and shaken by the wind, and the sound that arises from its bells,

original: sgra grag pa dang ldan pa'i gzhal yas khang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sgra grag pa dang ldan pa'i gzhal yas khang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “a celestial mansion endowed with the sound of resounding sounds.”

original: me long zhes bya ba la sogs pa la me long nyid ni me long yin te /
analyzed: me long zhes bya ba la sogs pa la me long nyid ni me long yin te /
translated: With regard to “mirror” and so on, a mirror itself is a mirror.

original: ma rig pa kun du sbyong bar byed cing chos thams cad mngon par rtogs pa ni ye shes so //🔽rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur pas dri mas gos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa kun du sbyong bar byed cing chos thams cad mngon par rtogs pa ni ye shes so // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur pas dri mas gos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Wisdom is the purification of ignorance and the realization of all dharmas.

original: rtag tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is always stainless because it is naturally radiant and not defiled by faults.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag nyid me tog yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag nyid me tog yin te /
translated: The branches of enlightenment are the flowers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom pa gang yin pa de nyid shin tu phul du byung ba'i dri dang ldan pa'i me tog rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom pa gang yin pa de nyid shin tu phul du byung ba'i dri dang ldan pa'i me tog rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cultivation of the seven branches of enlightenment in the bodhisattva stage is the flowers that have the most excellent fragrance.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni /
translated: The seven branches of enlightenment are:

original: dran pa gang gis chos thams cad rnam par dpyad nas chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dran pa gang gis chos thams cad rnam par dpyad nas chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The mindfulness by which one analyzes all dharmas and knows that all dharmas are empty of their own marks is the right mindfulness branch of enlightenment.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ye shes kyis de ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par spyod cing bkri ba'i don dang / nges pa'i don dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / brda dang /
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ye shes kyis de ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par spyod cing bkri ba'i don dang / nges pa'i don dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / brda dang /
translated: The joy, agility, concentration, and equanimity that are based on the thorough discernment of phenomena are the factors of awakening of joy, agility, concentration, and equanimity.🔽The mindfulness that is based on the thorough discernment of phenomena and that is not attached to joy, agility, concentration, and equanimity is the factor of awakening of mindfulness.

original: rnam par nges pa'i don 'di ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa'i don 'di ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The thorough discernment of phenomena that is based on the thorough discernment of phenomena is the factor of awakening of thorough discernment of phenomena.

original: dran pa gang la chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa 'di'i dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms kyi shes pas mngon par zhen pa 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa gang la chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa 'di'i dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms kyi shes pas mngon par zhen pa 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The effort that is based on the thorough discernment of phenomena and that is not attached to joy, agility, concentration, and equanimity is the factor of awakening of effort.

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i sems ma zhum zhing rab tu dang ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / gang gis nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub @152a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i sems ma zhum zhing rab tu dang ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / gang gis nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub @152a * //
translated: The mental factor of joy is the delight in the Dharma, the absence of mental lassitude, and the clarity of mind.

original: kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: It is the longing for the Dharma, and it is that which pacifies the afflictions. This is called the limb of enlightenment that is joy.

original: rab tu sbyangs pa'i sems gang gis nyon mongs pa 'jig cing sgrib pa dang bral la /
analyzed: rab tu sbyangs pa'i sems gang gis nyon mongs pa 'jig cing sgrib pa dang bral la /
translated: The mental factor of pliancy is that which destroys the afflictions and removes the obscurations.

original: zhi gnas la 'jug pa la dmigs pa'i sems su nye bar 'jog pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la 'jug pa la dmigs pa'i sems su nye bar 'jog pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: It is the mental factor that is focused on the attainment of śamatha. This is called the limb of enlightenment that is pliancy.

original: gang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos kyi ye shes mngon par sangs rgyas shing chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du lhag par mos pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos kyi ye shes mngon par sangs rgyas shing chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du lhag par mos pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The mental factor of samādhi is the wisdom of the Dharma that is attained through a mind that is in equipoise. It is the superior understanding of all phenomena as they are through their sameness. This is called the limb of enlightenment that is samādhi.

original: gang 'di yid bde bas chos gang la sems mngon par ma zhen cing 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phreng ba dang mi gnod pa 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di yid bde bas chos gang la sems mngon par ma zhen cing 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phreng ba dang mi gnod pa 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is the limb of enlightenment called equanimity.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams rgyur gyur ba'i yon tan gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu ni me tog phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams rgyur gyur ba'i yon tan gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu ni me tog phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: The qualities that are the causes of these limbs of enlightenment are their result, which is the perfection of flowers.

original: des dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa zhes bya ba mu tig gi chun 'phyang dbus na nor bus mdzes pa la ni dra ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: des dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa zhes bya ba mu tig gi chun 'phyang dbus na nor bus mdzes pa la ni dra ba zhes bya la /
translated: The net and half-net are pearl necklaces with beautiful jewels in the middle, called “net,”

original: dbus na brgyan pa med pa la ni dra ba phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbus na brgyan pa med pa la ni dra ba phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and without ornaments in the middle, called “half-net.”

original: me long ni me long nyid do //
analyzed: me long ni me long nyid do //
translated: The mirror is a mirror.

original: me tog gi phreng ba ni mand'a ra ba dang / autpala dang / ma li ka dang / dz'a ti dang / ba ku la la sogs pa las rgyan du byas pa ste /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba ni mand'a ra ba dang / autpala dang / ma li ka dang / dz'a ti dang / ba ku la la sogs pa las rgyan du byas pa ste /
translated: The garland is an ornament made of mandāravas, utpalas, mallikas, jātis, vakulas, and so on.

original: de sgo khyud dang / sgo 'gram gyi ngos dang 'brel par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de sgo khyud dang / sgo 'gram gyi ngos dang 'brel par gnas pa'o //
translated: It is related to the door and the sides of the door.

original: des sna tshogs pa'i ngo mtshar bskyed pa'o //🔽de nyid kyis na mnyam pa med pa ste /
analyzed: des sna tshogs pa'i ngo mtshar bskyed pa'o // de nyid kyis na mnyam pa med pa ste /
translated: It produces various marvels.🔽It is incomparable,

original: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: since it is not shared with others.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The eight liberations are as follows: The first liberation is to see forms while having the notion of form.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is to see external forms while having the notion of internal formlessness.

original: sdug pa nyid du mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa nyid du mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is to have the notion of beauty.

original: de gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o snyam nas gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o snyam nas gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth liberation is to transcend the notion of form and think, “Space is infinite,”

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa zhes bya ba'i nam mkha'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa zhes bya ba'i nam mkha'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: Transcending the notion of infinite space, thinking “consciousness is infinite,” is the fifth liberation.

original: rnam shes mtha' @152b yas skye ma ched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' @152b yas skye ma ched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: Transcending the base of infinite consciousness, thinking “there is nothing at all,” is the sixth liberation.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Transcending the base of nothing at all,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min ba sgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min ba sgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: thinking “this is neither discernment nor nondiscernment,” is the seventh liberation.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: Transcending the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, thinking “there is cessation of discernment and feeling,” is the eighth liberation.

original: 'di rnams ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: These are the liberations.

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i 'bras bu gzhal yas khang gi dbus na rnam par snang mdzad la logs pa'i gnas su /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i 'bras bu gzhal yas khang gi dbus na rnam par snang mdzad la logs pa'i gnas su /
translated: The ultimate nature is in the center of the immeasurable mansion, which is its effect, in the place of Vairocana.

original: ka ba bzang po brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin no //🔽rdo rje'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pas /🔽rdo rje tshul te /
analyzed: ka ba bzang po brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin no // rdo rje'i tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pas / rdo rje tshul te /
translated: It is beautified by eight excellent pillars.🔽The vajra way, etc.

original: theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The vajra way is the Great Vehicle, since it uproots all resistant tendencies without exception.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sngags kyi tshul gyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su chos ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sngags kyi tshul gyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su chos ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma in two aspects, due to the influence of the inclinations of sentient beings, by way of the division into the Perfections and Mantra ways.

original: de rab tu bskor ba mdzad cing yang dag par ston par mdzad pas rdo rje thig gis kun nas yongs su bskor ba yin te /
analyzed: de rab tu bskor ba mdzad cing yang dag par ston par mdzad pas rdo rje thig gis kun nas yongs su bskor ba yin te /
translated: It is surrounded by a vajra fence, since it is turned and taught by him.

original: rdo rje'i phreng bas kun nas yongs su bcad cing /
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng bas kun nas yongs su bcad cing /
translated: It is completely surrounded by a vajra garland,

original: rdo rje ra ba'i rongs kyis yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba'i rongs kyis yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and completely surrounded by a vajra trench. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the verse beginning with “form, etc.,”

original: gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: form, etc.,🔽means form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par dag pa gang yin pa chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing gnyis su med par bsgom pa de rgyur gyur pas bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par dag pa gang yin pa chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing gnyis su med par bsgom pa de rgyur gyur pas bla na med pa ste /
translated: That which is the purity of form, etc., is the meditation on the illusoriness of all phenomena and their nonduality.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gang du 'og nas lha rnams kyi nye bar longs spyod ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gang du 'og nas lha rnams kyi nye bar longs spyod ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: That is the cause of the unsurpassed, which is the nature of the five sense objects that are completely beyond all worlds, and which later on are the very nature of the enjoyment of the gods.

original: mchod pa lnga yis zhes bya ba la mchod pa lnga ni me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos te /
analyzed: mchod pa lnga yis zhes bya ba la mchod pa lnga ni me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos te /
translated: As for the verse beginning with “with the five offerings,” the five offerings are flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, and food.

original: des rnam par brgyan pa ni spud pa'o //
analyzed: des rnam par brgyan pa ni spud pa'o //
translated: Adorned with those is ornamented.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is the natural outflow of the purity of the realm of phenomena.

original: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi sgras ston pas bdud rtsi lnga yin no zhes la @153a * //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi sgras ston pas bdud rtsi lnga yin no zhes la @153a * //
translated: The reason the natural outflow is similar to the cause indicates that the teacher [Buddha] says that the five nectars are the dharmadhatu.

original: la zer ro //
analyzed: la zer ro //
translated: Some say, The five nectars are the five aggregates.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sna tshogs padma ni nag po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i mdog can no //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sna tshogs padma ni nag po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i mdog can no //
translated: The various and so on refers to the various lotuses, which are black, white, yellow, red, and green.

original: de'i 'dab ma ni padma'i 'dab ma ste /
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma ni padma'i 'dab ma ste /
translated: The petals are the lotus petals.

original: de rnams la legs par gnas pa'i nyi ma dang zla ba des mgon dang bcas shing byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de rnams la legs par gnas pa'i nyi ma dang zla ba des mgon dang bcas shing byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: The sun and moon are well-established on those, and it is endowed with a protector and blessed.

original: mnan pa'i 'og nas bshad pa'i lha'i gnas rnams gang yin pa der rin po che ni ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: mnan pa'i 'og nas bshad pa'i lha'i gnas rnams gang yin pa der rin po che ni ma lus pa ste /
translated: The divine abodes are the places explained below. All jewels are the five nectars.

original: ma rgad dang / aindra n'i la dang / padma r'a ga dang / bee d'urya dang / mu sa la gal ba zhes bya ba de rnams kyis rnam par spras pa ni de'i rang bzhin can du byas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ma rgad dang / aindra n'i la dang / padma r'a ga dang / bee d'urya dang / mu sa la gal ba zhes bya ba de rnams kyis rnam par spras pa ni de'i rang bzhin can du byas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The adorned means that they are made of the nature of those [jewels].

original: 'di ni 'du byed rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of formations.

original: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pas ni /
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pas ni /
translated: The connection with the meditation on the seal of the origin of phenomena and so on is as follows:🔽 By the purification of space and the meditation on the immeasurable palace,

original: nam mkha'i rnam par dag pa dang / gzhal yas khang bsgom pas ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang // yongs su longs spyod pas ;
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnam par dag pa dang / gzhal yas khang bsgom pas ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang // yongs su longs spyod pas ;
translated: all activities, conduct, and enjoyment

original: thams cad rnam par dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be seen as completely pure.

original: da ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa gsungs pa ni /🔽bcu drug cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa gsungs pa ni / bcu drug cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Now, the generation of Bhagavān Vajrasattva by the sequence of the five manifest enlightenments is stated:🔽The sixteen parts and so on.

original: bcu drug cha ni aa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcu drug cha ni aa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sixteen parts are the vowels beginning with a.

original: cha bcu drug po ni stong pa nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: cha bcu drug po ni stong pa nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The sixteen parts are the teachers of emptiness.

original: de'i tshogs ni phung po ste /
analyzed: de'i tshogs ni phung po ste /
translated: The collection of those is the aggregate.

original: de las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa dbus nyid ces pa dbus ma'i gdan du'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa dbus nyid ces pa dbus ma'i gdan du'o //
translated: The complete moon that arises from that is the middle seat.

original: de yang 'od zer dpag tu med pa'i tshogs kyis nye bar brgyan pa dbus ma'i gdan la bzhengs pa dbus kyi zla bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'od zer dpag tu med pa'i tshogs kyis nye bar brgyan pa dbus ma'i gdan la bzhengs pa dbus kyi zla bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: That is also imagined as the moon in the middle, standing on the middle seat, adorned with a collection of immeasurable light rays.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni slob dpon gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i man ngag las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni slob dpon gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i man ngag las bshad par bya ste /
translated: According to the rite means that it should be explained from the oral instructions of the lineage of one master after another.

original: bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba ni dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug ste /
analyzed: bcu drug cha dang tshogs las byung ba ni dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug ste /
translated: The sixteen parts and the collection that arises from that are the sixteen vowels.

original: de nyis 'gyur du byas pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de nyis 'gyur du byas pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin par bstan to //
translated: The teaching that those are doubled is the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: yi ge ka nas yi ge ha'i bar du sum cu rtsa gsum dang yi ge yam bam lam zhes bya ba sna med kyi yi ge gsum dang bcas pa dang / gcod kyi thig le gnyis po can aa zhes bya ba dang / rjes su yi ge aam dang /
analyzed: yi ge ka nas yi ge ha'i bar du sum cu rtsa gsum dang yi ge yam bam lam zhes bya ba sna med kyi yi ge gsum dang bcas pa dang / gcod kyi thig le gnyis po can aa zhes bya ba dang / rjes su yi ge aam dang /
translated: The thirty-three letters from ka to ha, plus the three letters without a nose ya, va, la, plus the two bindus of the section on cutting off, plus the letter a, plus the letter am,

original: kam zhes bya ba lce rtsa can dang wa zhes bya ba au padma ste /
analyzed: kam zhes bya ba lce rtsa can dang wa zhes bya ba au padma ste /

analyzed: de ltar @153b bzhi bcu po nyis 'gyur du byas pa ni dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur yongs su brtag par bya'o //

original: ka sogs gsal byed 'od zer can //

analyzed: dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug ni mdog dkar po //

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags las byung ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags las byung ba /

original: nang nas kun nas zlum por aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge phreng bar bsgom par bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: nang nas kun nas zlum por aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge phreng bar bsgom par bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin la /

analyzed: phyi rol du de rnams las byung ba'i ka la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phreng ba nyi ma'i mdog can thabs kyi ngo bo nyid bsam par bya zhing /

analyzed: ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed kyi yi ge re re la rang nyid bsams la /
translated: Visualize each of the consonants ka and so forth as yourself.🔽Recite the mantra:

analyzed: aom bho dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /

analyzed: zhes bya ba dang ; dbyangs kyi yi ge dang gsal byed yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: The vowels and consonants transform into

analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa las / 'di dag rnyed par ga la 'gyur //

original: zhes 'dir dogs pa'i gnas su mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes 'dir dogs pa'i gnas su mi bya ste /
translated: is not a source of doubt here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: der rgya cher bshad pa byed pa dag gis 'di ltar bris pa dang / de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba las /
analyzed: der rgya cher bshad pa byed pa dag gis 'di ltar bris pa dang / de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba las /

analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam byas nas //
translated: Having unified the vowels and consonants,

original: kha yi thad kar mdud par bya //
analyzed: kha yi thad kar mdud par bya //
translated: tie them above the mouth.

original: de yi 'og dang ri mo rnams //
analyzed: de yi 'og dang ri mo rnams //
translated: Below that and on the lines

original: yi ge thams cad dgod par bya //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad dgod par bya //

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las kyang 'di kho na ltar rnam par bzhag la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las kyang 'di kho na ltar rnam par bzhag la /

original: 'dir yang bla ma rnams tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bla ma rnams tshad ma nyid yin no //

original: dpal mchog dang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The glorious Supreme Original Buddha and so forth.

original: dpal mchog dang pe ni byang chub rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpal mchog dang pe ni byang chub rdo rje'o //
translated: The glorious Supreme Original Buddha is Vajradhara.

original: de'i snying po ni h'um ngo //🔽sngags de las byung ba ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i dbus na /
analyzed: de'i snying po ni h'um ngo // sngags de las byung ba ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i dbus na /

original: rdo rje bzang po rtse lnga pa rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzang po rtse lnga pa rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Arisen from that mantra is a five-pronged excellent vajra visualized in the center of the moon of the mind of enlightenment.

original: nor bu dmar 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni steng na padma r'a ga'i mdog can /
analyzed: nor bu dmar 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni steng na padma r'a ga'i mdog can /

original: ye shes rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of the five kinds of pristine awareness.

original: 'og tu nag po nyid do //
analyzed: 'og tu nag po nyid do //
translated: It is black below.

original: aom ti shtha @154a * //
analyzed: aom ti shtha @154a * //
translated: The mantra Om tistha vajra

original: badzra zhes bya ba'i sngags las byung ba'o //
analyzed: badzra zhes bya ba'i sngags las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from the mantra.

original: dpag med ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'od zer kun nas 'phor ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyis phyogs kyi tshogs ma lus par khyab par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dpag med ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'od zer kun nas 'phor ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyis phyogs kyi tshogs ma lus par khyab par bsam pa'o //
translated: The phrase infinite and so forth means that one imagines that the entire realm of space is filled with the hosts of buddhas that arise from the tips of the light rays that radiate from the jewel.

original: dang po'i snying po yi ge h'um gi dbus su mtshan ma'i mgon dang bcas par bsam par byas la /
analyzed: dang po'i snying po yi ge h'um gi dbus su mtshan ma'i mgon dang bcas par bsam par byas la /
translated: One should imagine that the syllable hum, which is the essence of the first [buddha], is in the center of the jewel, together with the sign of the protector.

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: The mantra Om vajra-atmako 'ham🔽means I am possessed of the pride of being a vajra-being.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis nga rgyal dang ldan zhes bya ba dang / mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i mchog rnams kyi don byas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis nga rgyal dang ldan zhes bya ba dang / mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i mchog rnams kyi don byas par gyur pa ste /
translated: The infinite emanations perform the welfare of the supreme beings.

original: yi ge h'um gi rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis bskor ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi 'od zer rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi gzungs su bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis bskor ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi 'od zer rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi gzungs su bskyed par bya'o //
