translated: The light rays from the tips of the light-rays surrounding the vajra syllable hūṃ generate the hosts of Buddhas, and the light rays from them generate the world as the Buddha’s magical creation.

original: thub mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa nas /🔽rgyal ba skyed byed nyid kyi sku ru bsam //
analyzed: thub mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa nas / rgyal ba skyed byed nyid kyi sku ru bsam //
translated: The supreme sage, etc.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽thub pa'i mchog nyid phra rab ni rdo rje las byung ba'i don 'od zer gyi dra ba mtha' ma las nges par byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams las bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te / thub pa'i mchog nyid phra rab ni rdo rje las byung ba'i don 'od zer gyi dra ba mtha' ma las nges par byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams las bsgrubs shing /
translated: is to be applied to the thought of the body of the Victorious One, the generator.

original: bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems zla ba rdo rje yongs su gyur pa'o //🔽de nyid kyis na mtshungs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems zla ba rdo rje yongs su gyur pa'o // de nyid kyis na mtshungs pa med pa ste /
translated: The supreme sage himself, the subtle atom, is the moon arisen from the vajra, the meaning of the vajra, the web of light rays arisen from the tips of the light rays, the Buddhas accomplished from the Buddhas, and the bodhicitta generated by them, the transformation of the vajra and moon.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: And by that very fact, it is incomparable, naturally pure.

original: zla ba rgyas 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zla ba rgyas 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Like the full moon, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang zhal dbus ma ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang zhal dbus ma ni /
translated: The body of the Blessed One, the central face,

original: zla ba rgyas pa dang 'dra bar dkar ba yin la /
analyzed: zla ba rgyas pa dang 'dra bar dkar ba yin la /
translated: He is white, like the full moon.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni sngon po'o //
translated: His right face is blue.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
translated: His left face is red.

original: de bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i rin po che'i 'od 'bar ba'i rgyan gdu bu dang / dbu rgyan dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyag rgya rig ma dam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i rin po che'i 'od 'bar ba'i rgyan gdu bu dang / dbu rgyan dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyag rgya rig ma dam pa ste /
translated: Similarly, he is adorned with ornaments blazing with the light of various jewels, bracelets, and a crown, and with his two hands in the gesture of sexual union, he embraces the excellent knowledge consort,

original: m'a ma k'i la 'khyud par mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du phyag lhag ma bzhis rdo rje dang ral gri dang / padma dang / rin po che bsnams pas mdzes shing sbyor bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i la 'khyud par mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du phyag lhag ma bzhis rdo rje dang ral gri dang / padma dang / rin po che bsnams pas mdzes shing sbyor bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Mamaki. Similarly, he is beautiful and engaged with his remaining four hands holding a vajra, sword, lotus, and jewel.

original: rang bzhin gyis ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rdo rje ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rdo rje ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The vajra is the nature of the five awarenesses, since it is the nature of the five awarenesses.

original: ral gri ni nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa thams cad gcod pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri ni nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa thams cad gcod pa'o //
translated: The sword cuts all the faults of the afflictions.

original: padma ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lotus is not soiled by the mud of faults such as desire by nature.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The wish-granting jewel fulfills all wishes.

original: 'di ni 'di dag @154b gi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dag @154b gi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is their purity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pa ni phyag drug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pa ni phyag drug go //
translated: The six perfections are the six arms.

original: khams gsum zhes bya ba ba spu'i bug ma lus pa'i rtse las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las skyes pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams kyis khams gsum ma lus pa khyab par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes bya ba ba spu'i bug ma lus pa'i rtse las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las skyes pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams kyis khams gsum ma lus pa khyab par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the mass of light rays that arise from the tips of all the pores, and the mass of buddhas that arise from them pervade the three realms without exception.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po'i rnam par dag pa gang yin pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po'i rnam par dag pa gang yin pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The three doors of liberation are the purity of the three doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: des kha dog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi zhal gsum mnga' ba yin la /
analyzed: des kha dog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi zhal gsum mnga' ba yin la /
translated: The ultimate nature is the three faces with the nature of the three colors.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas bud med dang skyes pa lta bu'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas bud med dang skyes pa lta bu'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: He is endowed with the great seal of the pristine awareness that is the nondual union of wisdom and means, and so he has the nature of both a woman and a man.

original: snying rje'i mchog ces bya ba thugs rje chen pos sprul pa kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje'i mchog ces bya ba thugs rje chen pos sprul pa kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: He is the “supreme compassion” because he is the essence of the great compassion that is the nature of the emanations.

original: rgyal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The “victors” are the tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi bskyed pa ni yab tu gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bskyed pa ni yab tu gyur cing /
translated: He is their “creator,” their father.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma lus pa sprul par byed par bdag nyid bsam zhing 'di ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma lus pa sprul par byed par bdag nyid bsam zhing 'di ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
translated: The practitioner should imagine himself in this way and generate this pride:

original: aom aa th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta tho& ham /🔽zhes srid pa bar ma la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems nyid de ltar bsam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: aom aa th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta tho& ham / zhes srid pa bar ma la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems nyid de ltar bsam pa yin gyi /
translated: “Oṃ, I am the creator of all tathāgatas.”

original: mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: The practitioner who is in the intermediate state should imagine his own mind in this way, but he should not actualize it.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sbyor ba 'di mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sbyor ba 'di mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of the glorious Vajrasattva should actualize this yoga.

original: bsgom pa 'dis yab dang yum rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'dis yab dang yum rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: This meditation shows the purity of the father and mother.

original: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i spyod pas sems can thams cad gdon par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i spyod pas sems can thams cad gdon par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to liberate all sentient beings through the conduct of experiencing the great bliss of the stage of joy,

original: bcom ldan 'das dkyil khor gyi 'khor lo sprul par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dkyil khor gyi 'khor lo sprul par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: the Bhagavān emanates the maṇḍala wheel.

original: mchog tu rjes chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mchog tu rjes chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Supreme passion and so on.

original: mchog kyang yin la rjes su chags pa yang yin pas na /
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la rjes su chags pa yang yin pas na /
translated: Since it is supreme and it is passion,

original: mchog tu rjes chags te /
analyzed: mchog tu rjes chags te /
translated: it is supreme passion.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dod chags chen po de nyid ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /🔽bla na med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dod chags chen po de nyid ni phun sum tshogs pa ste / bla na med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That great passion, which has the characteristic of ripening and liberating sentient beings, is the perfection, the unsurpassed union.

original: des 'dus ba'i sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa la bltas nas rjes su chags shing dbang du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des 'dus ba'i sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa la bltas nas rjes su chags shing dbang du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Having looked at the entire assembly of sentient beings gathered by that, he is passionate and magnetizes them,

original: chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but he is not free from passion.🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: de yang / sangs rgyas kun gyi chags pa yi //
analyzed: de yang / sangs rgyas kun gyi chags pa yi //
translated: The passion of all buddhas
Desire🔽🔽

original: chags ye shes rnyog pa med //
analyzed: chags ye shes rnyog pa med //
translated: Passion is the unclouded intuition.

original: chags pas chags bral bcom na ni //
analyzed: chags pas chags bral bcom na ni //
translated: If one is passionate, and conquers passion,

original: des ni bde ba thams cad stsol //
analyzed: des ni bde ba thams cad stsol //
translated: he will obtain all the joys.🔽And,

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
translated: All yogis are the Blessed One,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //🔽de yi longs spyod khams gsum pa ;
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs // de yi longs spyod khams gsum pa ;
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata.🔽His enjoyment is the entire

original: / ma lus pa ni thams cad do //
analyzed: / ma lus pa ni thams cad do //
translated: three worlds.

original: zhes gsungs pas 'dod chags chen pos 'dul ba'i 'jig rten pa rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'dod chags chen pos 'dul ba'i 'jig rten pa rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, in order to convert those worldly people who are to be converted by great passion,

original: dga' ba'i sgyu ma'i sgra yis zhes bya ba la rol pas na dga' ba ste /🔽rab tu dga' ba'i rol pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgyu ma'i sgra yis zhes bya ba la rol pas na dga' ba ste / rab tu dga' ba'i rol pa'o //
translated: the sound of the illusion of passion,

original: de las byung ba'i rdo rje dang padma sgyu ma lta bu'i yang dag par sbyor ba'i shugs las byung ba'i sgra ni brag ca dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rdo rje dang padma sgyu ma lta bu'i yang dag par sbyor ba'i shugs las byung ba'i sgra ni brag ca dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: is the sound of the illusion of the vajra and lotus, which is like an echo, arising from the force of the union which is like an illusion.

original: des phyogs bcu na dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ru bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams bzhugs bya'o //
analyzed: des phyogs bcu na dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ru bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams bzhugs bya'o //
translated: By that sound, the hosts of Buddhas who dwell in the bodies of glorious Vajrasattva in the ten directions are summoned.

original: de ni spyan la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni spyan la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eyes, etc. are the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sgras zhugs pa'i rgyal ba'i tshogs de rnams spyan la sogs pa'i rigs gsum gyi gzugs dang dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug tu sprul pas phyung nas /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sgras zhugs pa'i rgyal ba'i tshogs de rnams spyan la sogs pa'i rigs gsum gyi gzugs dang dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug tu sprul pas phyung nas /
translated: That is, the hosts of victors who have entered by the word “delight” are emanated in the form of the three families such as Lochana, and the six goddesses such as Rupavajra.

original: rang gi rig ma ni m'a ma k'i ste /
analyzed: rang gi rig ma ni m'a ma k'i ste /
translated: One’s knowledge consort is Mamaki.

original: de'i nang du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du chud par bya'o //
translated: They should be caused to enter her.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs spyan la sogs pa lha mo dgu'i gzugs su phyung nas m'a ma k'i lus la zhugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs spyan la sogs pa lha mo dgu'i gzugs su phyung nas m'a ma k'i lus la zhugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, the hosts of buddhas who have entered the body of the Lord are emanated in the form of the nine goddesses such as Lochana, and they should be caused to enter the body of Mamaki. This is the meaning.

original: de'i padma'i zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i padma'o //
analyzed: de'i padma'i zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i padma'o //
translated: “Her lotus” is the secret lotus.

original: lte ba ni gsang ba'i sna'o //
analyzed: lte ba ni gsang ba'i sna'o //
translated: “Nectar” is the secret nose.

original: nang du dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gsang ba'i padma'i lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: nang du dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gsang ba'i padma'i lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: “The mandala inside” is the mandala that is located in the center of the secret lotus of knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba gtso bor 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba gtso bor 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhugs pa'o //
translated: and the Tathāgatas, and goddesses, and all the Bodhisattvas, with Mañjuvajra as the chief.

original: zla zer las byung bar zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zla zer las byung bar zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Arisen from the moonbeams” means that he is seated on a clear moon-disk.

original: bsams nas blo yis zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su gang bar bsgoms te /
analyzed: bsams nas blo yis zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su gang bar bsgoms te /
translated: “Having imagined him with the mind” means that he is visualized as filled with one’s own mind.

original: mchod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bsgom par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba bsgom par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should visualize the offerings and the tasting of the elixir.

original: yang dkyil 'khor der rang gi blos 'gro ba'i tshogs ma lus pa /
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor der rang gi blos 'gro ba'i tshogs ma lus pa /
translated: Then, in that maṇḍala, one should visualize the entire assembly of migrating beings,

original: nyon mongs dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to eliminate the afflictive and the cognitive obstructions.

original: @155b slob ma gzhug pa'i rim pas der rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: @155b slob ma gzhug pa'i rim pas der rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize them entering there, in the manner of a disciple.

original: gang du gzhug par bya zhe na /🔽gsang ba'i rdo rje dam pa'i dbus su ni //
analyzed: gang du gzhug par bya zhe na / gsang ba'i rdo rje dam pa'i dbus su ni //
translated: Where should they enter?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “In the middle of the holy secret vajra” is stated.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas chos 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dbus su chud pa tsam gyis 'gro ba'i tshogs de rnams chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i 'od kyis reg cing /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas chos 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dbus su chud pa tsam gyis 'gro ba'i tshogs de rnams chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i 'od kyis reg cing /
translated: Merely by entering there, the hosts of migrating beings are touched by the light of the source of phenomena.

original: skyed pa po'i 'od zer gyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa /
analyzed: skyed pa po'i 'od zer gyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa /
translated: The light of the creator, Vairocana, and so on,🔽the five tathāgatas, become the perfect appearance of the five tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par yang dag pa'i snang bar gyur pa dang / dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje mtha' las byung ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par yang dag pa'i snang bar gyur pa dang / dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje mtha' las byung ba /
translated: The secret vajra of glorious Vajrasattva arises from the end of the vajra.

original: zla bzhu ba'i gzugs su gyur pa'i bdud rtsi lnga'i rdo rjes dbang bskur bas /
analyzed: zla bzhu ba'i gzugs su gyur pa'i bdud rtsi lnga'i rdo rjes dbang bskur bas /
translated: The vajra of the five amṛtas, which has the form of melted moon, confers empowerment.

original: sems kyi tshogs de rnams dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi tshogs de rnams dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: The hosts of minds are empowered.

original: kun nas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “should be empowered” is “should be completely empowered.”

original: de ltar dbang bskur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having conferred empowerment in that way, in order to attain omniscience,

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pas mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pas mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the eyes, etc. with Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: de ni don dam par de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni don dam par de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that this is the ultimate nature of its purity.

original: de nas sa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas sa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Then, it is said, “Then, with Kshitigarbha, etc.”

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug gis mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab cing de'i ngo bo nyid de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug gis mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab cing de'i ngo bo nyid de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the eyes, etc. with the six, Kshitigarbha, etc., and make their nature the nature of that.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug gis ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dbyings byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug gis ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dbyings byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: With the six, Rupavajra, etc., one should consecrate form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and the realm of phenomena.

original: spyan la sogs pa bzhis ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams byin gyis brlab pa rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa bzhis ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams byin gyis brlab pa rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: With the four, Locana, etc., one should complete the consecration of the great elements, earth, etc.

original: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: “Form, etc.” Form is the form aggregate.

original: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga'o //
translated: It is the five sense faculties and the five sense objects.

original: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'du shes ni nye bar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni nye bar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Perception is the apprehension of the specific characteristics of an object.

original: bum pa la 'di ni bum pa'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la 'di ni bum pa'o snyam pa'o //
translated: It is the thought that this is a pot.

original: 'du byed ni sems dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //🔽de la sems dang ldan pa ni sems pa dang / 'dun pa dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du @156a * //
analyzed: 'du byed ni sems dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o // de la sems dang ldan pa ni sems pa dang / 'dun pa dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du @156a * //
translated: Formation is the mental factor that is associated with the mind and the mental factor that is not associated with the mind.

original: 'dzin pa dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / phrag dog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / phrag dog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is associated with the mind is intention, aspiration, understanding, memory, attention, anger, resentment, deceit, guile, jealousy, and so on.

original: mi ldan pa ni thob pa dang / rnyed pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni thob pa dang / rnyed pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is not associated with the mind is obtainment, possession, the meditative absorption of nonperception, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yid de //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yid de //
translated: Consciousness is the mind.

original: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
translated: The mind is the immediately past six collections of consciousness.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: It is the consciousness that has just ceased.

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: This is explained in the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: de ltar phung po rnam pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phung po rnam pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po yin no //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are the five Tathagatas, the nature of the five pure ones.

original: de ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs nas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhis byin gyis brlabs shing /🔽sa'i snying po la sogs pa dang / gzugs rdo rje la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs nas spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhis byin gyis brlabs shing / sa'i snying po la sogs pa dang / gzugs rdo rje la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, the aggregates, sense-fields, and elements, having been blessed by the Tathagatas Vairocana and so forth, are blessed by the four goddesses Locana and so forth.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par sbyangs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang rjes su gzung ba'i phyir 'og nas bshad pa'i sa bon 'di rnams kyis rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam par sbyangs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang rjes su gzung ba'i phyir 'og nas bshad pa'i sa bon 'di rnams kyis rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: By means of the purification of the eyes and so forth and of form and so forth, by means of the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects, and by means of the acceptance of all sentient beings, one should emerge by means of the following seed syllables.

original: kshim dzr'im kham gam shkam sam zhes bya ba drug gis sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: kshim dzr'im kham gam shkam sam zhes bya ba drug gis sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: By means of the six syllables kṣiṃ jriṃ khaṃ gaṃ śaṃ saṃ, one should emerge as the six, Kṣitigarbha and so forth.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram zhes bya bas ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram zhes bya bas ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: With JRAUM HÜM VAM HOH KHAM RAM one should emit Rūpavajrā and so forth.

original: lam m'am pam t'am zhes bya bas ni spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lam m'am pam t'am zhes bya bas ni spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: With LAM MAM PAM TAM one should emit Locanā and so forth.

original: bhr'um a'am dzra'im kham h'um zhes bya bas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bhr'um a'am dzra'im kham h'um zhes bya bas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: With BHŪM ĀM JRIH KHAM HÜM one should emit Vairocana and so forth.

original: 'di dag ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: tshul 'di dag gis nye bar mtshon pa stong phrag snyed gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di dag gis nye bar mtshon pa stong phrag snyed gdon par bya'o //
translated: One should emit thousands of deities in this way.

original: da ni srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs las byang chub sems dpa' mngal du 'jug pa ston par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs las byang chub sems dpa' mngal du 'jug pa ston par gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, it is said that the Bodhisattva enters the womb from the state of the intermediate existence.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The verse begins, Om, and so forth.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bsgoms pa 'od dang ldan pa'i yi ge ho: gnyis kyi nang du chud par sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bsgoms pa 'od dang ldan pa'i yi ge ho: gnyis kyi nang du chud par sems pa'o //
translated: The mind is the mind that is imagined to be inside the two HŪMs, which are endowed with light, as previously cultivated.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang yul yang dag par thob pa'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang yul yang dag par thob pa'i tshul gyis te /
translated: The phrase in accordance with the rite refers to the method of attaining the right place and time.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: As it is said in the Abhidharma,

original: srid pa bar ma spangs nas ni //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the intermediate existence,

original: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: like a lamp, one enters the womb.

original: de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i bde ba chen po nyams su bstar ba la zhugs shing /
analyzed: de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i bde ba chen po nyams su bstar ba la zhugs shing /
translated: Moreover, having entered the practice of the great bliss of glorious Vajrasattva,

original: sems can ma lus pa gdon pa la rab tu zhugs @156b par mthong nas 'gro ba dang yul bzang po yang dag par thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa gdon pa la rab tu zhugs @156b par mthong nas 'gro ba dang yul bzang po yang dag par thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa skyes shing /
translated: and having seen that one is engaged in liberating all sentient beings, one gives rise to desire for the attainment of a good place and object.

original: 'di lta bu'i nges pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i nges pa skye ste /
translated: And one gives rise to the following certainty:

original: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa 'dir sems can gang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ldan pa de yang zhugs pa tsam gyis 'tshang rgya ba nyid thob pa yin la /
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bsgom pa 'dir sems can gang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ldan pa de yang zhugs pa tsam gyis 'tshang rgya ba nyid thob pa yin la /
translated: “In this meditation on the mudra of the source of phenomena, even those sentient beings who possess the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, by merely entering, attain the state of buddhahood.

original: de bas na ngas kun du bzang po nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir gnas 'di nyid du zhugs par bya'o zhes de lta bu'i sems brtan por byas nas /
analyzed: de bas na ngas kun du bzang po nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir gnas 'di nyid du zhugs par bya'o zhes de lta bu'i sems brtan por byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to attain the state of Samantabhadra, I will enter this place.” Having stabilized one’s mind in that way,

original: srid pa bar ma pa yi ge lnga'i gzugs shes rab kyi gsang ba'i padma'i nang du mar me ltar zhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa yi ge lnga'i gzugs shes rab kyi gsang ba'i padma'i nang du mar me ltar zhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The five-syllable form of the intermediate being enters the secret lotus of wisdom like a flame.

original: mnyam med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa med pa'o //
translated: Without equal means without compare.

original: shes rab kyis yang dag par bskyed pa'i 'dod chags ni shes rab chags pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis yang dag par bskyed pa'i 'dod chags ni shes rab chags pa ste /
translated: The passion that is generated by wisdom is the passion of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi gsang ba'i chu skyes kyi nang du zhugs pa tsam gyis srid pa par ma pa zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs can rnam par shes pa tsam gyi yang dag pa'i rig pa'i ngo bor gyur la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gsang ba'i chu skyes kyi nang du zhugs pa tsam gyis srid pa par ma pa zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs can rnam par shes pa tsam gyi yang dag pa'i rig pa'i ngo bor gyur la /
translated: By merely entering the secret lotus of wisdom, the intermediate being, which has the form of melted moon, becomes the entity of pure awareness, which is mere consciousness.

original: nur nur po la sogs par bsgom pa 'di ni spyir na rnam par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs par bsgom pa 'di ni spyir na rnam par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: This meditation on the kalala and so on is generally the purification of consciousness.

original: ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'i phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'i phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The five aggregates of the moment of conception in the mother's womb are consciousness.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i chu shel gyi gzugs can du gyur pa'i 'od zer gyi gzi byin gyi mthus yab dang yum gnyis ka 'ang zla bar zhu bar byas shing byang chub kyi sems thig le'i gzugs su byung la /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i chu shel gyi gzugs can du gyur pa'i 'od zer gyi gzi byin gyi mthus yab dang yum gnyis ka 'ang zla bar zhu bar byas shing byang chub kyi sems thig le'i gzugs su byung la /
translated: The his refers to the bodhicitta, which has become the form of a water crystal, and through the power of the radiance of the light rays, both the father and mother melt into the moon and arise in the form of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: de dag de lta bur gyur pa mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir thugs rje chen po skyes la /
analyzed: de dag de lta bur gyur pa mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir thugs rje chen po skyes la /
translated: Seeing that, the bhagavān buddhas generate great compassion for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar mdzad pa yin la /
translated: The bhagavān nirmāṇakāya liberates all sentient beings from the suffering of samsara.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i bdag nyid can chos kyi skur yongs su thim la /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i bdag nyid can chos kyi skur yongs su thim la /
translated: In that way, the ultimate nature dissolves into the dharmakāya.

original: de ltar ni bdag cag kyang snying brtse ba dang bral bas sems can thams cad gdon pa la rgyus ji ltar gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni bdag cag kyang snying brtse ba dang bral bas sems can thams cad gdon pa la rgyus ji ltar gnas par bya ste /
translated: In that way, since we are also devoid of compassion, how should we remain in order to liberate all sentient beings?

original: de ltar na don dam pa'i bdag cag gis rang gi don tsam du zad do zhes de ltar yongs su brtags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i gzugs su mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar na don dam pa'i bdag cag gis rang gi don tsam du zad do zhes de ltar yongs su brtags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'i gzugs su mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having thoroughly examined the matter, the Blessed One, having assumed the forms of the four goddesses such as Locanā,

original: gzhan gyi don gyi phongs pas gdungs pa 'dod @157a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi phongs pas gdungs pa 'dod @157a * //
translated: with the distress of being impoverished in regard to the aims of others,

original: pas nyam thag pa lta bur snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i glu'i tshig bzhis /
analyzed: pas nyam thag pa lta bur snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i glu'i tshig bzhis /
translated: with the four verses of a song that are pleasing and delightful,

original: bcom ldan 'das la bskul bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bskul bar gyur to //
translated: urged the Blessed One.

original: de ltar 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas lha mo spyan dang por glu len te sems nyid 'gro ba'i rtsa ba yin pas thugs kyi ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyis thugs la dang por gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'og nas bshad pa'i rnam pas lha mo spyan dang por glu len te sems nyid 'gro ba'i rtsa ba yin pas thugs kyi ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyis thugs la dang por gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, as will be explained below, the goddess Locanā sings first, and since mind itself is the root of transmigrators, she first requests the mind, which is the essence of the Blessed One.

original: de yang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, with regard to the line “the realm of sentient beings,”

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can nyid dang / thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis na sems can khams te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can nyid dang / thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis na sems can khams te /
translated: it is the realm of sentient beings because it is the nature of no other and because it is the ground of all.

original: 'gro ba'i don dang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni khyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rgyur gyur pas na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don dang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni khyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rgyur gyur pas na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: You are the lord of the abode, since the benefit of beings and the abundance of the Buddha are the cause of your cyclic existence and nirvana, which are to be accomplished.

original: khyod ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid de /
analyzed: khyod ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid de /
translated: You is the Lord himself.

original: 'tshe ba med cing yang dag pa la so sor rtog pas nyes pas mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rdo rje'i thugs so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med cing yang dag pa la so sor rtog pas nyes pas mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rdo rje'i thugs so //
translated: Since you are not harmed by faults, due to non-violence and correct discernment, you are the vajra mind, having the nature of vajra-like wisdom.

original: de bzhin du dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pa yid du 'ong zhing rnam par dag pas don che zhing mthu che ba'i 'dod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pa yid du 'ong zhing rnam par dag pas don che zhing mthu che ba'i 'dod pa /
translated: Similarly, you are the great desire, the beautiful and pure cause of joy,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pas 'dod par bya ba sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pas 'dod par bya ba sangs rgyas kyi mthar thug pas /
translated: the desire to be desired by both the mundane and supramundane, up to the stage of Buddhahood.

original: lha mo spyan bdag la chos nyid kyis thams cad bskyed pa'i tshul du bskyab cing gnod pa rnams la skyabs mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo spyan bdag la chos nyid kyis thams cad bskyed pa'i tshul du bskyab cing gnod pa rnams la skyabs mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Goddess Locana, by nature, protect me in the manner of giving rise to everything, and be a refuge from harms.

original: thog ma'i sangs rgyas su gyur pas na mgon po ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i sangs rgyas su gyur pas na mgon po ste gtso bo'o //
translated: Since he is the primordial Buddha, he is the protector, the principal one.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If, etc.

original: gal te bdag cag la brtson pa'i dbang gis bdag cag gnyi ga'i tshul du 'tsho zhing gson par mchis par bzhed na sems can yab chen zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing yon tan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na sems
analyzed: gal te bdag cag la brtson pa'i dbang gis bdag cag gnyi ga'i tshul du 'tsho zhing gson par mchis par bzhed na sems can yab chen zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing yon tan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na sems
translated: If you wish for us to live and remain alive in both ways by the power of our striving, then, O Father of all sentient beings, you are the one who is naturally nondual, the nature of all qualities, and the cause of all qualities.

original: can thams cad kyi yab bo //
analyzed: can thams cad kyi yab bo //
translated: Therefore, you are the father of all sentient beings.

original: thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can yin pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can yin pas na chen po'o //
translated: Since you are the nature of great compassion, you are great.

original: gnyen ni yab dang yum du gyur pas na gnyen no //
analyzed: gnyen ni yab dang yum du gyur pas na gnyen no //
translated: Since you are the father and mother of all sentient beings, you are the kinsman.

original: 'gro ba khyab pas na mchog ste shin tu phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba khyab pas na mchog ste shin tu phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Since you pervade all migrating beings, you are supreme, the most excellent.

original: dgyes par mdzad du gsol zhes pa ni bdag la dgyes pa bskyed par gsol zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dgyes par mdzad du gsol zhes pa ni bdag la dgyes pa bskyed par gsol zhes pa ste /
translated: Please be pleased means please generate pleasure in me.

original: gal te bdag gson par bzhed na bdag cag mngon par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i don 'di @157b mdzad du gsol zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bdag gson par bzhed na bdag cag mngon par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i don 'di @157b mdzad du gsol zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If you wish to live, then do this, the purpose for which we aspire, namely, the benefit of migrating beings.

original: spyan gyi rjes la m'a ma k'i sa rdo rje'i sku khyod ces bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba 'debs te lus yod na ngag la sogs pa 'byung bas de bas na de rnams las dang por sku'i phun sum tshogs pas gsol pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyan gyi rjes la m'a ma k'i sa rdo rje'i sku khyod ces bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba 'debs te lus yod na ngag la sogs pa 'byung bas de bas na de rnams las dang por sku'i phun sum tshogs pas gsol pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: After the eyes, with “O you whose body is the vajra” and so forth, he makes a request. Since speech and so forth occur when there is a body, he first requests the perfection of body.

original: gang khyed kyi skur gyur pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir khyed ni rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: gang khyed kyi skur gyur pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir khyed ni rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: Since the nature of your body is mind, you are the vajra body, because you are free from the fear of samsara.

original: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa mnga' bas bka'i 'khor lo ste bka'i tshogs so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i nus pa mnga' bas bka'i 'khor lo ste bka'i tshogs so //
translated: Since you have unimpeded power, you are the wheel of speech, the assembly of speech.

original: kun du bzang po yin pas na sems can kun la phan pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po yin pas na sems can kun la phan pa'o //
translated: Since you are Samantabhadra, you are the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: thabs thams cad phun sum tshogs par mnga' bas na gang sangs rgyas kyi don sgrub par mdzad pa dang byang chub dang gzhan la phan pa'i don rnam pa du mar thams cad rjes su gzigs shing rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thabs thams cad phun sum tshogs par mnga' bas na gang sangs rgyas kyi don sgrub par mdzad pa dang byang chub dang gzhan la phan pa'i don rnam pa du mar thams cad rjes su gzigs shing rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Since he possesses all the means, he sees and completes all the various aspects of the aims of enlightenment and the benefit of others, which are the aims of the Buddha.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The self is Mamaki.

original: 'dod chags dam tshig ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i lam mo //
translated: Attachment is the pledge, which is the path of the purification of joy.

original: dgyes par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba ni bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par mdzod cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgyes par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba ni bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par mdzod cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Please be pleased means please be endowed with perfect bliss.

original: m'a ma k'i'i 'og tu gos dkar mos bskul ba ni khyed ni rdo rje gsung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i 'og tu gos dkar mos bskul ba ni khyed ni rdo rje gsung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: After Mamaki, Pāṇḍaravāsinī implores him with You are the vajra speech, etc.,

original: lus grub par gyur pa las tshig yongs su rdzogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus grub par gyur pa las tshig yongs su rdzogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa yin no //
translated: since the benefit of sentient beings is done by the completion of speech from the establishment of the body.

original: de'i phyir gsung phun sum tshogs pa'i don du bskul pa ni yang dag pa nyid yin pas khyod ni rdo rje gsung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung phun sum tshogs pa'i don du bskul pa ni yang dag pa nyid yin pas khyod ni rdo rje gsung zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is the object of the request for the perfection of speech is the one who is the truth, and you are called the Vajra Speech.

original: gzhan la rjes su brtse ba'i phyir phan pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bzhugs pas na kun la phan zhing thugs brtse ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rjes su brtse ba'i phyir phan pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bzhugs pas na kun la phan zhing thugs brtse ba'o //
translated: You are the one who is the benefit and compassion for all, because you abide in the method of benefitting others out of compassion.

original: rang gi don la ltos par mi mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i don gang yin pa mdzad cing de'i dgos pa mdzad pa la rtag tu brtson par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la ltos par mi mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i don gang yin pa mdzad cing de'i dgos pa mdzad pa la rtag tu brtson par zhugs pa'o //
translated: You are the one who always engages in the activity of accomplishing the purpose of the worldly aim, because you do not consider your own aim.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The one called “self” is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: bzang zhing nyes pa med pa'i dag pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyis spyod pas dngos po kun nas rnam par dag pa'i sems de nyid ni kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: bzang zhing nyes pa med pa'i dag pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyis spyod pas dngos po kun nas rnam par dag pa'i sems de nyid ni kun du bzang po'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of the pure, the good, and the faultless conduct is the mind of the complete purity of all things, and that one is Samantabhadra.

original: gzhan ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: The others have already been explained.

original: gos dkar mo'i 'og tu sgrol ma'i glu len pa ni khyed ni rdo rje 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gos dkar mo'i 'og tu sgrol ma'i glu len pa ni khyed ni rdo rje 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The song of Tārā, which is sung after the song of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, is “You are the Vajra Desire” and so forth.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ma tshang ba med par bskul ba'i phyir thugs dang sku dang @158a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ma tshang ba med par bskul ba'i phyir thugs dang sku dang @158a * //
translated: Since he is the one who impels in every way without incompleteness, he is the one with the perfect mind, body, and speech.

original: gsung phun sum tshogs pa'i rjes la don thams cad phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir bskul ba yin no //
analyzed: gsung phun sum tshogs pa'i rjes la don thams cad phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir bskul ba yin no //
translated: After the perfection of the mind, body, and speech, he is the one who impels in order to perfect all aims.

original: dngos po gang la sems kyi 'dod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po gang la sems kyi 'dod par gyur pa'am /
translated: Whatever things the mind desires,

original: de dag thams cad sems rnam par dag pa las 'byung bas na de'i phyir khyod ni rdo rje 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad sems rnam par dag pa las 'byung bas na de'i phyir khyod ni rdo rje 'dod pa'o //
translated: since they all arise from the pure mind, therefore you are the vajra desire.

original: dam tshig ni lam mo //
analyzed: dam tshig ni lam mo //
translated: Vow is the path.

original: mchog ni rnam par dag pa ste /🔽des na de ni dam tshig mchog rnam pa thams cad du phan pa mdzad par gyur pas na /
analyzed: mchog ni rnam par dag pa ste / des na de ni dam tshig mchog rnam pa thams cad du phan pa mdzad par gyur pas na /
translated: Supreme is the pure.

original: phan pa'i don chen po'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i don chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, since he is the one who acts for the benefit in every way, he is the one with the great benefit.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung ni gang 'khor ba thog ma med par gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par byung ba de'i mchog tu gyur pa ni khyed nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i thugs la gnas pa des sangs rgyas rnams mdzes par gyur
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung ni gang 'khor ba thog ma med par gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par byung ba de'i mchog tu gyur pa ni khyed nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i thugs la gnas pa des sangs rgyas rnams mdzes par gyur
translated: The supreme of those abides in your nondual mind, and by that the Buddhas are made beautiful.

original: cing / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas mnyam pa nyid la thugs brtse ba'o //
analyzed: cing / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas mnyam pa nyid la thugs brtse ba'o //
translated: And because he sees all phenomena as equality, he has compassion for equality.

original: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rin chen mang po'i gter gyur zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the treasure of many jewels of good qualities means that he is the cause of all perfections.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: zhi ba la sogs par gyur pa 'di ni ming dang gzugs rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs par gyur pa 'di ni ming dang gzugs rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: This peace and so on is the purity of name and form.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa ni gzugs ji srid skye mched drug ma thob pa'i bar ni ming ngad gzugs so ;
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa ni gzugs ji srid skye mched drug ma thob pa'i bar ni ming ngad gzugs so ;
translated: The embryo and so on is form, and name is whatever is not form up to the point of obtaining the six sense spheres.

original: / de lta bu'i glu zhes bya ba ni glus bslangs pa'o //
analyzed: / de lta bu'i glu zhes bya ba ni glus bslangs pa'o //
translated: Such a song is a song of praise.

original: ngor byas pa nges rang gi sngags kyi lus su gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ngor byas pa nges rang gi sngags kyi lus su gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should supply having made the face of the mantra body of his own deity, and having become the mantra body of his own deity.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: chos kun sgyu ma lta bur yang dag rig / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos kun sgyu ma lta bur yang dag rig / ces bya ba ste /
translated: He correctly knows all things to be like illusions.

original: dngos po ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu yin zhing sgyu ma dang mtshungs par yang dag par rig cing rtogs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa sgyu ma lta bu yin zhing sgyu ma dang mtshungs par yang dag par rig cing rtogs par gyur pa ste /
translated: He correctly knows, he realizes, that all things without exception are like illusions, are similar to illusions.

original: des na rgyud las /🔽ae ma'i kun du bzang po yi //
analyzed: des na rgyud las / ae ma'i kun du bzang po yi //
translated: Therefore, the Tantra says:🔽Amazing!🔽The one with the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
translated: is completely good.

original: skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: By the method of non-production,

original: skye ba 'di ni rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni rab tu bsgrags //
translated: this production is proclaimed.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'od zer kha dog lnga pa'i 'od do //
analyzed: snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'od zer kha dog lnga pa'i 'od do //
translated: With light and so on.  Light is the light of five-colored rays.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The circle is the circle of melted bodhicitta.

original: rang gi sngags kyi lus su rang nyid gyur //
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyi lus su rang nyid gyur //
translated: He himself becomes the mantra body of his own deity.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs de nyid mam las byung ba'i ral gri'i ngo @158b por gyur pa'o //🔽der ni 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni ral gri der kha dog lnga ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa ral gri'i nang du yid kyis bcug par gyur pa las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs de nyid mam las byung ba'i ral gri'i ngo @158b por gyur pa'o // der ni 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni ral gri der kha dog lnga ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa ral gri'i nang du yid kyis bcug par gyur pa las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: That very form of the melting moon becomes the nature of a sword born from the syllable MAM.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa gzhon nu lo brgyad lon pa'i rnam pa can zur phud lnga dang ldan pa shes rab rang bzhin can zhal gsum phyag drug pa sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dbus na sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa sgeg pa'i
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa gzhon nu lo brgyad lon pa'i rnam pa can zur phud lnga dang ldan pa shes rab rang bzhin can zhal gsum phyag drug pa sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dbus na sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa sgeg pa'i
translated: There, by the light, means that by the light rays of five colors in that sword, all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas enter the mind into the sword. From that, one becomes the form of Manjusri, the nature of wisdom, with three faces and six arms, adorned with the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being, in the posture of a bodhisattva on a variegated lotus and moon, with the appearance of an eight-year-old youth, and with five locks of hair.

original: nyams su yongs su gyur pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi skur gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su yongs su gyur pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi skur gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes the form of Manjusri, who is fully transformed into the experience of gracefulness.

original: sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag dang mtshon cha'i dbye ba bstan pa ni gur kum bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag dang mtshon cha'i dbye ba bstan pa ni gur kum bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the divisions of color, faces, hands, and weapons is stated by “excellent saffron” and so forth.

original: gur kum bzang po zhes bya ba ni gur kum ser po ste de dang 'dra bar mdog dmar ba 'bar ba'i mdangs gang la mnga' ba ste 'dod chags chen po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gur kum bzang po zhes bya ba ni gur kum ser po ste de dang 'dra bar mdog dmar ba 'bar ba'i mdangs gang la mnga' ba ste 'dod chags chen po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Excellent saffron” is yellow saffron, and he has a color like that, a red color with a blazing radiance, because he is the essence of great passion.

original: 'di ni cung zad ser po'i mdog can gyi dmar po yin gyi shin tu dmar pa'i mdog can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad ser po'i mdog can gyi dmar po yin gyi shin tu dmar pa'i mdog can ni ma yin no //
translated: This is a red color with a slight yellow tint, but not a very red color.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni sngon po g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni sngon po g-yon pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The right face is blue, and the left face is white.

original: 'di ni sman pa gso ba ngan par byas pa ltar /
analyzed: 'di ni sman pa gso ba ngan par byas pa ltar /
translated: This is like a bad doctor’s treatment.

original: g-yas pa dkar ba dang g-yon pa nag por 'chad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: g-yas pa dkar ba dang g-yon pa nag por 'chad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: There is an explanation that the right face is white and the left face is black.

original: de ni rdul gyis bsgos pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ni rdul gyis bsgos pa lta bu ste /
translated: That is like being smeared with dirt.

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhal mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir de ltar smras su zin kyang gzhung 'di ni log par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhal mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir de ltar smras su zin kyang gzhung 'di ni log par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Although it is said that Mañjuvajra is to be accomplished as having the face of Akṣobhya, this text is a false accomplishment.

original: phyag g-yon pa gnyis kyis ral gri dang mda' bsnams pa dang phyag g-yas ba gnyis kyis autpala sngon po dang gzhu bsnams par 'dod pa de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa gnyis kyis ral gri dang mda' bsnams pa dang phyag g-yas ba gnyis kyis autpala sngon po dang gzhu bsnams par 'dod pa de yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is also not reasonable to assert that he holds a sword and arrow in his two left hands and a blue lotus and bow in his two right hands.

original: gang yang des shes rab 'khyud pa'i phyag gnyis na rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams so snyam du sems pa de yang legs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yang des shes rab 'khyud pa'i phyag gnyis na rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams so snyam du sems pa de yang legs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is also not good to think that he holds a vajra and bell in the two hands embracing wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i bya bas phyag stong pa ma yin no snyam pa de yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i bya bas phyag stong pa ma yin no snyam pa de yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not good to think that the two hands are not empty due to the activity of embracing and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni skyes bu tha mal pa dga' bal nye bar longs spyod pa ltar phyag gnyis 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni skyes bu tha mal pa dga' bal nye bar longs spyod pa ltar phyag gnyis 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavān is not like ordinary men who enjoy the pleasures of the two hands.

original: gzhan du na shes rab dam pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid thabs dang bcas par gyur pa'i rang gi lus zhes 'og @159a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na shes rab dam pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid thabs dang bcas par gyur pa'i rang gi lus zhes 'og @159a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the explanation below that the body is the natural outflow of the essence of sublime wisdom and method.

original: nas bshad pas de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de dag bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: nas bshad pas de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de dag bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Vajra and Bell are present in order to care for sentient beings who engage in desire, as the natural outflow of the essence of wisdom and method endowed with the meaning of perfection.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for the Bhagavān to hold a vajra and bell with both hands.

original: 'o na te 'di skad du rdo rje dang dril bu ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'o na te 'di skad du rdo rje dang dril bu ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If it is said that the vajra and bell are the essence of wisdom,

original: ral gri yang shes rab kyi ngo bo yin pas de yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ral gri yang shes rab kyi ngo bo yin pas de yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: then since the sword is also the essence of wisdom, it would also be absent.

original: rdo rje thabs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje thabs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since the vajra is the essence of method,

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Akṣobhya and so on would not have that.

original: de bas na 'dir sgrub pa'i thabs mdzad pas ji skad bshad pa med bzhin du blta bar bya ba 'di nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sgrub pa'i thabs mdzad pas ji skad bshad pa med bzhin du blta bar bya ba 'di nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, here, the one who composes the means of achievement should view this as explained, even though it does not exist.

original: rgyud tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is reasonable, because the tantra is authoritative.🔽Adorned with various ornaments means that his body is adorned with bracelets, armlets, belts, pearl necklaces, anklets, and so on.

original: sna tshogs rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang ska rags dang mu tig gi do shal dang rkang gdub la sogs pa de dag gis sku la brgyan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis shes rab dam pa la thabs kyis 'khyud par
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang ska rags dang mu tig gi do shal dang rkang gdub la sogs pa de dag gis sku la brgyan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis shes rab dam pa la thabs kyis 'khyud par
translated: With his two hands he embraces the sublime wisdom with skillful means.

original: mdzad pa dang mdangs dang ldan pa'i 'od 'bar ba'i ral gri dang mda' nyid kyis phyag brgyan cing bsnams pa dang / autpa la sngon po dang gzhu bsnams par mdzad pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa dang mdangs dang ldan pa'i 'od 'bar ba'i ral gri dang mda' nyid kyis phyag brgyan cing bsnams pa dang / autpa la sngon po dang gzhu bsnams par mdzad pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: He is adorned with and holds a sword and arrow blazing with radiant light, and he holds a blue lotus and a bow.

original: de yang shes rab rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ral gri ste /
analyzed: de yang shes rab rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ral gri ste /
translated: Moreover, the sword is the essence of pure wisdom.

original: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
translated: The great sword is the vajra sharpness.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las kyang /
translated: And in the Vajra Essence Ornament Sutra:

original: bde gshegs dri med shes rab ni //
analyzed: bde gshegs dri med shes rab ni //
translated: The Sugata's stainless wisdom

original: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //
translated: is explained to be the vajra sharpness.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And:

original: thugs rje chen pos 'bigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mda'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis nyes pa'i 'dam thams cad kyis mgos pa ni autpala sngon po'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos 'bigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mda'o // rang bzhin gyis nyes pa'i 'dam thams cad kyis mgos pa ni autpala sngon po'o //
translated: The great compassion is the arrow.🔽The natural purity of the blue lotus is the blue lotus.

original: nyes pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa nyid ni gzhu'i rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa nyid ni gzhu'i rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The purity of the bow is the basis of all the Tathagata's qualities, the antidote to all faults.

original: mtha' yas 'od ldan zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ltar snang ba'i gzi brjid tshad med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas 'od ldan zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ltar snang ba'i gzi brjid tshad med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The great light is the sun, which has the nature of infinite light.

original: ma lus rigs rnams 'phro bas rnam brgyan zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro @159b bo'i rnam pa'i rigs ma lus pa de gang yin pa de nyid de la skyes shing de rnams 'bar ba'i 'od dang
analyzed: ma lus rigs rnams 'phro bas rnam brgyan zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro @159b bo'i rnam pa'i rigs ma lus pa de gang yin pa de nyid de la skyes shing de rnams 'bar ba'i 'od dang
translated: Adorned with the emanations of all the families means that the one who is that very one who is the emanation of all the families of the tathāgatas, goddesses, bodhisattvas, and wrathful ones is adorned with the blazing light of those emanations.

original: ldan pas rnam par 'phro bas rnam par brgyan cing sbud par byas pa'i nam mkha' ma lus pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gang gis mdzes par byas pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pas rnam par 'phro bas rnam par brgyan cing sbud par byas pa'i nam mkha' ma lus pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gang gis mdzes par byas pa ste /
translated: By that, the entire realm of space is filled and beautified with maṇḍalas.

original: 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po nyid yin par ston to //
translated: By these, it is taught that the Bhagavān is Samantabhadra himself.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la skyob pa mnga' bas na skyob pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la skyob pa mnga' bas na skyob pa'o //
translated: The protector is the one who has protection, and🔽in the Pramaṇavarttika,

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
translated: it is explained:

original: skyob pa nyid kyis gzigs lam ston //
analyzed: skyob pa nyid kyis gzigs lam ston //
translated: “The protector teaches the path of seeing.”

original: zhes bshad pas ji ltar thugs su chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas ji ltar thugs su chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa la bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that he teaches the path of omniscience and so forth, just as he has realized it.

original: 'di ni skye mched drug rnam par dag pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched drug rnam par dag pa la'o //
translated: This is the purification of the six sense spheres.

original: da ni don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs bsgoms pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs bsgoms pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom and skill in means is taught.

original: dngos rnams zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos rnams zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The verse says “things.”

original: gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The apprehended is form, etc.

original: 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa ste 'di dag ni don dam par dngos po med kyi byis pa skye bos brtags pa tsam du zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa ste 'di dag ni don dam par dngos po med kyi byis pa skye bos brtags pa tsam du zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The apprehender is the eye, etc. These are explained as ultimately non-existent, merely imputed by the childish.

original: gal te 'di yang dag par dngos po med na mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang mig la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bas na de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar skye bar 'gyur
analyzed: gal te 'di yang dag par dngos po med na mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang mig la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bas na de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar skye bar 'gyur
translated: If these are truly non-existent, since the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form apprehended by the eye, in the same way, how does the mental consciousness arise in dependence on the mental faculty and phenomena?

original: / de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: / de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: That is not so, because apart from the appearance as form, etc., there is no other apprehended object or apprehending subject.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa cung zad kyang nye bar ma dmigs te don dam par na stong pa'i gzugs snang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du yod par zad do //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa cung zad kyang nye bar ma dmigs te don dam par na stong pa'i gzugs snang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du yod par zad do //
translated: And it is not observed in the least to grasp, so ultimately it is just the mere characteristic of the appearance of empty form.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nang gi bdag nyid can ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyis stong ngo /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nang gi bdag nyid can ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyis stong ngo /
translated: And that is stated in the Perfection of Wisdom: “The internal is empty of the internal.

original: phyi ni phyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi ni phyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The external is empty of the external.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig ni mig gang ba nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: mig ni mig gang ba nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The eye is empty of the eye,

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is its nature.

original: de bzhin du gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: Similarly, form is empty of the nature of form,

original: yid dang chos ni yid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang chos ni yid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the mind and phenomena are empty of the nature of the mind and phenomena.”

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas gzung bar bya ba med pa la des na 'dzin @160a * //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas gzung bar bya ba med pa la des na 'dzin @160a * //
translated: Thus, since external things do not exist, the apprehended does not exist. Therefore, the apprehender

original: par byed pa'i mig la sogs pa dang bral bas 'dzin pa po yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: par byed pa'i mig la sogs pa dang bral bas 'dzin pa po yang med pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no eye, etc. that is the instrument of perception, there is also no perceiver.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis po dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i tshul de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid la gnas nas 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin sems tsam yang dor bar bya'o ;
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis po dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i tshul de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid la gnas nas 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin sems tsam yang dor bar bya'o ;
translated: Since there is no duality of the perceived and the perceiver, one should discard even the mere mind, the nature of the perceiver, by abiding in reality, the nature of suchness, which is the mode of non-duality.

original: / de ltar gnyi ga yang med pas dngos po ma lus pa thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med par shes nas rnam par byang ba rnam par dag pa ni kun du bzang po lta bu'i sems ni gnyen po bsgoms pa yin te /
analyzed: / de ltar gnyi ga yang med pas dngos po ma lus pa thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med par shes nas rnam par byang ba rnam par dag pa ni kun du bzang po lta bu'i sems ni gnyen po bsgoms pa yin te /
translated: Thus, since both are non-existent, having understood that all things are ultimately without essence, the purification of complete purification is the mind like Samantabhadra, which is the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de la mngon par zhe na pa med pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang bsgoms pa nye bar mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhe na pa med pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang bsgoms pa nye bar mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The absence of attachment there is the non-apprehension of the object of meditation, the meditator, and the meditation.

original: de ltar na de med cing zad pa dang spangs pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de med cing zad pa dang spangs pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the non-existence, exhaustion, and abandonment of that, one should bless.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags 'dis bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sngags 'dis bya'o //
translated: One should do this with the mantra taught in the Tantra, which will be explained below.

original: aom zhes bya ba ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni nges pa ste /
translated: Om means “certainty.”🔽“I am by nature the essence of the dharmadhatu” means that by the power of meditation, one focuses on the essence of mind and becomes free from adventitious defilements.

original: rang bzhin gyis bdag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ste bsgom pa'i stobs kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyid la dmigs nas glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bdag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ste bsgom pa'i stobs kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyid la dmigs nas glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: And it is explained:🔽Totally afflicted and completely pure,

original: de yang / kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: de yang / kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
translated: it is stained and stainless.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' bzhin //🔽dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' bzhin // dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: Like the water element, gold, and space,

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is pure in the same way that it is impure.

original: 'dir man ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the instruction here.

original: rgyal ba skyes mchog rnams kyi dri med dngos brten nas //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyes mchog rnams kyi dri med dngos brten nas //
translated: Relying on the stainless reality of the supreme victors,

original: phyi yi ma lus spod byed gnyis dang bral ba yi //
analyzed: phyi yi ma lus spod byed gnyis dang bral ba yi //
translated: one is free from the two, which completely purify the external.

original: sems la brten te sems ni sems tsam nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: sems la brten te sems ni sems tsam nyid du rtogs //
translated: Relying on the mind, one realizes that the mind is only mind.

original: de yang sna tshogs snang ba gcig pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de yang sna tshogs snang ba gcig pa nyid ma yin //
translated: And that is not the same as the appearance of variety.

original: sna tshogs reg pas du ma'i gzugs su 'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: sna tshogs reg pas du ma'i gzugs su 'ang ma yin te //
translated: Not even as a multiplicity of forms due to the variety of contacts.

original: de ltar thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs //
translated: Thus, everything is understood to be just non-existent.

original: 'di la dngos rnams rim gyis de gnyis bcas 'gyur la //
analyzed: 'di la dngos rnams rim gyis de gnyis bcas 'gyur la //
translated: Here, things are gradually endowed with those two,

original: slar yang sems de nyid ni de ltar bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: slar yang sems de nyid ni de ltar bsgom par bya // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and again, that very mind is cultivated in that way.

original: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i dam tshig gi yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i dam tshig gi yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: This is the correct application of the pledge of approach.

original: bsnyen pa ni de kho na nyid la bslab pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa ni de kho na nyid la bslab pa'o //
translated: Approach is training in reality.

original: de'i dam tshig ni rim gyis 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni rim gyis 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: Its pledge is the attainment of the result through stages.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the result that is in accordance with the cause is the approach.

original: bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: My own guru's guru said:

original: stong nyid la sogs bsnyen pa ste /
analyzed: stong nyid la sogs bsnyen pa ste /
translated: Approach is emptiness and so forth,

original: aom dang ma yi thog mtha' can //
analyzed: aom dang ma yi thog mtha' can //
translated: beginning with Om and ending with Ma.

original: @160b de yi 'bras bu rgyu mthun pa //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: @160b de yi 'bras bu rgyu mthun pa // zhes bshad pa yin no //
