translated: Its result in accordance with the cause🔽is the attainment of the result of separation.

original: de ni nye bar bsgrub pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni nye bar bsgrub pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the practice should be stated.

original: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa ni nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa ni nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya bar bshad la /
translated: The consecration of the eyes, etc. is explained as the “accomplishment.”

original: rnam par smin pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of that is the evolutionary.

original: de 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa la de 'og ces bya ba ni dam tshig dang pa snyen pa'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa la de 'og ces bya ba ni dam tshig dang pa snyen pa'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: After that, etc. “After that” means after the performance of the pledge and the service.

original: rang gi sa bon ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa ste /
translated: One’s own seed is Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: kshi dzr'im kham gam shkam sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kshi dzr'im kham gam shkam sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mantra is Kshi, Jri, Kham, Gam, Sham, Sam.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni go rims ma 'chol ba ste /
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni go rims ma 'chol ba ste /
translated: “As they are” means in the proper order.

original: kshim la sogs pa'i sa bon drug las byung ba'i 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung bas mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid la zhugs te sa bon de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs par byas nas sa'i snying po la sogs pa lha rnams bskyed la mig la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: kshim la sogs pa'i sa bon drug las byung ba'i 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung bas mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid la zhugs te sa bon de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs par byas nas sa'i snying po la sogs pa lha rnams bskyed la mig la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The wheel, vajra, jewel, lotus, sword, and the form of the vajra, which arise from the six seed syllables kṣiṃ and so on, enter the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind. The light rays of those seed syllables cause all the tathāgatas to enter, and the deities such as Kṣitigarbha are generated. The eyes and so on are made to have the nature of those.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sa la sogs pas de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sa la sogs pas de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that the consecration should be done in the same way with the earth and so on, and the consecration of the five aggregates such as form should be done with Vairocana and so on.

original: nye bar bsgrub pa'i cho ga 'dis ni reg pa rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa'i cho ga 'dis ni reg pa rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: This ritual of consecration should be explained as the purification of contact.

original: de yang / de yi 'bras bu rnam smin yin //
analyzed: de yang / de yi 'bras bu rnam smin yin //
translated: And that is the result, the maturation.

original: sgrub pa dag gis bshad par bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa dag gis bshad par bya //
translated: the practice will explain.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the practice is as follows.🔽The stainless, etc.

original: dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa la rang gi zla ba'i zhes pa rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la rdo rje'i lte ba zhes pa rdo rje'i chang gzungs kyi dbus su gnas pa'i yi ge h'um las snying gar thugs kyi rdo rje bsam pa dang /
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa la rang gi zla ba'i zhes pa rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la rdo rje'i lte ba zhes pa rdo rje'i chang gzungs kyi dbus su gnas pa'i yi ge h'um las snying gar thugs kyi rdo rje bsam pa dang /
translated: The “center of one’s vajra” is the letter HŪM located in the center of the vajra-womb, and the “mind-vajra” is the mind-vajra imagined in the heart from the letter HŪM.

original: de bzhin du kha dang mgo bor padma dang 'khor lo dag la gnas pa'i yi ge a'a: dang aom las byung ba'i gsung rdo rje ste 'od dpag tu med pa dang sku rdo rje ste rnam par snang mdzad bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha dang mgo bor padma dang 'khor lo dag la gnas pa'i yi ge a'a: dang aom las byung ba'i gsung rdo rje ste 'od dpag tu med pa dang sku rdo rje ste rnam par snang mdzad bsam par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the “speech-vajra” is the speech-vajra, Amitābha, imagined from the letter AḤ, and the “body-vajra” is the body-vajra, Vairocana, imagined from the letter OṀ, both located in the lotus and the wheel in the mouth and the head.

original: zla ba'i sgra smos pa nyid kyis me dang dbang chen dang chu dang rlug gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng na sna tshogs padma yod par dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i sgra smos pa nyid kyis me dang dbang chen dang chu dang rlug gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng na sna tshogs padma yod par dpag par bya'o //
translated: The mention of the moon indicates that the variegated lotus is located on the circles of fire, wind, water, and earth.

original: tshig le'u ra byas pa las dkyil 'khor ma smos na ji ltar 'di ltar dpag par byas te /
analyzed: tshig le'u ra byas pa las dkyil 'khor ma smos na ji ltar 'di ltar dpag par byas te /
translated: If the mandala is not mentioned in the verse, how is it imagined?

original: de ni legs pa ma yin no zhes brtag pa ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni legs pa ma yin no zhes brtag pa ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not investigate whether that is good or not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de skad rgyud las bshad pa la //🔽'dis ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i @161a * //
analyzed: de skad rgyud las bshad pa la // 'dis ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i @161a * //
translated: It is explained in the tantra.

original: rgyud kyi rim pa thams cad ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rim pa thams cad ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows all the stages of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: de yang bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: de yang bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Moreover, my own teacher said:🔽Air, water, and earth,

original: rlung dang chu dang 'brel pa dang // de bzhin yang ni dbang chen me //
analyzed: rlung dang chu dang 'brel pa dang // de bzhin yang ni dbang chen me //
translated: and likewise fire,

original: yam bam lam ram las byung ba //
analyzed: yam bam lam ram las byung ba //
translated: arise from yam, vam, lam, and ram.🔽Their colors are blue, white, yellow, and red,

original: mdog ni grangs bzhin sngo ba dang // dkar dang ser dang dmar ba dang // ba dan gyis mtshan bum par ldan //
analyzed: mdog ni grangs bzhin sngo ba dang // dkar dang ser dang dmar ba dang // ba dan gyis mtshan bum par ldan //
translated: respectively, and are marked with their respective banners and vases.

original: dbang chen mtshams su rdo rjes mtshan //
analyzed: dbang chen mtshams su rdo rjes mtshan //
translated: Earth is marked with a vajra in the cardinal directions.

original: rlung ni gzhu yi dbyibs can no //
analyzed: rlung ni gzhu yi dbyibs can no //
translated: Air is shaped like a bow.

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor zlum po ste //
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor zlum po ste //
translated: The water maṇḍala is round.

original: dbang chen zur bzhi pa nyid yin //
analyzed: dbang chen zur bzhi pa nyid yin //
translated: Earth is square.

original: me yi zur gsum rnam pa ste //
analyzed: me yi zur gsum rnam pa ste //
translated: Fire is triangular.

original: de yi dbus su rnam par bsgom //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yi dbus su rnam par bsgom //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Meditate on them in the center.

original: de ltar na snying gar me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du thugs rdo rje de'i gong brang du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ye shes sems dpa'/
analyzed: de ltar na snying gar me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du thugs rdo rje de'i gong brang du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ye shes sems dpa'/
translated: Thus, you should imagine that the mind vajra is on the fire mandala in the heart, the gnosis being is on the great lord mandala in the chest,

original: lkog mar chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gsung rdo rje /
analyzed: lkog mar chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gsung rdo rje /
translated: the speech vajra is on the water mandala in the throat,

original: mgo bo'i thod pa'i nang du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sku rdo rje bsam mo //
analyzed: mgo bo'i thod pa'i nang du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sku rdo rje bsam mo //
translated: and the body vajra is on the wind mandala in the skull of the head.

original: la la ni thugs rdo rje nyid ye shes sems dpa' yin no zhes 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: la la ni thugs rdo rje nyid ye shes sems dpa' yin no zhes 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Some assert that the mind vajra itself is the gnosis being.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not true.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rgyud las / snying ga'i dbus nas phra ba yi //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rgyud las / snying ga'i dbus nas phra ba yi //
translated: Why is it not true?🔽The tantra states:🔽Meditate on the subtle gnosis being

original: ye shes sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
translated: in the center of the heart.🔽Imagine that it is in the center

original: yi ge gnas kyi mchog gyur pa //🔽de yi dbus su chud par bsam //
analyzed: yi ge gnas kyi mchog gyur pa // de yi dbus su chud par bsam //
translated: of the supreme place of the syllable.

original: de ltar gnas ni bzhi po ru //
analyzed: de ltar gnas ni bzhi po ru //
translated: Thus, the four places🔽are the gnosis being.

original: zhes gsungs pas thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rje dang bzhi pa ni ye shes sems dpa' yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rje dang bzhi pa ni ye shes sems dpa' yin no //
translated: The four places are the mind vajra, the speech vajra, the body vajra, and the fourth, which is the gnosis being.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas par ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas par ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Well then, why didn't Buddhajñānapāda teach it in verse?

original: lan du smras pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: lan du smras pa nyid yin te /
translated: The answer is that he did teach it in verse.

original: dang por nang par snying ga'i zla dbus su //
analyzed: dang por nang par snying ga'i zla dbus su //
translated: At the beginning, in the middle of the moon at the heart,

original: dri med 'od zer rab tu 'phro ba'i mam //
analyzed: dri med 'od zer rab tu 'phro ba'i mam //
translated: the syllable mam, radiating stainless light rays,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang du smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang du smos pa yin no //
translated: and so forth.

original: de bas na ye shes sems dpa' med par dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par mi 'gyur bar shes par byas la /
analyzed: de bas na ye shes sems dpa' med par dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par mi 'gyur bar shes par byas la /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that without the gnosis being, the maṇḍala circle is not complete,

original: slob dpon gyis tshigs su bcad par ma gsungs pa'i som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis tshigs su bcad par ma gsungs pa'i som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: and one should not doubt that the master did not teach it in verse.

original: ye shes sems dpa' ni dam tshig sems dpa' ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' ni dam tshig sems dpa' ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: The gnosis being should be contemplated as the nature of wisdom and method, like the commitment being.

original: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of Cittavajra and so forth.

original: de'i thugs ka'i zhes bya ba la de'i zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi thugs ka'i ye shes kyi gzugs can gyi yi ge ste /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i zhes bya ba la de'i zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi thugs ka'i ye shes kyi gzugs can gyi yi ge ste /
translated: At its heart means at the heart of those [vajras], the gnosis-being letters.

original: de las byung @161b ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: de las byung @161b ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: The mass of light rays that arise from that.

original: shes rab dam pa ni rang rang gi rig pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab dam pa ni rang rang gi rig pa ste /
translated: The highest wisdom is one’s own awareness.

original: de rnams dang 'dus pa ni gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de rnams dang 'dus pa ni gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The union with those is the merging into one.

original: de'i 'od rnams kyis snang zhing gsal ba'i ngang tshul can gyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'od rnams kyis snang zhing gsal ba'i ngang tshul can gyis so //
translated: The nature of the light rays is to illuminate and shine.

original: des ji skad ston par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ji skad ston par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does that occur?

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i snying po'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mchod la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i snying po'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnams mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mchod la /
translated: The light rays that arise from the seed syllables of the essence of Akṣobhya and so forth worship the assembly of tathāgatas with various kinds of offerings.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bdag nyid byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bdag nyid byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: With this verse, one should request the consecration.

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Glorious” is because of being the lord of the maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje thugs 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed cing g-yo ba med pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni rdo rje thugs 'chang ba ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thugs 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed cing g-yo ba med pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni rdo rje thugs 'chang ba ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: He who holds the vajra mind is Akshobhya, who holds the vajra mind, which is indivisible and unmoving like a vajra.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum po rdo rje ltar mi phyed cing mi g-yo ba bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum po rdo rje ltar mi phyed cing mi g-yo ba bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas so //
translated: He who meditates on the three vajras of body, speech, and mind as indivisible and unmoving like a vajra is he who meditates on the three indivisible vajras.

original: 'dis ni don dam par thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam par thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that ultimately everything is the nature of everything.

original: deng bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rang bzhin gyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis rlob par mdzad du gsol zhes pa ste /
analyzed: deng bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rang bzhin gyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis rlob par mdzad du gsol zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, with I, etc., he says, I, a yogin of vajra mind, by nature indivisible, pray bless me to be the dharmadhatu.

original: bdag gi sems thugs rdo rje dang mnyam par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o /
analyzed: bdag gi sems thugs rdo rje dang mnyam par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o /
translated: May my mind become the same as vajra mind.

original: thugs rdo rje 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only vajra mind,

original: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bdag la byin gyis rlob par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bdag la byin gyis rlob par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: The yogins of body, speech, and mind vajras abiding in the ten directions should bless me.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Om and so forth.

original: thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bdag gi sems thugs rdo rje dang 'dra bar gyur to zhes aom gyis nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bdag gi sems thugs rdo rje dang 'dra bar gyur to zhes aom gyis nges par byas pa'o //
translated: By the blessing of the mind vajra and by the blessing of all the tathagatas, my mind has become like the mind vajra. This is ascertained by the om.

original: ye shes sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa yang rim pa 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa yang rim pa 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: The blessing by the gnosis being should also be done in this very sequence.

original: gsung rdo rje'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The verse of supplication to the speech vajra is stated:

original: chos kyi gsung lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi gsung lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The path of the speech of Dharma and so forth.

original: chos ni rdo rje chos te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni rdo rje chos te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Dharma is Vajradharma, Amitabha.

original: gsung lam ni gsung gi ngo bo ste chos thams cad ston ba la dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung lam ni gsung gi ngo bo ste chos thams cad ston ba la dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of speech is the essence of speech, because it is the mastery of teaching all dharmas.

original: @162a * // de nyid kyis na dpal ldan no //🔽gsung ni rdo rje can bdag la //
analyzed: @162a * // de nyid kyis na dpal ldan no // gsung ni rdo rje can bdag la //
translated: He is glorious by virtue of that.🔽The one who has the vajra of speech,

original: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs mdzod la //
analyzed: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs mdzod la //
translated: Bless my speech,

original: bdag gi ngag de dang 'dra bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi ngag de dang 'dra bar gyur cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: so that my speech may become like that, is the meaning.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Om and so forth is as before.

original: sku rdo rje'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa ni dpal ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa ni dpal ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse of supplication to Body Vajra is stated with Glorious Vajra, and so forth.

original: sku rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sku rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Body Vajra is Vairochana.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis shin tu mdzes pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sku chen po mnga' bas dpal ldan te des bdag gi lus byin gyis brlabs par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis shin tu mdzes pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sku chen po mnga' bas dpal ldan te des bdag gi lus byin gyis brlabs par mdzad de /
translated: He is glorious because he possesses a great body that is naturally very beautiful. With that, he blesses my body,

original: bdag gi lus rdo rje lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus rdo rje lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: so that my body becomes like a vajra, is the meaning.

original: aom zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Om and so forth is as before.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some say,

original: kun du bzang po'i thugs gang yin //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i thugs gang yin //
translated: The mind that is Samantabhadra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum byin gyis brlab pa'i don du 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum byin gyis brlab pa'i don du 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although these three verses are accepted as having the meaning of consecration,🔽the second verse is taught in the twelfth chapter, and the first verse is taught in the seventh chapter.🔽Therefore, they are not in the same context.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po nyid ston pas le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa de ni gnas skabs gzhan yin te mar me mdzad bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po nyid ston pas le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa de ni gnas skabs gzhan yin te mar me mdzad bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: As Mar-me-dzin-sang-bo says,

original: rjes dran bcu drug dag pa rnams //
analyzed: rjes dran bcu drug dag pa rnams //
translated: The sixteen purities of recollection

original: byed pa yin zhes der gsungs pa //🔽de ni thugs sogs byin brlab pa'i //
analyzed: byed pa yin zhes der gsungs pa // de ni thugs sogs byin brlab pa'i //
translated: are said to be the agent.

original: gnas skabs min phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: gnas skabs min phyir ma bshad do //
translated: Since they are not in the context of the consecration of mind and so on, they are not explained.

original: zhes bshad pas rjes su dran pa'i skabs su kun du bzang po'i thugs gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas rjes su dran pa'i skabs su kun du bzang po'i thugs gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the context of recollection, the text says, What is the mind of Samantabhadra? and so on.

original: sku gsum byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa 'dis ni tshor ba rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sku gsum byin gyis brlabs pa bstan pa 'dis ni tshor ba rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explanation of the consecration of the three bodies shows the purity of feeling.

original: da ni sgrub pa chen po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa chen po brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the great practice will be explained.

original: sgrub pa chen po ni dbang gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po ni dbang gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The great practice is the result of empowerment.

original: de bshad pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te don dam par nam mkha' lta bur dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje gsum po'i mtshan nyid de mtshan dang dpe byad kyi cha shas dang bral bar dmigs shing rnam par bsams
analyzed: de bshad pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te don dam par nam mkha' lta bur dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje gsum po'i mtshan nyid de mtshan dang dpe byad kyi cha shas dang bral bar dmigs shing rnam par bsams
translated: The explanation of that is “like space,” and so forth. The nature of the three vajras, which is ultimately like space, is the nature of non-entity, free from the parts of the major and minor marks, and is observed and imagined.

original: nas sgrub pa chen po brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: nas sgrub pa chen po brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Then, having done that, one should begin the great practice. This is the intention of the master.

original: sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor chen po la yang dang yang du bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor chen po la yang dang yang du bslab par bya ste /
translated: In order to stabilize the mind, one should train again and again in the great yoga.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin te //
translated: Everything has the nature of space,

original: sems kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: sems kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin du //
translated: and the mind also has the nature of space.

original: rnam par mi rtog nyid brten na //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog nyid brten na //
translated: By relying on non-conceptuality,

original: dogs @162b pa med pa nyid rab skye //
analyzed: dogs @162b pa med pa nyid rab skye //
translated: fearlessness itself arises.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is explained.

original: phyogs tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyogs bcu khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams snying po'i 'od zer rnams kyis yang dag bskul zhes pa ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul ba dang ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon
analyzed: phyogs tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyogs bcu khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams snying po'i 'od zer rnams kyis yang dag bskul zhes pa ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul ba dang ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon
translated: “The hosts of the ten directions” and so forth: the hosts of buddhas who pervade the ten directions are “perfectly invoked” by the light rays of the essence, meaning invoked by the light rays of the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being and awakened by the mass of light rays of the seed syllable of the gnosis being.

original: gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis sad par byas pa'i phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sgo las skyes pa'i spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs phyag gi mthil na bdud rtsi lnga'i chus yongs su gang ba'i
analyzed: gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis sad par byas pa'i phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sgo las skyes pa'i spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs phyag gi mthil na bdud rtsi lnga'i chus yongs su gang ba'i
translated: The light rays that arise from the hosts of tathāgatas in the maṇḍalas of the ten directions, which are awakened by the light rays of the seed syllable of the gnosis being, are the hosts of goddesses such as Locanā, who arise from the door, holding vases completely filled with the water of the five elixirs

original: bum pa bsnams pas dbang bskur ba dang mi bskyod pas rnam par brgyan pa'i cod pan du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa bsnams pas dbang bskur ba dang mi bskyod pas rnam par brgyan pa'i cod pan du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in the palms of their hands, who confer empowerment, and who become the diadems adorned with Akṣobhya. This is the meaning.

original: rang gi rigs kyi gtso bo ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi gtso bo ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa yin te /
translated: The chief of its own family is Akṣobhya, the lord of the family of Mañjuvajra,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the nature of the gnosis of the purity of the realm of reality.

original: spyi bor bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du mi bskyod pa bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rnams kyi man ngag yin no //
analyzed: spyi bor bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du mi bskyod pa bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rnams kyi man ngag yin no //
translated: The teacher's oral instruction is that one should visualize Akṣobhya above the maṇḍala of nectar at the crown of one's head.

original: dbang bskur bas ni sred pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur bas ni sred pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The consecration shows the purity of craving.

original: 'di ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
translated: This is the great accomplishment.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu dbang yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu dbang yin no //
translated: Its result is the consecration.

original: de ltar thabs mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yan lag bzhi po bstan pa yin no zhes bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thabs mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yan lag bzhi po bstan pa yin no zhes bdag gi bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, my teacher's teacher explained that the four branches of the method are taught.

original: thabs kyi bye brag gis shes rab khyad par can du 'gyur bas thabs bsgoms nas shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi bye brag gis shes rab khyad par can du 'gyur bas thabs bsgoms nas shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since wisdom becomes special by the distinction of the method, one should cultivate wisdom after cultivating the method.

original: 'dir la la dag yongs su rgol bar byed de sngar /
analyzed: 'dir la la dag yongs su rgol bar byed de sngar /
translated: Here, some object: Previously,

original: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba 'dis 'di'i shes rab bstan zin nas /
analyzed: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba 'dis 'di'i shes rab bstan zin nas /
translated: Having already explained his wisdom,

original: ji ltar na yang shes rab bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang shes rab bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: how then should one cultivate wisdom?

original: de ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.🔽The explanation of this statement,🔽His two hands embrace the sublime wisdom,

original: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba bstan pa 'di'i bshad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba bstan pa 'di'i bshad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: is as follows.

original: gzhan du na sngar yan lag cha shas yongs su rdzogs zin pas 'jam pa'i rdo rje sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan du na sngar yan lag cha shas yongs su rdzogs zin pas 'jam pa'i rdo rje sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, since the limbs and parts are already fully complete, it would be untenable to consecrate the body, speech, and mind of Manjushri.

original: ji ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs @163a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs @163a * //
translated: Just as the consecration of body, speech, and mind is tenable in order to demonstrate that,

original: pa'i bya ba 'thad pa de bzhin du shes rab bsgom pa yang rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa'i bya ba 'thad pa de bzhin du shes rab bsgom pa yang rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: in the same way, the cultivation of wisdom is also reasonable.

original: gzhan dag ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that this was stated by the master for the sake of consecrating the pledge seal.

original: rgyud kyi don la mngon par mi mkhas pa la la'i gzhung ni ji ltar /
analyzed: rgyud kyi don la mngon par mi mkhas pa la la'i gzhung ni ji ltar /
translated: Some who are not skilled in the meaning of the tantras explain this passage🔽with the words:🔽The two hands embrace the sublime wisdom,

original: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams 'dis 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: phyag gnyis shes rab dam pa 'khyud pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams 'dis 'chad par byed de /
translated: and so on up to:🔽The nature of the union is the emptiness of the union.

original: ji ltar 'byar ba'i ngang tshul ni 'byar ba stong pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste de ltar 'jam pa'i rdo rje 'ba' zhig nyid rnam par bsams la de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab bsgom par bya'o zhes zer mod kyi 'di ni shin
analyzed: ji ltar 'byar ba'i ngang tshul ni 'byar ba stong pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste de ltar 'jam pa'i rdo rje 'ba' zhig nyid rnam par bsams la de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab bsgom par bya'o zhes zer mod kyi 'di ni shin
translated: Thus, one should contemplate only Vajrapāṇi and meditate on wisdom with such and such, and so on.🔽This is very unreasonable.

original: tu yang mi 'thad de ci'i phyir rgyud las /🔽sngags kyi skyes bu ji snyed pa //
analyzed: tu yang mi 'thad de ci'i phyir rgyud las / sngags kyi skyes bu ji snyed pa //
translated: Why?🔽The tantra states:🔽All beings of mantra

original: rdo rje gsum gyi ye shes rdzogs //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi ye shes rdzogs //
translated: are perfected in the gnosis of the three vajras.

original: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the union of the two organs,

original: dngos po thams cad brtag par bya //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad brtag par bya //
translated: all things are to be imagined.

original: zhes gsungs pa la ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'dir rgya cher bshad par byed pa dag gis 'di na sngags kyi skyes bu gang ji snyed yod pa de thams cad bskyed pa'i dus kyi rjes thogs nyid nas shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor bas rnam par bsgom
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa la ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'dir rgya cher bshad par byed pa dag gis 'di na sngags kyi skyes bu gang ji snyed yod pa de thams cad bskyed pa'i dus kyi rjes thogs nyid nas shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor bas rnam par bsgom
translated: In this context, those who do extensive explanations of the phrase “as many as there are” say that all the mantra beings that there are here are meditated on by the union of wisdom and method immediately after the creation stage.

original: par bya'i gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya'i gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, those who explain as many as there are say that all of those mantra-persons who exist here, from the very moment of their generation, are to be meditated on by the union of wisdom and means, and not just one.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha 'jam pa'i rdo rje ci 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba'i mdangs mdzes pa'i lha mo gang yin pa rang gi snying po mam gyis sprul zhing bskyed bar bya zhing ji ltar
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha 'jam pa'i rdo rje ci 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba'i mdangs mdzes pa'i lha mo gang yin pa rang gi snying po mam gyis sprul zhing bskyed bar bya zhing ji ltar
translated: Thus, thus and so forth.  Thus means that one should emanate and generate a goddess who is as beautiful as one's deity, Mañjuvajra, with the syllable maṃ.

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur bar bya ba de bzhin du rig ma la yang bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur bar bya ba de bzhin du rig ma la yang bya'o //
translated: Just as Mañjuvajra is to be consecrated with the consecration of body, speech, and mind, so too is the knowledge-woman.

original: de nyid kyis na mig la sogs pa dgang zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mig la sogs pa dgang zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “filling the eyes, etc.,”

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pas dgang ba dang yi ge gsum rnam par dgod pas sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa des rig ma'i lus 'od dang ldan zhing 'bar ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pas dgang ba dang yi ge gsum rnam par dgod pas sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa des rig ma'i lus 'od dang ldan zhing 'bar ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: with the essence of the earth, etc., filling and the three syllables being placed, the consecration of body, speech, and mind, by which the body of the awareness-woman is radiant and blazing.

original: de ltar thabs dang 'dra bar thun mong gi mngon par 'du bya bas mngon par 'dus byas nas /🔽rgyud la sogs pa gsungs pa'i byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang 'dra bar thun mong gi mngon par 'du bya bas mngon par 'dus byas nas / rgyud la sogs pa gsungs pa'i byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, having been consecrated by the common performance of the method,🔽the consecration of the tantra, etc., is stated.

original: de nyid shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the consecration is stated in “knowing reality,” etc.

original: mgo dang zhes bya ba spyi bor aom snying gar h'um lte bar sv'a gsang ba'i padmar a'a: sogs @163b pa'i sgras brla gnyis nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar der yi ge h'a bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: mgo dang zhes bya ba spyi bor aom snying gar h'um lte bar sv'a gsang ba'i padmar a'a: sogs @163b pa'i sgras brla gnyis nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar der yi ge h'a bsam par bya ste /
translated: “Head,” etc., means that one should imagine the syllable oṃ at the crown, the syllable hūṃ at the heart, the syllable svā at the navel, and the syllable āḥ, etc., at the secret lotus, and so forth, beginning from the two thighs up to the feet, one should imagine the syllable ha.

original: 'di dag gis rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa ste /
translated: These are Vairochana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas yan lag byin gyis brlabs par bsgoms la /🔽sa gsum po khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i tshogs dam pa gang la yod pa'i yi ge aas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gsang ba'i lte ba gang yin pa yi ge h'um las padma 'dab ma brgyad
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas yan lag byin gyis brlabs par bsgoms la / sa gsum po khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i tshogs dam pa gang la yod pa'i yi ge aas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gsang ba'i lte ba gang yin pa yi ge h'um las padma 'dab ma brgyad
translated: One should visualize that one is consecrated by the five Tathagatas.🔽The secret navel, which is blessed by the syllable A, is the supreme collection of the garland of light rays, which is the nature of the five Tathagatas that pervade the three worlds.

original: pa'i gzugs can gyi gsang ba'i padma chos 'byung ba'i khongs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: pa'i gzugs can gyi gsang ba'i padma chos 'byung ba'i khongs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The secret lotus, which has the form of the syllable Hum, is the shape of an eight-petaled lotus.

original: lha'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni shes rab padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes rab dam pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni shes rab padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes rab dam pa ste /
translated: The statement of the purity of the deity is “the supreme wisdom lotus,” and so on. The nature of emptiness, which is free from all collections of conceptual elaborations, is the supreme wisdom.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi bden ba'i shes rab dang lhan cig tu 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul gyis sngags pas dga' ba kun du brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi bden ba'i shes rab dang lhan cig tu 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul gyis sngags pas dga' ba kun du brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The natural outflow is the result similar to the cause, the wisdom of conventional truth, together with which the mantrin should commence all joys, in the manner to be explained below.

original: shes rab thabs kyi spyor ba dang ldan pas don dam pa'i yul la kun du chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi spyor ba dang ldan pas don dam pa'i yul la kun du chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Endowed with the practice of wisdom and means, he is passionately attached to the object of ultimate truth.

original: de ltar rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i dus su lha'i nga rgyal khyad par can bskyed par bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i dus su lha'i nga rgyal khyad par can bskyed par bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, at the time of experiencing the great bliss of the union of the vajra and lotus, one should generate the special divine pride, which is expressed by Oṃ.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi cha gcig tu gyur pa'i sbyor bas rang bzhin gyi sems kun du bzang po nyid du yongs su dga' ba la brtson par aom zhes bya bar nges par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi cha gcig tu gyur pa'i sbyor bas rang bzhin gyi sems kun du bzang po nyid du yongs su dga' ba la brtson par aom zhes bya bar nges par bya ba'o //
translated: By the union of the ultimate and conventional aspects of all the tathāgatas becoming one, one should be certain in Oṃ, striving in the universal joy of one’s own nature, which is Samantabhadra.

original: shes rab bsgoms pas ni len pa rnam par dag pa bstan la /
analyzed: shes rab bsgoms pas ni len pa rnam par dag pa bstan la /
translated: By cultivating wisdom, the purity of grasping is taught.🔽Since the subsequent delight is the way of karma, it is the purity of existence.

original: rjes su mnyes pa ni las kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir srid pa rnam par dag pa yin te 'di dag bstan pas ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag bzhi pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mnyes pa ni las kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir srid pa rnam par dag pa yin te 'di dag bstan pas ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag bzhi pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: By teaching these, the four limbs of the nature of the path of seeing are the first application.

original: la la ni dbang bskur ba'i mthar thug pa la dbang po'i sbyor ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: la la ni dbang bskur ba'i mthar thug pa la dbang po'i sbyor ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that the application of the faculties is concluded by the empowerment.

original: da ni shes rab dang thabs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni shes rab dang thabs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to completely perfect wisdom and method in every way, the samādhi of the supreme king of maṇḍalas will be explained.

original: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin la /🔽de bshad @164a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin la / de bshad @164a * //
translated: This is the nature of the path of cultivation.

original: pa ni thugs ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa ni thugs ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Its explanation is “from the heart” and so on.

original: thugs ka'i zla ba zhes bya ba ni thugs ka'i zla ba'i nang du chud pa'i sngags yi ge mam gyi 'od rnams kyis phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i 'og nas bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams ma lus par zhugs pa tsam nyid kyi h'um gis byin

analyzed: pa lho dang nub kyi mtshams su bsam par bya'o //

analyzed: 'dra ba gang yin pa rlung gi phyogs te nub byang mtshams su bsam par bya'o //
