analyzed: de yang dri ma med pa rin po che'i phreng ba ste rin po che'i 'od kyi phreng ba gang yin pa des nam mkha'i khams kyi phyogs kyi tshogs ma lus par khebs shing g-yogs pa sku mdog rin chen 'byung ldan ltar ser zhing zhal dang phyag dang mtshon
translated: She is a stainless jewel garland, a garland of jewel light, which covers and fills the entire direction of the realm of space. Her body color is yellow like Ratnasambhava, with faces, hands, and implements like him.

original: cha yang de dang 'dra ba dbang ldan gyi phyogs zhes bya ba byang shar mtshams su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: cha yang de dang 'dra ba dbang ldan gyi phyogs zhes bya ba byang shar mtshams su bsam par bya'o //
translated: The direction of the powerful part is like that part, and should be imagined in the northeast corner.

original: 'khor lo bzang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyag g-yas pa'i gtso bo'i phyag mtshan spyan gyi ni 'khor lo bzang po ste 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyag g-yas pa'i gtso bo'i phyag mtshan spyan gyi ni 'khor lo bzang po ste 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: With good wheel, etc. The principal hand implement of the right hand of Locana is a good wheel, a wheel with twelve spokes.

original: m'a ma k'i'i ni autpala dmar po'o //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i ni autpala dmar po'o //
translated: For Mamaki it is a red lotus.

original: gos dkar mo'i ni padma'o //
analyzed: gos dkar mo'i ni padma'o //
translated: For Pandaravasini it is a lotus.

original: sgrol ma'i ni autpala gser gyi mdog can du bsam mo //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i ni autpala gser gyi mdog can du bsam mo //
translated: For Tara it is an utpala of the color of gold.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bdag po ji bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bdag po ji bzhin 'dod //
translated: The rest are as desired, like their lords.

original: ces bya ba ni rang gi bdag po dang 'dra ba las autpala dang padma ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang gi bdag po dang 'dra ba las autpala dang padma ston te /
translated: This shows that the lotus and utpala are like their own lords.

original: des na padma autpala de dag gcig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na padma autpala de dag gcig tu sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the lotus and utpala are combined into one.

original: cod pan la ni rang gi bdag po rnams bsam mo //
analyzed: cod pan la ni rang gi bdag po rnams bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine the lords on the crowns.

original: lha mo 'di dag thams cad sna tshogs padma'i steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la thams cad kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rang gi bdag po'i skus 'khyud pa bsam ste 'di la slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa las ci'i phyir de
analyzed: lha mo 'di dag thams cad sna tshogs padma'i steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la thams cad kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rang gi bdag po'i skus 'khyud pa bsam ste 'di la slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa las ci'i phyir de
translated: Imagine that all these goddesses are on variegated lotuses, on moon mandalas, and that they are all the nature of wisdom and method, embraced by the bodies of their respective lords.

original: skad ma gsungs zhes ba'i som nyi mi bya ste /
analyzed: skad ma gsungs zhes ba'i som nyi mi bya ste /
translated: Do not doubt why the master did not state this in verse.🔽The tantra states:

original: rgyud las / rig pa chen mo spyan la sogs //
analyzed: rgyud las / rig pa chen mo spyan la sogs //
translated: Mahāvidyā, Locanā, and so on,

original: rtag tu 'dod pa'i don @166a * //🔽brtson pa // 'dod pa'i longs spyod dag gis ni //
analyzed: rtag tu 'dod pa'i don @166a * // brtson pa // 'dod pa'i longs spyod dag gis ni //
translated: always strive for the desired goal.🔽By enjoying desired objects,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bsten na 'grub //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bsten na 'grub //
translated: one will accomplish whatever one desires.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du le'u dang po las sa rdo rje la sogs pa'i nges pa gsungs pas 'di skad du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du le'u dang po las sa rdo rje la sogs pa'i nges pa gsungs pas 'di skad du bshad par bya ste /
translated: And likewise, since the first chapter states the ascertainment of earth, vajra, and so on, this should be explained as follows.

original: sa rdo rje dang zhes gang gsungs pa de thams cad shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i rnam par dag pa gtso bor byas pa rgyud 'di rdzogs pa'i bar la ston pas de'i phyir rgyud kyi don mi shes pas rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs mi 'byed
analyzed: sa rdo rje dang zhes gang gsungs pa de thams cad shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i rnam par dag pa gtso bor byas pa rgyud 'di rdzogs pa'i bar la ston pas de'i phyir rgyud kyi don mi shes pas rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs mi 'byed
translated: All that is said, “earth is vajra,” and so on, is taught in this tantra up to the completion of the purification of the non-duality of wisdom and means, primarily. Therefore, one should not give an opportunity to conceptual thought by not knowing the meaning of the tantra.

original: pa'o // de nyid gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i mtshams su gyur pa me'i phyogs su spyan la sogs pa bzhi po dang / de bzhin du rtsa ba'i sgo'i ngos gnyis dang g-yas dang g-yon logs su gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i mtshams su gyur pa me'i phyogs su spyan la sogs pa bzhi po dang / de bzhin du rtsa ba'i sgo'i ngos gnyis dang g-yas dang g-yon logs su gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa lha mo drug bsam par bya'o //
translated: “The three realities” and so on. At the boundary of the maṇḍala wheel, in the fire direction, one should imagine the four, Locanā and so on, and likewise, on the two sides of the main door, on the right and left, the six goddesses, beginning with Rūpavajrā.

original: de dag kyang sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid lnga dang drug pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid lnga dang drug pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu ste /
translated: Those are the five, the nature of the five tathāgatas, beginning with Kāyavajra, and the sixth, Dharma­dhātu­vajra, is like Vajrasattva.

original: 'di rnams kyi thabs kyi ngo bo ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug bsam par bya'o //🔽gzugs rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis sa'i snying po la 'khyud pa g-yas na me long bsnams pa /🔽sgra rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa ltar sku mdog gnag pa la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis pi wang brdungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi thabs kyi ngo bo ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug bsam par bya'o // gzugs rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis sa'i snying po la 'khyud pa g-yas na me long bsnams pa / sgra rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa ltar sku mdog gnag pa la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis pi wang brdungs pa /
translated: The essence of the method of these is to be contemplated as the six bodhisattvas, Kṣitigarbha, and so on.🔽Rūpavajrā is similar to Vairocana, with the two principal hands embracing Kṣitigarbha, holding a mirror in the right hand.🔽Śabda­vajra is black, like Akṣobhya, with the two principal hands embracing Vajradhara, playing a vīṇā with the two right hands.

original: dri rdo rje ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'dra ba la phyag gnyis kyis nam mkha'i snying po la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis tsandan la sogs pas yongs su gang ba'i dung phor bsnams pa /
analyzed: dri rdo rje ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'dra ba la phyag gnyis kyis nam mkha'i snying po la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis tsandan la sogs pas yongs su gang ba'i dung phor bsnams pa /
translated: Gandhavajrā is similar to Ratnasaṃbhava, with the two hands embracing Ākāśagarbha, holding a conch cup filled with sandalwood and so on with the two right hands.

original: ro rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa dang 'dra ba la phyag gnyis kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: ro rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa dang 'dra ba la phyag gnyis kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug la 'khyud pa phyag gnyis kyis bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: Taste Vajra is similar to Amitābha, with two hands embracing Lokanātha, the other two hands holding skull cups filled with the five elixirs.

original: reg rdo rje don yod grub pa dang 'dra ba la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la 'khyud pa gnyis kyis gos bsnams pa /
analyzed: reg rdo rje don yod grub pa dang 'dra ba la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la 'khyud pa gnyis kyis gos bsnams pa /
translated: Touch Vajra is similar to Amoghasiddhi, with two principal hands embracing Nivāraṇaviṣkambhin, the other two hands holding cloth.

original: chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis kun du bzang po la 'khyud pa phyag lhag ma rnams rang gi bdag po dang 'dra ba las gzhan du na padma'i gnas su autpala'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba la rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis kun du bzang po la 'khyud pa phyag lhag ma rnams rang gi bdag po dang 'dra ba las gzhan du na padma'i gnas su autpala'o //
translated: Dharmadhātu Vajra is similar to Vajrasattva, with two principal hands embracing Samantabhadra, the remaining hands similar to one’s lord, except that an utpala is in the lotus location.

original: @166b byang chub sems dpa' lnga po'i zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan rnams de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: @166b byang chub sems dpa' lnga po'i zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan rnams de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang 'dra mod kyi /
translated: The faces, hands, and hand implements of the five bodhisattvas are similar to the five tathāgatas.

original: 'od kyang sa'i snying po'i phyag g-yas na ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: 'od kyang sa'i snying po'i phyag g-yas na ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan no //
translated: In the right hand of Kṣitigarbha is a wish-fulfilling gem victory banner.

original: sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'i phyag g-yas na ni zhi ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'i phyag g-yas na ni zhi ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: In the right hand of Nīvaraṇaviṣkambhin is a mudra of pacification.

original: kun du bzang po ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra'o //
translated: Samantabhadra is like Vajrasattva.

original: mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa tha dad par so sor tshig le'ur byas pa las ma bshad kyang 'di dag shar sgo'i ngos nas brtsams te byang shar gyi mtshams kyi bar gyi gnas su bskor phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa tha dad par so sor tshig le'ur byas pa las ma bshad kyang 'di dag shar sgo'i ngos nas brtsams te byang shar gyi mtshams kyi bar gyi gnas su bskor phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor
translated: Although the individual eyes, etc., and forms, etc., are not explained separately in the individual chapters, these are to be imagined as residing in the directions beginning from the eastern gate up to the northeastern corner, in the clockwise direction, upon variegated lotuses and moon maṇḍalas.

original: la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: They are to be imagined as seated in the sattva posture.

original: ya m'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ya m'anta kri ta ces brjod la gshin rje gshed dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: ya m'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ya m'anta kri ta ces brjod la gshin rje gshed dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: Yama, etc. Yama is to be generated as Yamāntaka.

original: de yang mtha' yas 'jigs 'od phyogs kun khyab dang ldan //
analyzed: de yang mtha' yas 'jigs 'od phyogs kun khyab dang ldan //
translated: He is also limitless, with the light of fear pervading all directions.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad med cing mi bzad par 'jigs pa'i 'od 'bar ba'i tshogs gang la mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad med cing mi bzad par 'jigs pa'i 'od 'bar ba'i tshogs gang la mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has a mass of blazing light that is immeasurable and unbearable.🔽He has the color of a circle of clouds at the end of an eon,

original: dus mtha' mi bzad sprin gyi dkyil 'khor mdog / ces bya ba ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus kyi sprin gyi mdog ltar mdangs nag po mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: dus mtha' mi bzad sprin gyi dkyil 'khor mdog / ces bya ba ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus kyi sprin gyi mdog ltar mdangs nag po mnga' ba'o //
translated: which is the color of the end of the eon of destruction.

original: thugs kyi rgyal po ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi rgyal po ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The king of minds is Akṣobhya.🔽He is similar in body to him, with a dark-colored body, and the other two faces are similar to him, appearing as the wrathful and fierce form of Yamāntaka.

original: de dang sku mtshungs pa ni sku mdog gnag cing zhal lhag ma gnyis kyang de dang 'dra bar drag cing gtum pa'i gshin rje gshed ltar snang ba'i rigs kyi 'od dpag tu med cing tshad med par rnam par 'phro zhing 'byin par snang la /
analyzed: de dang sku mtshungs pa ni sku mdog gnag cing zhal lhag ma gnyis kyang de dang 'dra bar drag cing gtum pa'i gshin rje gshed ltar snang ba'i rigs kyi 'od dpag tu med cing tshad med par rnam par 'phro zhing 'byin par snang la /
translated: The immeasurable and limitless light of the family of Amitābha shines forth and appears.

original: de rnams kyis gshin rje gshed kyi srog 'phrog par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas gshin rdzes mthar mdzad cing shin tu gdug pa'i sbrul 'jog po la sogs pas ral pa bcings pa mgul rgyan dang phyag gdub dang zhabs la sogs par byas pas sku lus kyi
analyzed: de rnams kyis gshin rje gshed kyi srog 'phrog par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas gshin rdzes mthar mdzad cing shin tu gdug pa'i sbrul 'jog po la sogs pas ral pa bcings pa mgul rgyan dang phyag gdub dang zhabs la sogs par byas pas sku lus kyi
translated: Since they have the nature of stealing the life of Yamantaka, they are the finality of Yama, and since they bind the hair with extremely wrathful snakes such as Ananta, they are adorned with ornaments such as a necklace, armlets, and anklets on the body.🔽Since they are endowed with the glory of subduing those difficult to subdue, they are naturally the essence of the first [buddha].

original: yan lag brgyan cing gdul dka' ba 'dul bar mdzad pa'i dpal dang ldan pa ste de nyid kyis na rang bzhin gyis dang po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa shar gyi sgor nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag brgyan cing gdul dka' ba 'dul bar mdzad pa'i dpal dang ldan pa ste de nyid kyis na rang bzhin gyis dang po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa shar gyi sgor nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine them on the sun maṇḍala in the eastern door.

original: pradzny'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pradzny'a nta kri ta ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: pradzny'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pradzny'a nta kri ta ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyis khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: “Prajñā” and so on: One should generate the wrathful Acala with the mantra “prajñāntakṛt” and so on.

original: bla med 'od ces bya ba shes rab mthar byed lta bu'i 'od zer 'phro bar gyur pa dang sku'i rdo rje @167a * //
analyzed: bla med 'od ces bya ba shes rab mthar byed lta bu'i 'od zer 'phro bar gyur pa dang sku'i rdo rje @167a * //
translated: The one called Supreme Light, who is like Wisdom-Destroyer, emits light rays and is Body-Vajra.

original: zhes bya ba zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang 'di'i phyag g-yon du 'khor lo bsam par bya'o zhes bdag gi bla ma bzhed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang 'di'i phyag g-yon du 'khor lo bsam par bya'o zhes bdag gi bla ma bzhed do //
translated: My guru explains that although the one called Body-Vajra is similar to Vairochana in face, hands, implements, and color, one should imagine a wheel in his left hand.

original: gzhan yang drag po ni khyab 'jug 'dul bar mdzad pas shin tu drag cing gtum pa'o//
analyzed: gzhan yang drag po ni khyab 'jug 'dul bar mdzad pas shin tu drag cing gtum pa'o//
translated: Moreover, since Shiva is the one who tames Vishnu, he is very wrathful and fierce.

original: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la padm'anta kri ta ces bya ba'i sngags kyis rta mgrin dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la padm'anta kri ta ces bya ba'i sngags kyis rta mgrin dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: With regard to the one called Lotus and so forth, one should generate Hayagriva with the mantra Padmantakrita.

original: bo rnams 'jigs par byed pa'i ha ha zhes bzhad pa'i khro bo'i bzhad pa chen pos ti se la sogs pa'i ri bo 'dzin par byed pa dang / de na gnas pa'i thub pa'i dbang po kun ba ged  gzhon nu la sogs pa 'jig rten du thub dbang du sgrar grags pa gang gis rnam par 'jig cing gsal bar mdzad pa nub phyogs kyi sgor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bo rnams 'jigs par byed pa'i ha ha zhes bzhad pa'i khro bo'i bzhad pa chen pos ti se la sogs pa'i ri bo 'dzin par byed pa dang / de na gnas pa'i thub pa'i dbang po kun ba ged  gzhon nu la sogs pa 'jig rten du thub dbang du sgrar grags pa gang gis rnam par 'jig cing gsal bar mdzad pa nub phyogs kyi sgor bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the great laughter of the wrathful one, which is a “ha ha” that terrifies the hosts of obstructors, is the laughter that shakes Mount Meru, Mount Kailash, and so forth, and that the great laughter that is the sound of the “ha ha” that terrifies the hosts of obstructors is the sound that destroys and illuminates all the lords of sages, such as Kumārabhṛta, who are renowned as lords of sages in the world.

original: bighn'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bighn'a nta kri ta ces bya ba'i sngags kyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bighn'an zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bighn'a nta kri ta ces bya ba'i sngags kyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: One should imagine that the mantra “vigha” and so forth causes Amṛtakuṇḍali to emerge.

original: dpa' bo ni tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa'i bgegs rnams 'joms par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni tshogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa'i bgegs rnams 'joms par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The hero is Gaṇeśa, who destroys the obstructors.

original: dus mtha'i me ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i me ste /
analyzed: dus mtha'i me ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i me ste /
translated: The fire at the end of time is the fire that destroys the eon.

original: de dang 'dra bar drag cing gtum pa'i khro bo rang dang 'dra ba'i tshogs spro bar mdzad pa dang de bzhin du 'phags pa'i zhal la sogs mi bskyod pa dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan sku mdog thugs rdo rje dang 'dra ba
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar drag cing gtum pa'i khro bo rang dang 'dra ba'i tshogs spro bar mdzad pa dang de bzhin du 'phags pa'i zhal la sogs mi bskyod pa dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan sku mdog thugs rdo rje dang 'dra ba
translated: The face, hands, hand implements, and body color are like Vajra Mind.

original: byang gi sgor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgor bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize him at the northern gate.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gshin rje gshed kyi cod pan la ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gshin rje gshed kyi cod pan la ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairochana and so on. On the crown of Yamantaka is Vairochana.

original: shes rab mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: On the crown of Prajnantaka is Akshobhya.

original: padma mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: padma mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: On the crown of Padmantaka is Amitabha.🔽On the crown of Vighnantaka is Akshobhya.🔽In this way, one should visualize them in order.

original: bgegs mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni mi bskyod pa ste de ltar rim bzhin du bsam pa @167b dang gshin rje gshed kyi phyag g-yas par tho ba /
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed kyi cod pan la ni mi bskyod pa ste de ltar rim bzhin du bsam pa @167b dang gshin rje gshed kyi phyag g-yas par tho ba /
translated: In Yamantaka's right hand is a hammer.

original: shes rab mthar byed kyi dbyug pa /
analyzed: shes rab mthar byed kyi dbyug pa /
translated: In Prajnantaka's hand is a club.

original: padma mthar byed kyi padma /
analyzed: padma mthar byed kyi padma /
translated: In Padmantaka's hand is a lotus.

original: bgegs mthar byed kyi rdo rje yang rim bzhin du bsam mo //
analyzed: bgegs mthar byed kyi rdo rje yang rim bzhin du bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine the vajra of Vighnāntakṛt in the same way.

original: la la ni rdo rje zhes smos pas sna tshogs rdo rje yin par 'dod do //🔽yang 'di dag go rims bzhin du ro langs ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang khro gnyer ma dang ral pa gcig ma ste lha mo bzhi dang snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs par bsam par bya ba dang thams cad kyang g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas sna tshogs
analyzed: la la ni rdo rje zhes smos pas sna tshogs rdo rje yin par 'dod do // yang 'di dag go rims bzhin du ro langs ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang khro gnyer ma dang ral pa gcig ma ste lha mo bzhi dang snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs par bsam par bya ba dang thams cad kyang g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas sna tshogs
translated: Some maintain that since the vajra is mentioned, it is a crossed vajra.

original: padma'i steng na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i steng na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa /
translated: One should imagine that they are in union with the four goddesses, Vetālī, Aparājitā, Ḍākinī, and Ekajaṭī, respectively, and that they are standing in the extended-left-leg posture on variegated lotuses with sun maṇḍalas.

original: zhal mche ba gtsigs pa dbu skra kyen  du brdzes pa /
analyzed: zhal mche ba gtsigs pa dbu skra kyen  du brdzes pa /
translated: They have bared fangs, disheveled hair,🔽yellow beards, wagging tongues, open mouths, and are laughing with wrath.

original: sma ra ser ba ljags bskyod pa zhal gdangs pa khro ba dang bcas pa bzhad pa de ltar yongs su rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis kun nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la kun du
analyzed: sma ra ser ba ljags bskyod pa zhal gdangs pa khro ba dang bcas pa bzhad pa de ltar yongs su rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis kun nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la kun du
translated: In this way, one should imagine the complete maṇḍala wheel as previously explained.

original: bzang po'i rnal 'byor par rnam par bltas nas dngos po thams cad kyis ni zhes pa sa'i snying po la sogs pas skye mched drug byin gyis brlabs pas rdzogs par bya zhing sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bzang po'i rnal 'byor par rnam par bltas nas dngos po thams cad kyis ni zhes pa sa'i snying po la sogs pas skye mched drug byin gyis brlabs pas rdzogs par bya zhing sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Having seen the good yogi, one should complete all things, that is, the consecration of the six sense bases by Kṣhitigarbha and so on, and also complete the consecrations of body, speech, and mind.

original: snying po'i sngags ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: snying po'i sngags ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon te /
translated: The essence mantra is the seed of the gnosis being.

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa bkug ste bcug pa bcings nas dbang du bya ste yi ge dza: mdog dmar po bsams /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa bkug ste bcug pa bcings nas dbang du bya ste yi ge dza: mdog dmar po bsams /
translated: Having invoked the Tathāgata in the aspect of the gnosis maṇḍala with light rays arisen from that, having entered, bound, and controlled, one should imagine a red letter jheṃ.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug la h'um mdog nag pos dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bcug ste bam mdog gser pos re re zhing sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje thugs ka dang lkog ma dang spyi bor byin gyis
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug la h'um mdog nag pos dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bcug ste bam mdog gser pos re re zhing sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje thugs ka dang lkog ma dang spyi bor byin gyis
translated: The light rays from that draw in the tathāgatas residing in the ten directions, and the black-colored hūṃ causes them to enter into the center of the maṇḍala. The yellow-colored vaṃ consecrates each of them with vajra body, speech, and mind at the heart, throat, and head.

original: brlab pa byas la yi ge ho: mdog dkar pos dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: brlab pa byas la yi ge ho: mdog dkar pos dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, the white-colored hoḥ consecrates the gnosis beings of all the maṇḍala deities.

original: da ni bsrung ba'i cho ga gsungs pa ni shes rab thabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te don dam pa'i bdag nyid can shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can gyi ting nge 'dzin rdo
analyzed: da ni bsrung ba'i cho ga gsungs pa ni shes rab thabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te don dam pa'i bdag nyid can shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can gyi ting nge 'dzin rdo
translated: Now, the explanation of the rite of protection is stated with “wisdom and method,” and so on. The vajra samādhi, which has the nature of wisdom and method, the ultimate nature, the ultimate unchanging nature,

original: rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor @168a * //
analyzed: rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor @168a * //
translated: is the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: ba de las byung zhing skyes pa shin tu bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i ngo bor gcig tu mthar thug pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsams nas de nas de'i rjes la bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba de las byung zhing skyes pa shin tu bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i ngo bor gcig tu mthar thug pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsams nas de nas de'i rjes la bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Having imagined the wheel of the maṇḍala that has arisen from that, which has arisen from the syllable bhrūṃ, which is of the nature of the experience of supreme bliss, and which is finally one, then after that one should protect it.

original: gang gis she na gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pas bshad pa zhes smos te des ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis she na gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pas bshad pa zhes smos te des ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: By whom? He says, “by Yamāntaka and so forth.” How does he do that?

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo rang gi lus las byung ba /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo rang gi lus las byung ba /
translated: The wrathful ones such as Yamāntaka arise from one’s body.

original: gzugs shin tu 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo rnams kyis bgegs dang gdug pa thams cad rnam par bsreg par bsams la /
analyzed: gzugs shin tu 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo rnams kyis bgegs dang gdug pa thams cad rnam par bsreg par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine that the wrathful ones, whose forms are extremely terrifying, burn all obstructors and evildoers.

original: de dag nyid rdo rje lu gu rgyud du yongs su gyur nas des steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa las byung ba'i rdo rje'i dra bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid rdo rje lu gu rgyud du yongs su gyur nas des steng dang 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa las byung ba'i rdo rje'i dra bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: Those [wrathful ones] transform into vajra chains, and one should imagine that they arise as a vajra net, consecrated above and below by a crossed vajra.

original: de ltar srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas dbang bskur ba la sogs pa mchod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas dbang bskur ba la sogs pa mchod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having thus meditated on the protection wheel, the ritual of the offerings such as the empowerment is taught.🔽

original: rang gi snying pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi snying pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Having thus meditated on the protection wheel, the rite of worship is taught, such as the consecration, with the mantra of oneself, etc.

original: rang gi sngags kyis mchod yon la bzlas la tsandan dang gur kum dang ga bur la sogs pa dang me tog ste mand'a rab dang autpala dang kar b'i ra dang dz'a ti dang ma li ka la sogs pa'i me tog dang bcas pa'i mchod yon gyi snod bshams
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyis mchod yon la bzlas la tsandan dang gur kum dang ga bur la sogs pa dang me tog ste mand'a rab dang autpala dang kar b'i ra dang dz'a ti dang ma li ka la sogs pa'i me tog dang bcas pa'i mchod yon gyi snod bshams
translated: With the mantra of oneself, one should recite over the water for welcoming, and set out the vessel of welcoming, together with sandal, saffron, camphor, etc., and flowers, i.e., mandarabha, utpala, karavira, jati, mallika, etc.

original: la dkyil 'khor ba'i lha thams cad la mchod yon gyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: la dkyil 'khor ba'i lha thams cad la mchod yon gyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate all the deities of the mandala with the welcoming water.

original: 'dis ni dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba dang phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yang ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba dang phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yang ston pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the consecration with the hanging banner, the consecration with the garland, etc.

original: de nas rang la byas pa lta bur zhes pa bdag nyid la byas pa dang 'dra bar snying po'i sngags kyis bskul ba'i nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi 'od zer gyi sgo las byung ba'i lha'i tshogs phyag na bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang
analyzed: de nas rang la byas pa lta bur zhes pa bdag nyid la byas pa dang 'dra bar snying po'i sngags kyis bskul ba'i nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi 'od zer gyi sgo las byung ba'i lha'i tshogs phyag na bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang
translated: Then, “just as it was done for me” means that just as it was done for oneself, the assembly of buddhas residing in the sky, invoked by the essence mantra, give rise to the assembly of deities from the door of light rays of the five amṛtas completely filling the hands of the deities.

original: ba'i bum pa bsnams pas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i bum pa bsnams pas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, “as if they were done to oneself” means that, as if done to oneself, the assembly of Buddhas dwelling in space, urged on by the essence mantra, should be empowered by the host of deities arisen from the door of light rays, holding vases completely filled with the five nectars in their hands.

original: de ltar cho ga 'dis kun nas mngon par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar cho ga 'dis kun nas mngon par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should worship with this rite.

original: padma zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi gsang ba'i padma'i nang du rang gi sa bon 'od rnams kyi zhes bya ba dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram zhes bya ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo thams cad spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi gsang ba'i padma'i nang du rang gi sa bon 'od rnams kyi zhes bya ba dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram zhes bya ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo thams cad spyan drangs nas /
translated: “Lotus” means that, within the secret lotus of wisdom, one’s seed syllable, with the light rays called “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” invites all the goddesses such as Rūpavajrā.

original: yang dag byang chub yid kyi ngo bo yin //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub yid kyi ngo bo yin //
translated: The true enlightenment is the nature of mind.

original: zhes bya ba zla ba'i dkyil @168b 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od zer lnga pa'i dkyil 'khor pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba zla ba'i dkyil @168b 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od zer lnga pa'i dkyil 'khor pas so //
translated: Thus, with the mandala of the five lights of the bodhicitta that has the aspect of a moon mandala.

original: de nas byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid shes rab ba spu re re las byung ba zhes bya ba ba spu'i bu ga'i tshogs re re las byung ba'i 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid shes rab ba spu re re las byung ba zhes bya ba ba spu'i bu ga'i tshogs re re las byung ba'i 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: Then, that very mandala of bodhicitta is the light rays that arise from each pore, that is, the various kinds of light rays that arise from each collection of pores.

original: nag po dang dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i 'od zer 'phros pa'i chogs rgya chen pos nam mkha'i khams kyi gtos ma lus par kun nas yongs su khyab par gyur la /
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i 'od zer 'phros pa'i chogs rgya chen pos nam mkha'i khams kyi gtos ma lus par kun nas yongs su khyab par gyur la /
translated: The great mass of light rays that radiate in black, white, yellow, red, and green completely pervades the entire realm of space.

original: de bas na blo dang ldan zhing rnal 'byor la mkhas pas rab tu spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na blo dang ldan zhing rnal 'byor la mkhas pas rab tu spro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise and skilled yogī should radiate them.

original: ji ltar spro bar bya zhe na 'od kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar spro bar bya zhe na 'od kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is asked how they are radiated, the light rays that arise from each pore are the light rays that arise from each pore.

original: ba spu'i tshogs re re'i khung bu las nges par byung ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las skyes pa'i gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis rgyal ba'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: ba spu'i tshogs re re'i khung bu las nges par byung ba'i 'od kyi rtse mo las skyes pa'i gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis rgyal ba'i dbang po ste /
translated: With goddesses such as Rupavajra, born from the tips of light rays that definitely emerge from each pore of his body, he should make excellent offerings to the lords of the victors,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams legs par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams legs par mchod par bya'o //
translated: the mandala deities such as Vairochana.🔽By what means? He who is adorned with ornaments such as necklaces, bracelets, anklets, armlets, and rings, which are made of stainless Jambu River gold and jewels,

original: ji lta bus she na gang gi sku'i yan lag dri ma med pa'i 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser dang nor bus sbras pa'i do shal dang dpung rgyan dang 'og pag dang phyag gdub dang zhangs gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kyis brgyan cing sbud pa gang yin pa
analyzed: ji lta bus she na gang gi sku'i yan lag dri ma med pa'i 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser dang nor bus sbras pa'i do shal dang dpung rgyan dang 'og pag dang phyag gdub dang zhangs gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kyis brgyan cing sbud pa gang yin pa
translated: and who is resplendent.

original: de me long dang pi wang ste dgu bo'i rgyud mangs dang dri ste ga pur gur kum tsandan gla rtsi bzhi po cha mnyam gyis yongs su gang ba'i dung phor dang ro'i snod de bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i thod pa dang gos te rgya yul gyi🔽dar mdog bzangs la sogs pa dang chos 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de me long dang pi wang ste dgu bo'i rgyud mangs dang dri ste ga pur gur kum tsandan gla rtsi bzhi po cha mnyam gyis yongs su gang ba'i dung phor dang ro'i snod de bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i thod pa dang gos te rgya yul gyi dar mdog bzangs la sogs pa dang chos 'byung ba ste /
translated: The mirror, the lute, the conch shell filled with the four equal parts of camphor, saffron, sandalwood, and musk, the skull cup filled with the five elixirs, the cloth, the Dharma source, and so on.

original: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang sogs pa zhes bya bas gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzhan dag rim gyis bsnams pa'i phyag rnam pa gnyis dang rnam par sgeg pa dang bcas shing rol pa'i mdangs dang ldan pa'i gzugs brnyan byung ba me long la
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang sogs pa zhes bya bas gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzhan dag rim gyis bsnams pa'i phyag rnam pa gnyis dang rnam par sgeg pa dang bcas shing rol pa'i mdangs dang ldan pa'i gzugs brnyan byung ba me long la
translated: The mirror reflects the image of the two hands holding the implements of the Dharma source and so on, the parasol, victory banner, and so forth, in sequence, and the form endowed with the radiance of playfulness and charm.

original: snang ba'i 'od kyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba'i 'od kyi snang ba ste /
translated: The light of the appearance

original: rang gi lus kyi 'od rnams kyis sbrul pa'i mchod pa me tog dang bdug sbos dang mar me dang dri dang gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs pa de rnams sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu ste sgyu ma dang
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi 'od rnams kyis sbrul pa'i mchod pa me tog dang bdug sbos dang mar me dang dri dang gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs pa de rnams sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu ste sgyu ma dang
translated: Those various clouds of offerings appear individually like illusions and so forth, like an illusory city, an echo, and the reflection of the moon in water.🔽One should know and understand that ultimately things are individually illusory and so forth.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dang brag ca dang chu zla lta bur so sor snang ba ni dngos po rnams don dam par sgyu ma la sogs pa so sor yang dag par rig cing shes pa ste des 'jig rten pa'i ngo bo rig cing lta @169a * //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dang brag ca dang chu zla lta bur so sor snang ba ni dngos po rnams don dam par sgyu ma la sogs pa so sor yang dag par rig cing shes pa ste des 'jig rten pa'i ngo bo rig cing lta @169a * //
translated: By that, one should know and see the nature of the world.

original: ba la mkhas pa de kho na nyid du na dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: ba la mkhas pa de kho na nyid du na dngos po med pa'o //
translated: In reality, things are non-existent.

original: rtog pa ma lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la so so rang gis rig pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo rab tu bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa ma lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la so so rang gis rig pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo rab tu bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: As for all conceptual thoughts, and so forth, it is because it is the cause for fully generating the supreme bliss of individual self-awareness, the nature of the highest joy.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje zhes bya ba mchod pa'i lha mo rnams dang de gcig pur ma zad kyi de bzhin du phyi'i dri ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje zhes bya ba mchod pa'i lha mo rnams dang de gcig pur ma zad kyi de bzhin du phyi'i dri ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not only that, but also external perfumes and so on,

original: dri dang me tog dang bdug sbos dang mar me dang lha bshos dang da ra dang rin po che la sogs pas yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang me tog dang bdug sbos dang mar me dang lha bshos dang da ra dang rin po che la sogs pas yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: perfumes, flowers, incense, lamps, food, parasols, jewels and so on should be offered.

original: de ltar tha dad rtog pas nges grol bya ;
analyzed: de ltar tha dad rtog pas nges grol bya ;
translated: Thus, one should be liberated by the conception of difference.

original: / zhes bya ba ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa po dang mchod pa nye bar mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa po dang mchod pa nye bar mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: This means that one should make offerings with the complete purity of the three spheres, since the object of offering, the one who offers and the offering are not perceived.

original: 'di ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
translated: One should generate pride in this way.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid ni bdag go zhes brjod la snying gar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid ni bdag go zhes brjod la snying gar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsam par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ, etc. By nature I am the essence of the supramundane vajra worship of all the tathāgatas, one should say, and imagine the wheel of the maṇḍala in one's heart.

original: da ni bstod pa gsungs pa ni sgra'i yul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽brag ca'i sgra 'dra zhes bya ba ni snying gar gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor la ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnams bsgoms la phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can thams cad
analyzed: da ni bstod pa gsungs pa ni sgra'i yul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / brag ca'i sgra 'dra zhes bya ba ni snying gar gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor la ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnams bsgoms la phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can thams cad
translated: Now, the praise is stated, beginning with the words, the objects of sound, etc.🔽The line like an echo means that one should meditate on the buddhas, like the five tathāgatas, from the seed syllable of the jñānasattva in the maṇḍala at the heart, through the door of the light rays, and then praise the five tathāgatas with the mind itself, having ascertained that everything, both outer and inner,

original: sems nyid yin par yongs su brtags la sems nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems nyid yin par yongs su brtags la sems nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bstod par bya'o //
translated: is mind itself.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ni mi bskyod pa ste /

original: rin chen rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kye bcom ldan 'das rin chen rgyal po rab tu dang ba'i 'od 'bar ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes can rab tu zab pa tshad med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi spyod

translated: The phrase wisdom of sameness means that he is the wisdom of sameness because he is the wisdom of the sameness of all phenomena.🔽 The phrase extremely profound means that he is extremely profound because he is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.🔽 The phrase inconceivable means that he is inconceivable because he is the object of the wisdom of the buddhas.🔽 The phrase possessor of all immeasurable good qualities means that he is the possessor of all immeasurable good qualities because he is the possessor of all good qualities.🔽 The phrase conduct of the sky means that he is the conduct of the sky because he is the conduct of the sky of the dharmadhātu.🔽 The phrase vajra of all aspects means that he is the vajra of all aspects because he is the vajra of all aspects.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyes bas ma gos pas na dri med nam mkha'o //
translated: The phrase sky of the stainless means that he is the sky of the stainless because he is the sky of the stainless.🔽 The phrase

translated: O Bhagavān, the vajra of immortality, the essence of immeasurable wisdom, the wisdom of discernment, the great king because you cannot be conquered by any power,

analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //

analyzed: // bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
