translated: The essence light rays are immeasurable.

original: zhes pa ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis sprul pa'i thub pa'i mchog sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mi shes pa thams cad kun du nges par gsal ba'i sems brtan par byas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' des
analyzed: zhes pa ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis sprul pa'i thub pa'i mchog sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mi shes pa thams cad kun du nges par gsal ba'i sems brtan par byas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' des
translated: The light rays from the seed of the gnosis being, having made firm the mind of the supreme emanation, the Buddha and bodhisattvas, who are the complete illumination of all ignorance,

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas la rang gi gsang sngags kyi nang du chud par snang bar byas te rang gi sems @171a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas la rang gi gsang sngags kyi nang du chud par snang bar byas te rang gi sems @171a * //
translated: having made all beings perfect buddhas, having been made visible within one’s mantra, one’s mind

original: la dbang du gyur pas de ltar sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ye shes la ni mi shong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la dbang du gyur pas de ltar sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ye shes la ni mi shong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: is empowered. Since it is emanated in that way, there is no lack of space in gnosis.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang sbyor bas sems brtan par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang sbyor bas sems brtan par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having made the mind firm by means of the union with the gnosis consort,

original: don dam pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor bsgom par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor bsgom par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: it is said that one should meditate on the yoga of the great seal, which has the nature of the ultimate.

original: shes rab thabs ni mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of wisdom and means

original: bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa mchog gis //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa mchog gis //
translated: The supreme yogi/nī of meditation

original: phyag rgya che dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: phyag rgya che dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: is united with the Great Seal,

original: bsgom pa rgyal bas gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: bsgom pa rgyal bas gsungs pa yin //
translated: the meditation taught by the Victorious Ones.

original: zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas /
translated: Thus, it is explained.

original: ri zhig rim pa 'dis dang por shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ri zhig rim pa 'dis dang por shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at the beginning, one should cultivate wisdom.

original: ci gzugs la sogs pas ji ltar byis pas yongs su brtags shing mthong ba rnams ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing don dam par stong pa yin nam 'on te kun rdzob tsam gyi rang bzhin can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzugs la sogs pas ji ltar byis pas yongs su brtags shing mthong ba rnams ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing don dam par stong pa yin nam 'on te kun rdzob tsam gyi rang bzhin can yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of form and so forth? Are they the nature of consciousness, and ultimately empty, or are they the nature of mere conventionalities?

original: de gsungs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The answer is “form and so forth.”

original: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs te /
translated: Form is that which is suitable as form.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold, divided into color and shape.

original: kha dog ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Color is blue and so forth.

original: dbyibs ni mnyam pa dang mtho ba dang dma' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ni mnyam pa dang mtho ba dang dma' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Shape is even, high, low, and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus yin gyi ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mig ser gyis nye bar bcom pa'i mig gis rtog pa mang po'i bzos bsgrubs pa las snang ba yin pa de'i rnam pa zhes pa gzugs kyi
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus yin gyi ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mig ser gyis nye bar bcom pa'i mig gis rtog pa mang po'i bzos bsgrubs pa las snang ba yin pa de'i rnam pa zhes pa gzugs kyi
translated: These forms and so on are beginningless, but they appear due to the fabrication of many conceptual thoughts by the eye that is damaged by the jaundice of the latent propensities for ignorance.

original: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
translated: The nature of form is emptiness, that is, the emptiness of its own essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: As the Bhagavān said, “Su­bhūti, form is empty of the essence of form.

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa de lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa de lta bu ste /
translated: This is its nature. ”

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: This is also the case with feeling and so on.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Discrimination is like a mirage,

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Compositional factors are like a plantain tree,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes //🔽de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes // de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: that consciousness is like a magical creation.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pas mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pas mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is seen by direct perception.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ji ltar yin zhe na de ni @171b ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ji ltar yin zhe na de ni @171b ma yin te /
translated: How can it be empty of intrinsic reality?

original: so sor snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because whatever appears individually is not true.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of two moons and so on to one with blurred vision.

original: 'on te 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin par bshad pas rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin par bshad pas rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin gyi /
translated: But since it is explained that direct perception is nonerroneous cognition, the appearance of two moons and so on to one with blurred vision is a semblance of direct perception.

original: de mngon sum ma yin te /🔽mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
analyzed: de mngon sum ma yin te / mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that direct perception is unobscured.

original: gal te de skad zer na de lta na ni de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa yin pas thams cad yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de skad zer na de lta na ni de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa yin pas thams cad yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that, then since the thorough understanding of thatness is direct perception, all would be correct yogis.

original: tshu rol mthong ba can du ni mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba can du ni mi 'gyur te ;
translated: One does not become a sophist,

original: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands reality just as it is.🔽And that is just as it has been explained:

original: de yang / gal te ji ltar grags pa 'di //
analyzed: de yang / gal te ji ltar grags pa 'di //
translated: If this is just as it is reputed to be,

original: chos rnams ngo bo ji bzhin yin //🔽yang dag don mthong grol 'gyur bas //
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo ji bzhin yin // yang dag don mthong grol 'gyur bas //
translated: and the natures of things are just as they are,🔽then all transmigrators would be liberated,

original: 'gro ba thams cad cis mi grol //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽de la slob dpon gyis mngon sum ni rnal 'byor pa dang cig shos kyi ste rnam pa gnyis su bshad pas tha snyad tsam kho nar rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar shes pa'i don ma 'khrul pa tsam gang yin pa de la 'khrul pa
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad cis mi grol // zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o // de la slob dpon gyis mngon sum ni rnal 'byor pa dang cig shos kyi ste rnam pa gnyis su bshad pas tha snyad tsam kho nar rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar shes pa'i don ma 'khrul pa tsam gang yin pa de la 'khrul pa
translated: since they see reality.

original: med pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: There, the master has explained that perception is twofold, that of the yogi and that of the other, and so he explains that, just as a dream, etc., is mere convention, whatever is the mere non-delusion of the object of knowledge is called “non-delusion.”

original: de nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni /
translated: And by that he says:

original: gzung ba rnams kyang cung zad yod min la //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba rnams kyang cung zad yod min la // zhes bya ste /
translated: The apprehended also do not exist in the least.

original: sems de'i gzung bar bya ba gzugs la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems de'i gzung bar bya ba gzugs la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those forms, etc., which are the apprehended objects of that mind do not exist.

original: de gnyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are not established as things that are the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: tshad ma gnyis nyid yin pas mngon sum du 'dod par mi 'thad kyang rjes su dpag pas yod par 'thad do zhe na der yang /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis nyid yin pas mngon sum du 'dod par mi 'thad kyang rjes su dpag pas yod par 'thad do zhe na der yang /
translated: Although it is not tenable to assert that it is perception because it is the two valid cognitions, it is tenable that it exists through inference.🔽Also, in that regard, it is said:

original: gzhan pa'i 'brel pa'i yid kyang mthong ba med //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i 'brel pa'i yid kyang mthong ba med // ces bya ba smras te /
translated: The mind that is related to another is also not seen.

original: shes pa don dang lhan cig pa'i rtags dang / rtags can gyi 'dzin pa med pas gzhan pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa don dang lhan cig pa'i rtags dang / rtags can gyi 'dzin pa med pas gzhan pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since there is no evidence of consciousness together with an object and no apprehension of the evidence, it is also not the case that it is inferred by another.

original: 'brel pa ni gnyis su gnas te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gnyis su gnas te /
translated: The meaning of that is that a relationship is twofold:

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: the characteristic of being the same nature and the characteristic of arising from that.

original: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin te thag ring ba dang / nye ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i shes pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin te thag ring ba dang / nye ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: In that regard, first, it is not the same nature because a clear or unclear consciousness does not arise due to the distinction of being distant or near, and so on.

original: shes pa dang yul gcig tu gyur na de lta bu'i rnam pa mi srid do //
analyzed: shes pa dang yul gcig tu gyur na de lta bu'i rnam pa mi srid do //
translated: If consciousness and the object were one, such an aspect would be impossible.

original: de las @172a * //🔽byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las @172a * // byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from that,

original: stan khra bo la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sna tshogs pas /
analyzed: stan khra bo la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sna tshogs pas /
translated: because the consciousness of a multicolored object is not variegated.🔽If it were, then the consciousness would be different in aspect, but since the object is extensive, the consciousness that arises from it is not variegated, because it is apprehended as occupying an extensive location.

original: rnam pa dang 'dra ba'i shes pa'i bye brag tha dad par thal bar 'gyur na phyogs rgya che bas na sna tshogs par gnas pa'i yongs su 'dzin pas shes pa de ltar skye ba yod pa ma yin pas gang gis sna tshogs pa nyid du bsgrub par bya🔽ba'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang 'dra ba'i shes pa'i bye brag tha dad par thal bar 'gyur na phyogs rgya che bas na sna tshogs par gnas pa'i yongs su 'dzin pas shes pa de ltar skye ba yod pa ma yin pas gang gis sna tshogs pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa legs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that multiple consciousnesses arise in order to establish the variegated nature of the object.

original: gzugs med pa ni yul na gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni yul na gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that multiple consciousnesses arise because it is impossible for formless states to exist in a location.🔽And as it is said:

original: de yang / gang phyir de yod nges shes pa'i //
analyzed: de yang / gang phyir de yod nges shes pa'i //
translated: Because it is ascertained that it exists,

original: shes pa don dang lhan cig nyid //
analyzed: shes pa don dang lhan cig nyid //
translated: consciousness is simultaneous with the object.

original: de yi bdag nyid de las byung //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid de las byung //
translated: It is not of the nature of that, nor does it arise from that,

original: 'brel pa gang yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa gang yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: nor is there any connection between them.

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la sogs pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la sogs pas smras pa /
translated: Here, those who advocate the existence of external objects and so on say:

original: shes pa ni dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can dbyibs med par nga rgyal gyi gnas su gyur pa nang na gnas pa nyams su myong ba yin pas /
analyzed: shes pa ni dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can dbyibs med par nga rgyal gyi gnas su gyur pa nang na gnas pa nyams su myong ba yin pas /
translated: Consciousness is the basis of self-pride that abides internally, experienced as having the nature of pleasure, pain, and so on, and as being devoid of shape.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing dbyibs la sogs par ma grub pa yang ma yin pa dang / nga rgyal gyi gnas kyang ma yin pas de'i phyir shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid du nyams su myong ba yin pas nyams su myong ba'i dbye ba yod pa'i dngos po la dbye ba med par sems dang bcas pas byar ji ltar rung zhe na🔽/ de la yang bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing dbyibs la sogs par ma grub pa yang ma yin pa dang / nga rgyal gyi gnas kyang ma yin pas de'i phyir shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid du nyams su myong ba yin pas nyams su myong ba'i dbye ba yod pa'i dngos po la dbye ba med par sems dang bcas pas byar ji ltar rung zhe na / de la yang bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
translated: Blue and so on are not the nature of pleasure, pain, and so on, nor are they established as shape and so on, nor are they the basis of self-pride. Therefore, since they are experienced as being external to consciousness, how could it be reasonable for the mind to engage them without differentiation, since there is a differentiation of experience?

original: bde sogs zhes pa /
analyzed: bde sogs zhes pa /
translated: To this, the root text says, “Happiness and so on,” and so on.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can 'dzin pa po shes pa de /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can 'dzin pa po shes pa de /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the nature of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i bya ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i bya ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: is not seen to have any characteristic of apprehending the distinction of the action of apprehending form, etc.

original: cig car rang rgyud du snang ba gnyis la /🔽cung zad ni gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: cig car rang rgyud du snang ba gnyis la / cung zad ni gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: In the simultaneous appearance of the two, the continuum and the object,🔽a cause for the ascertainment of the distinction, “This is the apprehended object,

original: cung zad ni 'dzin pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: cung zad ni 'dzin pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: and this is the apprehender,” is not seen.

original: de bas na cig car dus mtshungs par yul dang lhan cig shes par gyur cing /
analyzed: de bas na cig car dus mtshungs par yul dang lhan cig shes par gyur cing /
translated: Therefore, since it is simultaneously simultaneous with the object,

original: yongs su gcod par byed pas na 'dzin pa po ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pas na 'dzin pa po ma yin pa ni /
translated: the consciousness that is the apprehender is not

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: like form, etc.

original: ji ltar gzugs 'dzin pa po ma yin pa de @172b bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs 'dzin pa po ma yin pa de @172b bzhin du /
translated: Just as form is not the apprehender,

original: shes pa yang 'dzin pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang 'dzin pa po ma yin no //
translated: so consciousness is not the apprehender.

original: de yang rab 'byor chos rnams kyis chos rnams mi shes so zhes ji skad rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang rab 'byor chos rnams kyis chos rnams mi shes so zhes ji skad rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, phenomena do not know phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes rtogs na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes rtogs na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the white, etc.”

original: dkar po la sogs pa gang zhig sngar mthong ba nyid dus tshod gzhan dag tu mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa gang zhig sngar mthong ba nyid dus tshod gzhan dag tu mi mthong ste /
translated: Whatever is seen as white, etc. is not seen at another time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skad cig ma yin pas sdod pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pas sdod pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of momentariness, there is no stability.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skad cig ma rnams ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skad cig ma rnams ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moments of the past, future, and present have different characteristics.

original: mthong ba nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa yod par bsgrub pa yang de la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa yod par bsgrub pa yang de la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it established that what is seen exists separately from experience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun 'gal bas mi mthun pa gcig la gcig lhan cig gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas mi mthun pa gcig la gcig lhan cig gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of mutual contradiction, they are incompatible and do not coexist.

original: ji ltar bde sogs zhes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag mi mthun pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bde sogs zhes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag mi mthun pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as pleasure and so on are incompatible,

original: sngon mthong pa dang / phyis mthong ba dang / 'di dag kyang rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon mthong pa dang / phyis mthong ba dang / 'di dag kyang rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: so too, what was seen before and what is seen now are always incompatible by their very nature.🔽Since the appearance of the apprehended is not tenable as either one or many, it does not exist in its own right.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba gang yin pa 'di dag kyang gcig dang du ma nyid du mi 'thad pas rang gi ngo bor med pa nyid yin pa de ni thog mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba gang yin pa 'di dag kyang gcig dang du ma nyid du mi 'thad pas rang gi ngo bor med pa nyid yin pa de ni thog mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: That is stated in “beginning, end, and so on.”

original: gzung ba'i rnam par so sor snang ba gang yin pa de ni gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par so sor snang ba gang yin pa de ni gcig ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of the apprehended is not one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po de la thog mtha' la sogs pa'i bye brag snang ba dang / don byed pa'i nus pa'i dbye ba yang mthong bas gang la phyogs kyi cha yod pa de ni gcig pa nyid mi rigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dngos po de la thog mtha' la sogs pa'i bye brag snang ba dang / don byed pa'i nus pa'i dbye ba yang mthong bas gang la phyogs kyi cha yod pa de ni gcig pa nyid mi rigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Because the distinctions of beginning, end, and so on appear in that thing, and because the distinctions of the capacity to perform functions are also seen. Therefore, since it has directional parts, it is not tenable that it is one.

original: rang bzhin gcig dang bral bas du ma yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig dang bral bas du ma yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is devoid of a single nature, it is not multiple either.

original: dkar po la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i cha dang ldan pa rnams la phra rab tu brtags pa'i shes pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i cha dang ldan pa rnams la phra rab tu brtags pa'i shes pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable to posit a cognition that analyzes the most subtle aspect of those that possess the aspect of appearing as individual colors such as white.

original: phra rab rnams kyi rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir /🔽mngon sum du 'dzin par khas mi len la de yang phra rab rnams ni yan lag med pa cha shas med pa yin te /
analyzed: phra rab rnams kyi rang bzhin gzung du med pa'i phyir / mngon sum du 'dzin par khas mi len la de yang phra rab rnams ni yan lag med pa cha shas med pa yin te /
translated: This is because the nature of subtle particles cannot be apprehended.🔽We do not accept that they are apprehended directly.🔽Moreover, subtle particles are partless and without divisions because they are without parts.

original: yan lag med pa'i phyir cha shas med pas / rdul phra rab gzhan dang 'dus pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i phyir cha shas med pas / rdul phra rab gzhan dang 'dus pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: They are free from being combined with other subtle particles.

original: gal te yod na shar la sogs pa'i mdun rgyab dang / logs gnyis dang 'og ste phyogs drug tu gnas pas phra rab drug 'dus pa yin @173a * //🔽par 'thad la /
analyzed: gal te yod na shar la sogs pa'i mdun rgyab dang / logs gnyis dang 'og ste phyogs drug tu gnas pas phra rab drug 'dus pa yin @173a * // par 'thad la /
translated: If they existed, it would be tenable that six subtle particles would be combined, since they would be located in the six directions of east and so on, the front and back, the two sides, and below.

original: 'dus pa des na cha shas drug 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dus pa des na cha shas drug 'gyur te //
translated: Since they are combined, they would have six parts.

original: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: Since six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle would have six parts.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽🔽

original: de bas na rdul phra rab ma grub pas phra rab bsags pa las gyur pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs te /
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab ma grub pas phra rab bsags pa las gyur pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs te /
translated: Thus, since the atom is not established, the collection of atoms, such as the circle of earth,

original: gling bdun la sogs pa sa rnams bsags par brtags pa yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gling bdun la sogs pa sa rnams bsags par brtags pa yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: and the collection of the seven continents, etc., are not tenable.

original: de bas na gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the apprehended does not exist.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'gro ba 'di dag ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'gro ba 'di dag ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how do these migrating beings appear?

original: de'i phyir de bas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽de bas zhes pa de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de bas zhes pa de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Therefore, the apprehender, etc.”🔽Therefore, because the nature of the one and the many are not tenable, since they are free from the apprehender, etc., there is no apprehended object and no apprehending subject.

original: 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang bral bas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di dag ni rang rgyud can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang bral bas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di dag ni rang rgyud can yin gyi /
translated: These migrating beings are self-produced,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not produced from another, such as Īshvara.

original: rang rgyud rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rgyud rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not self-produced in every way.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from causes and conditions on the relative level.

original: rgyu med par gyur na ni rtag tu yod pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu med par gyur na ni rtag tu yod pa'am /
translated: If they were without causes, they would either be permanently existent or

original: med pa la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: nonexistent, and so on.

original: gzugs sogs ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni rtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Form and so forth are by nature feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.🔽They are like stars, cataracts, lamps,

original: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bu //
analyzed: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bu //
translated: Illusions, dew, bubbles, dreams, lightning, and clouds.

original: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
analyzed: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
translated: Thus should the conditioned be seen.

original: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: They are like a city of gandharvas.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden par slu zhing snying po med pa nyid du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden par slu zhing snying po med pa nyid du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, on the relative level, they should be seen as deceptive and without any essence.

original: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
translated: On the relative level, everything exists.

original: dam pa'i don du yod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du yod ma yin //
translated: On the ultimate level, nothing exists.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'khor ba dang mya ngan ldas 'das par ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'khor ba dang mya ngan ldas 'das par ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If that is so, how are samsara and nirvana established?

original: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the self and being mine, etc.”

original: bdag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nga rgyal can gyi rang bzhin can bdag med ba bzhin du bdag dang bdag tu rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nga rgyal can gyi rang bzhin can bdag med ba bzhin du bdag dang bdag tu rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The self is the afflicted mind, which is the nature of the conceit of “I,” but which is non-self, and conceives of self and being mine.

original: bdag ni bu dang chung ma dang nor la sogs pa'o //🔽de gnyis kyi rgyun ni rgyun du 'jug pa gang yin pa ste 'di'i 'jug pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa'i dngos po'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i dbang gis 'di ni bdag yin @173b pas 'di dag dgos so zhes log par rtogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma
analyzed: bdag ni bu dang chung ma dang nor la sogs pa'o // de gnyis kyi rgyun ni rgyun du 'jug pa gang yin pa ste 'di'i 'jug pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa'i dngos po'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i dbang gis 'di ni bdag yin @173b pas 'di dag dgos so zhes log par rtogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma
translated: Being mine is one’s son, wife, wealth, etc.

original: yin pa'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: yin pa'i yid la byed pas /
translated: The continuum of those two is the continuous engagement. The engagement of that is the power of the connection of the latent tendencies of the things that benefit and harm. It is the incorrect thought, “This is the self, and these are its needs,” which is the incorrect mental activity.

original: mthong ba nyid las ni 'khor bar rnam par bzhag la dag pa 'ang phyin ci log de med pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid las ni 'khor bar rnam par bzhag la dag pa 'ang phyin ci log de med pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas ni mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
translated: From seeing itself, there is the establishment of cyclic existence. Nirvana is the mere intrinsic reality of the absence of that error, since the conceptions of “I” and “mine” are abandoned.🔽As it is said:

original: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from conception,

original: 'khor ba zhes bya 'ga' ma mchis //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya 'ga' ma mchis //
translated: there is no so-called cyclic existence.

original: de bas rnam rtog rnam bsal bas //
analyzed: de bas rnam rtog rnam bsal bas //
translated: Therefore, having eliminated conception,

original: khyed ni rtag tu mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyed ni rtag tu mya ngan 'das // zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: you are always in nirvana.

original: de bas na bdag dang bdag gir lta ba las ldog par dor ba dang blang bar bya ba'i dngos po dang bral bas 'khor ba'i gnyen por gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang bdag gir lta ba las ldog par dor ba dang blang bar bya ba'i dngos po dang bral bas 'khor ba'i gnyen por gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since cyclic existence is the opposite of the views of “I” and “mine,” nirvana is the antidote to cyclic existence, since it is free of things to be discarded and adopted.

original: de ltar na ni 'khor ba med pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas dngos por med do zhes rtogs pas de'i phyir zhi ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'khor ba med pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas dngos por med do zhes rtogs pas de'i phyir zhi ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since there is no cyclic existence in that way, nirvana is not a thing, since it is the absence of cyclic existence. Thus, in order to understand that, it says, “Peace . . . ” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la skyo ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' pa ston par mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba la skyo ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' pa ston par mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavān teaches nirvāṇa in order to generate disgust with saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la ni dbye ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la ni dbye ba gang yang med do //
translated: But there is no difference at all between saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de yang chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du yin gyi kun rdzob tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du yin gyi kun rdzob tu ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, “by nature” means in terms of the ultimate nature, not conventionally,

original: gzhan du na chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise it would be nihilism.

original: de yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Also, the master Nāgārjuna said:

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med min //
translated: Nirvāṇa is not a nonthing.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: If nirvāṇa were a thing,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur //🔽dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur // dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
translated: nirvāṇa would be a conditioned thing.🔽But how could a thing that is not conditioned

original: 'ga' yang ji ltar yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ji ltar yod ma yin //
translated: exist in any way?

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained.

original: 'di nyid du 'thad pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir gang phyir gzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid du 'thad pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir gang phyir gzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the proof of this, he says, “Because of the absence of apprehended and apprehender,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang phral ba yin par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag thams cad du lung dang rigs pa dag gis rtag tu grub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang phral ba yin par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag thams cad du lung dang rigs pa dag gis rtag tu grub pa de'i tshe /
translated: Because of the absence of the nature of apprehended and apprehender ultimately, samsara and nirvana are always established as such by scripture and reasoning.

original: thams cad kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: At that time, nothing at all exists.

original: kun rdzob tu ni yang dngos po de dag so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun du rtog pa las gud na med de so sor snang ba'i dngos po rnams med pa nyid du sems dang ldan pa su zhig 'gog par byed /🔽'on kyang rnam par dpyad na yod @174a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni yang dngos po de dag so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun du rtog pa las gud na med de so sor snang ba'i dngos po rnams med pa nyid du sems dang ldan pa su zhig 'gog par byed / 'on kyang rnam par dpyad na yod @174a * //
translated: However, conventionally, those things do not exist apart from the imagination of what is unreal, which is the nature that appears as such. What intelligent person would refute the nonexistence of things that appear as such?

original: bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bar mi 'thad do //
translated: However, when analyzed, existence is not tenable.

original: de ltar rnam par 'jog pas rang gi sde bas brtags pa'i rtsod pa'i yang go skabs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par 'jog pas rang gi sde bas brtags pa'i rtsod pa'i yang go skabs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of this presentation, there is no opportunity for the dispute imagined by our own group.

original: de dag 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: They say this:

original: gal te 'di dag thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If all of these are emptiness,

original: bag chags pa sgro ba dang bsgo bar bya ba dang bsod nams dang sdig pa'i chos bstan pa dang las dang 'bras bu la stong pa nyid du smra bas skur ba btab par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags pa sgro ba dang bsgo bar bya ba dang bsod nams dang sdig pa'i chos bstan pa dang las dang 'bras bu la stong pa nyid du smra bas skur ba btab par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then you repudiate the teaching of the imputation of predispositions, the object of imputation, and the phenomena of virtue and vice, and you repudiate the relation between actions and their effects by advocating emptiness.

original: de ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis thams cad kyang lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis thams cad kyang lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The master Nagarjuna has already responded to this:

original: las rnams med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: las rnams med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Actions are not nonexistent.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rmi lam tsam du yang yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rmi lam tsam du yang yod par mthong ste /
translated: The effects of virtue and nonvirtue are seen to exist, even if they are like a dream.🔽The suffering that is included within the five aggregates also includes dreams.

original: phung po lngas bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal des ni rmi lam yang bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du rgyu rnam par dag pa las 'bras bu yang rnam par dag pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: phung po lngas bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal des ni rmi lam yang bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du rgyu rnam par dag pa las 'bras bu yang rnam par dag pa 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, a pure effect arises from a pure cause.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
translated: And, Whatever is possible in emptiness,

original: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: All is possible in that.

original: de ltar don dam par rnam par dpyad na phyi yul med pas sems las gzhan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par rnam par dpyad na phyi yul med pas sems las gzhan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, when one analyzes the ultimate, since external objects do not exist, nothing exists apart from the mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin la ma gtogs pa bdag ces bya ba gud na logs shig tu ci yang yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin la ma gtogs pa bdag ces bya ba gud na logs shig tu ci yang yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that anything else, a self, exists apart from the nature of the habitual propensities of conceptual thought.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis phyi'i don med pa'i sems tsam la gnas nas de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis phyi'i don med pa'i sems tsam la gnas nas de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, by this process, one should abide in mind only, in the nonexistence of external objects. That also is not tenable, since it is devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: de yang ; dngos po gang gang rnam dpyad pa //🔽de de gcig tu yod min pa //
analyzed: de yang ; dngos po gang gang rnam dpyad pa // de de gcig tu yod min pa //
translated: And, Whatever things are analyzed,🔽They do not exist as one.

original: de la du ma'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la du ma'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor do they exist as many.

original: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from one and many,

original: rnam pa gzhan dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dag yod ma yin //
translated: There is no other form.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: 'on te 'di skad cas shes pa nyams su myong bar ni grub pa yin la nyams su myong ba grub pa nyid kyis na dgag par dka' ba yin te de bkag na thams cad kyang dgag par byas par 'gyur na shes pa de ni ma rig pa'i bag
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad cas shes pa nyams su myong bar ni grub pa yin la nyams su myong ba grub pa nyid kyis na dgag par dka' ba yin te de bkag na thams cad kyang dgag par byas par 'gyur na shes pa de ni ma rig pa'i bag
translated: But if you say, “The experience of consciousness is established, and because the experience is established, it is difficult to refute, and if it is refuted, everything would be refuted,” that consciousness is the appearance of blue and so on by the power of the latent propensities of ignorance.

original: chags kyi stobs kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba yin la don dam par ni shel sgong dag par ltar snang ba cha shas med pa yul na mi gnas pa sngon po la sogs @174b pa'i rang bzhin sna tshogs su snang ba med pa yin🔽no zhe na /
analyzed: chags kyi stobs kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba yin la don dam par ni shel sgong dag par ltar snang ba cha shas med pa yul na mi gnas pa sngon po la sogs @174b pa'i rang bzhin sna tshogs su snang ba med pa yin no zhe na /

original: de ni tshig tsam du zad do //

analyzed: shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yi //

analyzed: shes pa rab tu tshor ba med //

analyzed: ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: 'di nyid ni slob dpon chos kyi grags pa yang bzhed pa nyid yin te /

analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel las /

analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam dben 'gyur // de bas gnyis po stong nyid gang //

analyzed: de nyid 'dir yang yang dag nyid //

analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //

original: kun rdzob tu ni bstan pa mtshar //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bstan pa mtshar //

original: zhes bya ba dang / skye ba med pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / skye ba med pa'i sbyor ba yis //

analyzed: skye ba 'di ni bstan pa yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: dzny'a na k'i rta'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa las phyag rgya chen po bsgrub pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /

analyzed: sems tsam la ni gnas nas su //

analyzed: phyi rol don la mi rtag go //

analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas kyang //

analyzed: sems tsam las kyang 'da' bar bya //

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'di dang 'og nas bshad pas kyang shes rab bsgom par bshad par bya'o //

original: gang zhig gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

analyzed: pa dang bral ba / yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa byed pa la shin tu byang pa de nyid bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gcig tu 'dres par gyur @175a * //
translated: imagined by the mind.🔽Like a wish-fulfilling gem, it is completely purified in the performance of the needs of all sentient beings.🔽That very nature, which is a single, unified state free from the concepts of meditation and meditator,

original: pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni thams cad kun du bzang po dang 'dra bar bye brag med pa'i blo yod pa ste /🔽chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni thams cad kun du bzang po dang 'dra bar bye brag med pa'i blo yod pa ste / chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: is the existence of a mind that is undifferentiated, like all of the Samantabhadra.🔽Because there is no phenomenon

original: chos ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir //

analyzed: rnal 'byor pas dngos po thams cad bye brag med par blta bar bya ste ;

original: dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //

analyzed: de ni kun la mthong bar 'dod //

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is the emptiness of one thing

original: de ni kun gyi stong nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni kun gyi stong nyid yin //

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is as explained.🔽Therefore, it says, “The present and the past and future are not different,”

original: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snang ba gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth.

original: snang zhing so sor mngon pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa da ltar yod pa gang yin pa dang de las gzhan pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtog pa mang po'i bzos bsgrubs pa cung zad gang yin pa de dngos po de rnams brtags pa des rnam par
analyzed: snang zhing so sor mngon pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa da ltar yod pa gang yin pa dang de las gzhan pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtog pa mang po'i bzos bsgrubs pa cung zad gang yin pa de dngos po de rnams brtags pa des rnam par
translated: The present objects of form and so on that appear and are manifest and the past and future that are slightly established by the fabrication of many thoughts, other than that, are all things.

original: dpyad pa na phan tshun bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dbye ba yod pa yin la /
analyzed: dpyad pa na phan tshun bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dbye ba yod pa yin la /

analyzed: don dam par ni de dang bral bas brtag pa yang med pa'i phyir tha dad par gyur pa cung thad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But ultimately, since they are free from that, even the investigation does not exist and therefore they are not different in the slightest.

original: dngos po rnams ni brtags pas dbye ba yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni brtags pas dbye ba yod pa yin gyi /

analyzed: don dam par ni dbye ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi mdo yin no //

analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis shes rab kyi 'gro ba rnams dngos po med par rnam par dpyad na phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by this process, the movements of wisdom are analyzed as unreal, and one becomes endowed with the application of the great seal.🔽This is the nature of the mind,

analyzed: gang 'di spros pa thams cad dang // tshig gi 'ang gnas ma gyur rang bzhin //

original: de ni thugs kyi rdo rje yis //
analyzed: de ni thugs kyi rdo rje yis //

original: shes rab ces ni yongs su bshad //
analyzed: shes rab ces ni yongs su bshad //
translated: which is fully explained as wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs //

original: 'gro la snying rje chen po yin //
analyzed: 'gro la snying rje chen po yin //

original: ji ltar mnyam par sbyor zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar mnyam par sbyor zhe na //

original: gcig pu kho na dbye med bcas //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na dbye med bcas //

original: de yi bsgom pa'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: de yi bsgom pa'ang de bzhin te //

original: bzlog pa yis ni rnam par phye //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa yis ni rnam par phye // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but it is distinguished by the opposite.

original: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /

translated: Having actualized great compassion, he/she should gather all mental activity into the mind, having cleared away the mental activity of things and non-things, self-entity and other-entity, and so on.

original: ci la yang mi bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ci la yang mi bsam par bya'o //
translated: He/she should not think about anything.

translated: When he/she does not think about anything, the transcendent Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā will arise through the kindness of the guru, having been realized from long service to the guru.

analyzed: bu'i rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba rang snang ba'i ngo bo nyid spros pa med pa nyid kyis na spros pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: eration.🔽The supreme joy is realized through the application of the mirror.🔽Through the power of that, one should think, “Since these sentient🔽beings are by nature nirvāṇa, if they do not understand that themselves,

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid me long lta bu'i sbyor bas rtogs pa dang / de'i mthus kyi ma'o gti mug gi nus pa gang gis sems can 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can yin du zin kyang bdag nyid kyis mi shes na ji ltar na bdag gis 'di dag khong du chud par bya zhes rnam par bsams nas sems
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid me long lta bu'i sbyor bas rtogs pa dang / de'i mthus kyi ma'o gti mug gi nus pa gang gis sems can 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can yin du zin kyang bdag nyid kyis mi shes na ji ltar na bdag gis 'di dag khong du chud par bya zhes rnam par bsams nas sems
translated: how can I cause them to understand?”

original: can ma lus pa de'i bdag nyid kho nar bsams na dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi snying rje chan po gang yin pa skye ste bdag nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid can yin pas dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: can ma lus pa de'i bdag nyid kho nar bsams na dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi snying rje chan po gang yin pa skye ste bdag nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid can yin pas dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: If one thinks that all sentient beings are just that nature, then great compassion, which has the nature of being non-apprehensible, arises. Since one’s own nature is also that nature, one should think that the nature of all things is just that.

translated: Then, when the meditation of the yogin, whose nature is all things and whose nature is great compassion, becomes powerful, the nature of all things, whose nature is great compassion,

translated: and one’s own nature, which is the nature of the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā, which is also called the “great seal,” become undifferentiated, and one sees them as mixed into one, like water poured into water.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that happens,

original: de de'i bdag nyid can du bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid can du bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: One meditates on that as having the nature of that,

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of the intuition of the non-duality of wisdom and means.

original: da ni rim pa 'di nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rim pa 'di nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the reality of the mandala by this very sequence,

original: dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “faith, etc.”

analyzed: dad pa dang ni theg pa chen po la mngon par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Faith is the characteristic of engagement in the Great Vehicle.

original: brtson 'grus ni dad pa skyes nas bsod nams dang ya shes kyi tshogs @176a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dad pa skyes nas bsod nams dang ya shes kyi tshogs @176a * //
translated: After faith has arisen, one should complete the accumulations of merit and

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: knowledge through effort.

original: dran pa ni dge ba'i phyogs rgyun mi gcod pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dge ba'i phyogs rgyun mi gcod pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Recollection is the non-abandonment of the continuity of the virtuous🔽side.

original: bsam gtan ni g-yeng ba ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni g-yeng ba ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Meditative concentration is the pacification of all distractions.

original: 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khro bo gshin rje gshed dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa zhes bya ba'i sgo srung rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khro bo gshin rje gshed dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa zhes bya ba'i sgo srung rnams yin no //
translated: These are the essence of the pure nature, namely, the door guardians called wrathful Yamantaka, Aparajita, Hayagriva, and Amrtakundalin.

original: shes rab rnam dag ces bya ba shes rab ni chos thams cad spros pa med pa nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam dag ces bya ba shes rab ni chos thams cad spros pa med pa nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The one called pure wisdom is the understanding that all phenomena are free of conceptual elaborations.

analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni ma lus pa'i yul du snang ba ste /
translated: Its purity is the appearance in the field of all objects.
