analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje zhes bya ba'i mchod pa'i lha mo drug ste /
translated: The six goddesses of offering are called the vajra realm of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and phenomena.

original: dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las ni /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las ni /
translated: The Sri-Vajrahrdayalankara states:

original: gzugs sgra dri dang ro dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra dri dang ro dang ni //
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste,

original: reg bya chos mchog rdo rje ma //
analyzed: reg bya chos mchog rdo rje ma //
translated: Touch, and the supreme phenomenon are the vajra.

original: shes rab rnam dag ngo bo de //
analyzed: shes rab rnam dag ngo bo de //
translated: The essence of pure wisdom

original: mchod pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: mchod pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: Is the offering goddess of great magical power.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa smos pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa smos pas /
translated: The one called “signless” is so called because of the mention of signlessness.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa rnams la bya ste de rnams la rol zhing dgyes pa ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa rnams la bya ste de rnams la rol zhing dgyes pa ni dga' ba ste /
translated: It is to be applied to emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning.

original: de'i longs spyod dang bcas pa nyid kyis na byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid can gyi lha mo bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod dang bcas pa nyid kyis na byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid can gyi lha mo bzhi'o //
translated: The four goddesses, who are the nature of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, are so called because they delight in and enjoy those.

original: de yang rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud las /
translated: The Tantra says:

original: zhi ba'i las ni rab sgrub pas //
analyzed: zhi ba'i las ni rab sgrub pas //
translated: Because it accomplishes the peaceful activity,

original: byams pa can zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: byams pa can zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: it is explained as “loving.”

original: sdug bsngal kun las thar byed pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las thar byed pas //
translated: Because it liberates from all suffering,

original: snying rje m'a ma k'i zhes bshad //
analyzed: snying rje m'a ma k'i zhes bshad //
translated: it is explained as “compassionate.”

original: rdo rje padma'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje padma'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Because of the union of vajra and lotus,

original: gos dkar mo ni dga' bar bshad //
analyzed: gos dkar mo ni dga' bar bshad //
translated: it is explained as “white-garbed.”

original: 'jig rten dga' rab skyed byed cing //🔽'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten dga' rab skyed byed cing // 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because it generates the joy of the world,🔽and because of the nature of great passion,

original: btang snyoms chen po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: it is the nature of great equanimity.

original: lha mo sgrol mar rang nyid gnas //
analyzed: lha mo sgrol mar rang nyid gnas //
translated: I am the goddess Tara, abiding in myself.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems can don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems can zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbang po drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid la bya'o //
analyzed: sems can don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems can zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbang po drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid la bya'o //
translated: With regard to the passage beginning “For the sake of sentient beings,” the term “sentient beings” refers to the six sense faculties, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: don gyi sgras ni yul te gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi sgras ni yul te gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The term “objects” refers to the six sense objects, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tangible objects, and phenomena.

original: bdag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: bdag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: The “I” is the afflicted mind, which has the nature of pride.

original: rnam rtog ni sgra @176b dang 'drer rung ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog ni sgra @176b dang 'drer rung ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: “Conceptualization” is the consciousness that is suitable to be mixed with words.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: The “engaging consciousnesses” are the six collections of consciousness, such as the eye consciousness.

original: 'di dag gi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang so so rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang so so rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don
translated: The nature of the consciousness of these is the nature of mirrorlike timeless awareness, that of equalizing, that of discerning and that of ensuring that everything is accomplished.🔽

original: yod grub pa shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi dang rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod grub pa shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi dang rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of the consciousnesses of these is the nature of the mirror-like, the equality, the individualizing, and the duty-fulfillment wisdoms, which are the four Tathagatas Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, respectively, dwelling in the eastern and other directions.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid yongs su mkhyen cing spros pa med pa nyid thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid yongs su mkhyen cing spros pa med pa nyid thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the thorough knowledge of the reality of things just as it is, and the realization of the absence of conceptual elaborations.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo kun du bzang po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo kun du bzang po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Its purity is the nature of Samantabhadra, the essence of omniscience.

original: de'i sbyor ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can nyid kyis 'khor lo'i gtso bo dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i ngo bos rnam par bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can nyid kyis 'khor lo'i gtso bo dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i ngo bos rnam par bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is present in the form of the principal wheel-holder, the lord of the mandala, by virtue of the nature of the gnosis of the pure realm of phenomena.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni ye shes lnga rgyud gcig gi nang du chud pas don dam par bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni ye shes lnga rgyud gcig gi nang du chud pas don dam par bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of here is that he is present in the ultimate sense, since the five gnoses are included within a single continuum.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for form and so forth,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin mngon par zhen pas longs spyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin mngon par zhen pas longs spyad pa'o //
translated: the error of form and so forth is the enjoyment of form and so forth through manifest clinging, just as it is perceived.

original: de med pas na de ltar bral ba ste /
analyzed: de med pas na de ltar bral ba ste /
translated: Since that does not exist, it is free from that.

original: gnyen po bsgom pas rnam par dag pa ni don dam pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pas rnam par dag pa ni don dam pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang /
translated: The cultivation of the antidote, the ultimate form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, which are pure, are the nature of Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha,

original: don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi and Akshobhya are the five Tathagatas.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyi rol gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyang yin par shes par bya'o//
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyi rol gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyang yin par shes par bya'o//
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood to include the external forms derived from the elements.

original: ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: “Avarice and so on” means

original: ser sna ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: ser sna ni 'dod chags so //
translated: avarice is attachment.

original: de la sogs pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang / stobs chung ba nyid dang / log pa'i smon lam dang / @177a * //
analyzed: de la sogs pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang / stobs chung ba nyid dang / log pa'i smon lam dang / @177a * //
translated: “And so on” means immorality, anger, laziness, distraction, poor understanding, weakness, wrong aspirations,🔽false imagination, and ignorance.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / mi shes pa ste 'di dag las ldog pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / mi shes pa ste 'di dag las ldog pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: The nature of these is the opposite of that.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang de'i rigs su gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu po ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang de'i rigs su gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu po ste /
translated: The ten levels such as the joyous are the essence of the ten transcendent perfections generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, power, aspiration, means and primordial wisdom and of the qualities that are their families.

original: chos dkar po 'di rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: chos dkar po 'di rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: These are the qualities that are the result of these positive factors.

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gnas su ma gyur pas /🔽bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par snang ba ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gnas su ma gyur pas / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par snang ba ni zab pa ste /
translated: Nonconceptuality refers to the fact that the ten levels are not the domain of any conceptual thoughts.🔽The appearance of the perfect fulfillment of one's own goal is the profound aspect.

original: shes rab zab mo las 'byung la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par snang ba 'byung ba ni rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab zab mo las 'byung la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par snang ba 'byung ba ni rgya che ba ste /
translated: The appearance of the perfect fulfillment of others' goals is the vast aspect.

original: thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis byed pas 'di gnyis kho nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sems don dam par shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas zab pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis byed pas 'di gnyis kho nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sems don dam par shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas zab pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la
translated: of wisdom and method, the profound is the perfect fulfillment of one’s own

original: / rgya che bas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rgya che bas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: purpose, and the vast is the perfect fulfillment of the purpose of others.🔽Moreover, in the Bodhisattvabhumi, it says that the mind is posited as🔽wisdom in the sense of turning away from error, and it is posited as method

original: de yang bdag sgrub pa la 'jug pa las de nyid du sems phyin ci log las ldog pa'i tshul gyis ni shes rab tu rnam par bzhag la rang gi bya ba'i nus pa med pa las ldog pa las ni thabs su rnam par gdags pa ni don dam
analyzed: de yang bdag sgrub pa la 'jug pa las de nyid du sems phyin ci log las ldog pa'i tshul gyis ni shes rab tu rnam par bzhag la rang gi bya ba'i nus pa med pa las ldog pa las ni thabs su rnam par gdags pa ni don dam
translated: in the sense of turning away from the inability to perform one’s own tasks.

original: pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the ultimate.

original: dkyil 'khor du lta bcu dgu'i rnam pa'i dbye bas phye bar bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par kun du bzang po'i thugs gcig pu nyid yin pas 'khor ba pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi lha'i
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du lta bcu dgu'i rnam pa'i dbye bas phye bar bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par kun du bzang po'i thugs gcig pu nyid yin pas 'khor ba pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi lha'i
translated: The mandala is taught to be divided by the categories of the nineteen views, but ultimately it is the nature of the mind of Samantabhadra alone.🔽

original: tshul du tha mi dad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshul du tha mi dad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: That which is taught as divided by the classification of the nineteen views in the mandala is ultimately the nature of the mind of Samantabhadra alone. Therefore, it is not different in the manner of a deity that has the nature of purification, the antidote to the afflictions of transmigrators.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni dbye ba yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni dbye ba yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, conventionally, there is a division.

original: des kyang ji skad ston ce na don dam par ni dbye ba med kyi kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar mthong ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des kyang ji skad ston ce na don dam par ni dbye ba med kyi kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar mthong ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: How does that teach? Ultimately, there is no division. Conventionally, there is a difference by the division of what is seen.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan las zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi ma rig pa'i bag @177b chags 'ga' zhig gi stobs kyis gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan las zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi ma rig pa'i bag @177b chags 'ga' zhig gi stobs kyis gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
translated: From others, etc. From others means from the power of some latent tendencies of ignorance that have existed since beginningless time. Others means attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: phrag dog dang / dad pa med pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa gang yin pa de de las rnam par ldog par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo dang khro bo la sogs pa'i dkyil🔽'khor ston par mdzad pa yin gyis /
analyzed: phrag dog dang / dad pa med pa dang / le lo dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa gang yin pa de de las rnam par ldog par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo dang khro bo la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ston par mdzad pa yin gyis /
translated: In order to reverse the grasping of jealousy, lack of faith, laziness, impaired mindfulness, discursive thoughts, and so on, the Bhagavān Buddha taught the maṇḍalas of the five tathāgatas, goddesses, wrathful ones, and so on to sentient beings through skillful means.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dbye ba bye brag rtog pa dang ni bral ba yin te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi rol mo sna tshogs rab tu ston par mdzad pas 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dbye ba bye brag rtog pa dang ni bral ba yin te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi rol mo sna tshogs rab tu ston par mdzad pas 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddha, free from the conceptualization of the divisions of Vairocana and so on, acts for the welfare of beings by displaying the various enjoyments of the buddhas.

original: yang sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Moreover, Buddhajñānapāda states:

original: de ltar kun rtog ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar kun rtog ma lus pa'i //
translated: In that way, in order to destroy

original: sems kyi sgro btags gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems kyi sgro btags gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: the mind’s reifications of all conceptual thoughts,

original: de nyid yang dag rtog ci snyed //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag rtog ci snyed //
translated: That itself is the correct conception of all things.

original: de yi gnas kyang de nyid yin //
analyzed: de yi gnas kyang de nyid yin //
translated: That itself is the abode of all things.🔽The nature of all things is the attachment to the superior,

original: de yi rang bzhin lhag zhen dang // de skyed pa la brten pa yis //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin lhag zhen dang // de skyed pa la brten pa yis //
translated: and the basis of the generation of that.

original: rnal 'byor pa sems rdzogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sems rdzogs bya'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of perfecting the mind of the yogi,

original: de rnams bskyed par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: de rnams bskyed par 'dod pa yin //
translated: those are desired to be generated.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: shes rab yan lag 'dus pa'i mchog tu ni//
analyzed: shes rab yan lag 'dus pa'i mchog tu ni//
translated: the supreme union of the branches of wisdom

original: dga' ba nyams myong bde ba dam par ldan //🔽de yi thabs gyur pa ni nyin mtshan du //
analyzed: dga' ba nyams myong bde ba dam par ldan // de yi thabs gyur pa ni nyin mtshan du //
translated: is endowed with the sacred bliss of the experience of joy.🔽The method for that is

original: blo dang ldan pas bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
translated: the meditation by the wise on the self day and night.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa la mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
translated: The yogi who is thus diligent in meditation,

original: gal te sems rgod pa'am zhum par gyur na de'i tshe thig le'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: gal te sems rgod pa'am zhum par gyur na de'i tshe thig le'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba yin pas /
translated: if the mind becomes excited or depressed, then at that time the meditation of the bindu yoga and so on should be performed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dbugs bgrang rngub rjes su dran pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dbugs bgrang rngub rjes su dran pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The mindfulness of the inhalation and exhalation of the breath is the yoga of the vital essence drop.

original: sdud pas na rngub pa ste dbugs gang nang du rngub pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pas na rngub pa ste dbugs gang nang du rngub pa'o //
translated: Inhalation is the breath that enters within, because it is collected.

original: phyir 'don pas na 'byin pa ste dbugs gang phyir 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir 'don pas na 'byin pa ste dbugs gang phyir 'byin pa'o //
translated: Exhalation is the breath that goes out, because it is emitted.

original: de gnyis 'dren pa ni dbugs sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad du 'byin pa dang rngub pa nas mgo btsugs la bgrang bar bya zhing phyis 'byin pa bgrang ba'i tshul gyis grangs bcu'i bar du bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dren pa ni dbugs sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad du 'byin pa dang rngub pa nas mgo btsugs la bgrang bar bya zhing phyis 'byin pa bgrang ba'i tshul gyis grangs bcu'i bar du bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: The counting of those two is begun with the inhalation and exhalation of the breath to the extent of twelve finger lengths, and later the counting is done up to ten by the method of counting the exhalations.

original: ma tshang bar bgrang ba ni gcig la gnyis zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //🔽lhag @178a * //
analyzed: ma tshang bar bgrang ba ni gcig la gnyis zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o // lhag @178a * //
translated: The incomplete counting is what is called “two in one.”

original: bar bgrang ba ni gnyis la gcig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bar bgrang ba ni gnyis la gcig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The excess counting is what is called “one in two.”

original: sems shin tu bsdus pa dang g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas shin tu mang ba dang nyung bar ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems shin tu bsdus pa dang g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas shin tu mang ba dang nyung bar ma byas pa yin no //
translated: One should not make the counting too long or too short out of fear of excessive contraction or distraction of the mind.

original: de ltar bsgom pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems zhum pa rnam par brtags nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i ral gri'i dbus na gnas pa'i thig le phra mo mu tig gi 'bras bu'i gzugs can rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems zhum pa rnam par brtags nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i ral gri'i dbus na gnas pa'i thig le phra mo mu tig gi 'bras bu'i gzugs can rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having examined the mind that is not in accord with such meditation, one should visualize the subtle drop located in the center of the sword of the gnosis-being in one's heart, which has the form of a pearl.

original: 'od dang ldan pa ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
translated: Having light means radiating light.

original: 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes pa'i thig le de 'od zer gyi phreng ba can mu tig gi rdog ma phra mo lta bu dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pa bcu spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis byas pas ye shes sems dpa' sad par bya zhing
analyzed: 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes pa'i thig le de 'od zer gyi phreng ba can mu tig gi rdog ma phra mo lta bu dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pa bcu spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis byas pas ye shes sems dpa' sad par bya zhing
translated: That drop, which is beautified by a mass of light rays, having a garland of light rays like a tiny pearl, by the process of the exhalation and inhalation of the ten vital airs, one should awaken the gnosis-being

original: brtan par byas la rim pa 'di nyid kyis gsung rdo rje dang sku rdo rje'i sa bon las 'byung ba padma dang 'khor lo lkog ma dang spyi bor gnas pa brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan par byas la rim pa 'di nyid kyis gsung rdo rje dang sku rdo rje'i sa bon las 'byung ba padma dang 'khor lo lkog ma dang spyi bor gnas pa brtan par bya'o //
translated: and stabilize it. And by this very process, one should stabilize the lotus and wheel, which arise from the seed of Speech Vajra and Body Vajra, located at the throat and head.

original: de nas brtan par gyur pa shes pa ni 'od zer gyi phreng ba de nyid ye shes kyi rgyun gyi sa bon gzugs can du spyi bo'i steng yan chad ji srid 'dod kyi bar du btang la rgyun mi 'chad pa kho nar rim pa'i rnam pa gang kho
analyzed: de nas brtan par gyur pa shes pa ni 'od zer gyi phreng ba de nyid ye shes kyi rgyun gyi sa bon gzugs can du spyi bo'i steng yan chad ji srid 'dod kyi bar du btang la rgyun mi 'chad pa kho nar rim pa'i rnam pa gang kho
translated: Then, the knowledge of stability is that the garland of light rays is the seed of the continuum of pristine consciousness in the form of a drop above the crown for as long as one wishes.🔽The way the emanation is withdrawn is that the seed syllable of the mind is withdrawn in the same way that it was emanated.

original: nas spros pa de bzhin du thugs kyis bon gyi bar du bsdu par bya zhing rkang pa'i mthil la thug gi bar gyi nang gi lus snang bar byas la /🔽de nas phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor kun du mtha' yas par ba spu re re las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyi char gyi rgyun 'bab pa lta bur khams gsum ma lus pa kun du dgang bar bya zhing ji srid du zhum pa med par gyur pa
analyzed: nas spros pa de bzhin du thugs kyis bon gyi bar du bsdu par bya zhing rkang pa'i mthil la thug gi bar gyi nang gi lus snang bar byas la / de nas phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor kun du mtha' yas par ba spu re re las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyi char gyi rgyun 'bab pa lta bur khams gsum ma lus pa kun du dgang bar bya zhing ji srid du zhum pa med par gyur pa
translated: The inner body is illuminated up to the soles of the feet.🔽Then, the rain of the assembly of light rays that arise from each pore fills the entire three realms, like a rain shower.

original: de srid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de srid kyi bar du'o //
translated: One should fill the entire three realms in that way until one becomes free of discouragement.

original: gal te sems rgod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sems rgod par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes agitated,

original: de'i tshe thig le tsam nyid la sems gtod pas brtan par bya zhing sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa ji srid du rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe thig le tsam nyid la sems gtod pas brtan par bya zhing sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa ji srid du rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bya'o //
translated: At that time, by focusing the mind on the mere drop, one should stabilize it, and one should meditate on the meditative absorption that stops the mind and mental factors, for as long as that agitation is pacified.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor 'di ni rgyud kyi le'u bcu gcig pa las /
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor 'di ni rgyud kyi le'u bcu gcig pa las /
translated: This yoga of the drop is taught in the eleventh chapter of the tantra,

original: srog ni thig ler gyur pas gzhag / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: srog ni thig ler gyur pas gzhag / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: beginning with “the life force is placed in the drop.”

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i phyir 'od ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i phyir 'od ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the yoga of the subtle, it says “luminous,” and so on.

original: yang na zhum pa dang rgod pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa rdzogs nas /
analyzed: yang na zhum pa dang rgod pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa rdzogs nas /
translated: Or, after completing the meditation on the yoga of the drop in order to pacify laxity and agitation,

original: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu phra mo tsam @178b la rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rtsa ba'i mtshan ma 'od dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu phra mo tsam @178b la rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rtsa ba'i mtshan ma 'od dang ldan zhing /
translated: one should meditate on the yoga of the subtle, which is the sign of the attainment of the branch of meditative concentration.🔽The yoga of the subtle is taught in the eleventh chapter of the tantra, beginning with “the life force is placed in the drop.”

original: kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnam par 'phro ba rang gi sna'i rtse mor gnas pa'am rig pa'i sna'i rtse mor bsgoms pa brtsams la /
analyzed: kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnam par 'phro ba rang gi sna'i rtse mor gnas pa'am rig pa'i sna'i rtse mor bsgoms pa brtsams la /
translated: The assembly of light rays of five colors radiates, located at the tip of one's nose, or one should meditate on the tip of the nose of the knowledge being.

original: de'i nang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa phra mor chud par byas la /
analyzed: de'i nang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa phra mor chud par byas la /
translated: Within that, one should meditate on the entire maṇḍala wheel, having been reduced to subtlety.

original: snying brtse zhing snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying brtse zhing snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having been preceded by compassion and great compassion, one should meditate.

original: zin pa ni blangs pa ste /
analyzed: zin pa ni blangs pa ste /
translated: “Grasping” is taking.

original: shes rab dam pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dam pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the wisdom consort, the gnosis of sublime wisdom.

original: mtshan ma brtan po ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas mtshan ma brtan pa nyid mthong bar gyur pa ni rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma brtan po ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas mtshan ma brtan pa nyid mthong bar gyur pa ni rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: “The firm sign” is seeing the firmness of the sign through meditating on subtle yoga, as it is said in the tantra:

original: smig rgyu lta bu dang po ste //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu dang po ste //
translated: The first is like a mirage;

original: du blta bu gnyis pa yin //
analyzed: du blta bu gnyis pa yin //
translated: the second is like smoke;

original: mkha' snang lta bu gsum pa ste //
analyzed: mkha' snang lta bu gsum pa ste //
translated: the third is like fireflies;

original: mar me ltar 'bar bzhi ba yin //🔽sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
analyzed: mar me ltar 'bar bzhi ba yin // sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
translated: the fourth is like a burning lamp;🔽the fifth is like a cloudless sky

original: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa yin //
translated: that is always shining.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i mtshan ma brtan po mthong bar gyur pa ;
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i mtshan ma brtan po mthong bar gyur pa ;
translated: Having seen these and other firm signs,

original: /'od zer de'i mtha' las byung ba'i ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzugs sna tshogs pa rnams yang dang yang du spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: /'od zer de'i mtha' las byung ba'i ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzugs sna tshogs pa rnams yang dang yang du spro bar bya'o //
translated: one should repeatedly emanate various forms of signs such as swords, vajras, wheels, lotuses, and so forth, which arise from the end of that light ray.

original: mtshan ma spros pas de las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas nam mkha' kun du gang bar bya'o//
analyzed: mtshan ma spros pas de las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas nam mkha' kun du gang bar bya'o//
translated: Having emanated the signs, one should fill the sky with Vairocana and so forth that arise from them.

original: blo ldan ni ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan ni ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par brtsam pa'o //
translated: The wise one is one who has undertaken the accumulation of wisdom.

original: la la ni sna'i rtse zhes bya ba ni sgras snying ga'i padma'i dbus yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: la la ni sna'i rtse zhes bya ba ni sgras snying ga'i padma'i dbus yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the tip of the nose is the center of the heart lotus.

original: snying gar bsgom pa nyid du bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying gar bsgom pa nyid du bya ba'o //
translated: One should meditate on it at the heart.

original: de yang rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud las /
translated: Moreover, the Tantra says:

original: sna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
analyzed: sna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
translated: Visualize a mustard seed at the tip of the nose.

original: 'gro dang mi 'gro yungs kar la //
analyzed: 'gro dang mi 'gro yungs kar la //
translated: The moving and unmoving worlds

original: 'khor lo la sogs khyad par du //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs khyad par du //
translated: are especially in the mustard seed.

original: bsgom pa de ni brtag par bya //
analyzed: bsgom pa de ni brtag par bya //
translated: That meditation should be contemplated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bzlas brjod kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlas brjod kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of repetition,

original: yang na bzlas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na bzlas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Or else, [one should] repeat [mantras] . . .” and so forth.

original: yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: Here, the word “or else”

original: 'di skad ston te /🔽phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa la bslab pa bor nas /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te / phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa la bslab pa bor nas /
translated: teaches that🔽one should not abandon the training in the cultivation of the yoga of the Great Seal

original: bzlas brjod bya ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: bzlas brjod bya ba ma yin gyi //
translated: and engage in repetition.

original: 'on kyang bsgom pas dub pa'i tshe bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgom pas dub pa'i tshe bya'o //
translated: However, [one should do so] when one is tired of cultivation.

original: la la ni sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba'i dus su bzlas brjod 'bum byas la /
analyzed: la la ni sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba'i dus su bzlas brjod 'bum byas la /
translated: Some say that at the time of performing the prior approximation, one should perform a hundred thousand repetitions,

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la bslab par bya ba yin pas /🔽'am zhes bya @179a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la bslab par bya ba yin pas / 'am zhes bya @179a * //
translated: and then train in the yoga of the Great Seal and so forth.🔽Therefore, the word “or else”

original: ba'i sgras phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba'i sgras phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: teaches another position.

original: bzlas pa ni sngags kyi bsgom pa'o /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni sngags kyi bsgom pa'o /
translated: Repetition is the cultivation of mantra.

original: rtse gcig sems nyid ni zhes bya ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig sems nyid ni zhes bya ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: One-pointed mind is free from all distraction.

original: dngos kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun du bzang po la sogs pa lta bur mngon sum byed pa'i gzhir gyur pas so //
analyzed: dngos kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun du bzang po la sogs pa lta bur mngon sum byed pa'i gzhir gyur pas so //
translated: “The nature of all things” means that it is the basis for the direct realization of the nature of Samantabhadra, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyis na rang gi sems dbang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rang gi sems dbang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is called “one’s own mind-faculty.”

original: de yang rang gi sngags rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan zhing kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs sna tshogs pa rnam par 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi sngags rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan zhing kha dog lnga'i 'od zer gyi tshogs sna tshogs pa rnam par 'bar ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is endowed with the light rays of one’s own mantra, blazing with the various collections of light rays of five colors.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i rtsa ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i rtsa ba'i sngags so //
translated: “One’s own” means one’s own deity’s root mantra.

original: srog ni dbugs 'byin pa dang rngub pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: srog ni dbugs 'byin pa dang rngub pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: “Life” is the wind of exhalation and inhalation.

original: de'i rtsol ba ni bsdam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rtsol ba ni bsdam pa ste /
translated: “Its exertion” is restraint.

original: de dang bcas pas shin tu ma bsdams pa yin la dbang po mi bsdams pa ni sngar bshad pa'i dbugs bgrang ba dang / rngub pa rjes su dran pa'i tshul gyis sems brtan par byas la /
analyzed: de dang bcas pas shin tu ma bsdams pa yin la dbang po mi bsdams pa ni sngar bshad pa'i dbugs bgrang ba dang / rngub pa rjes su dran pa'i tshul gyis sems brtan par byas la /
translated: Since it is endowed with that, it is “not very restrained,” and “the unrestrained faculty” is the mind stabilized by the method of counting the breath and recalling the inhalation, as explained above.

original: gsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni gug skyed dang tshad dang yongs su ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: gsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni gug skyed dang tshad dang yongs su ma bral ba ste /
translated: The phrase clearly means not separated from the vowels and measures,

original: ring bar ma yin /
analyzed: ring bar ma yin /
translated: not long,

original: dal bar ma yin /
analyzed: dal bar ma yin /
translated: not slow,

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pas kyang non par ma gyur pa dang / dbang po dang rtsol bas bskyed pa'i sgra che bas gsal ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pas kyang non par ma gyur pa dang / dbang po dang rtsol bas bskyed pa'i sgra che bas gsal ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: not overwhelmed by inhalation and exhalation, and not clear with a loud sound produced by the organs and effort.

original: rdo rje tshig gis bzla bya ste //
analyzed: rdo rje tshig gis bzla bya ste //
translated: The mantra should be recited with vajra speech.

original: rdo rje tshig ni sgra spangs pa //
analyzed: rdo rje tshig ni sgra spangs pa //
translated: Vajra speech is free from sound.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rgyud 'di nyid las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // rgyud 'di nyid las /
translated: This is stated.

original: khro bo'i bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: khro bo'i bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin //
translated: The characteristics of wrathful recitation are stated in this very tantra:

original: khro bo'i dam tshig ye shes kyis //
analyzed: khro bo'i dam tshig ye shes kyis //
translated: Through the wisdom of wrathful commitment,

original: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor grags //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor grags //
translated: one's vajra maṇḍala resounds.

original: sngags kyi yi ge tshig thos pa //🔽de ni khro bo'i bzlas par bshad //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge tshig thos pa // de ni khro bo'i bzlas par bshad //
translated: Hearing the mantra syllables and words,

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //
translated: that is explained as wrathful recitation.

original: aom ni tshad phyed dang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: aom ni tshad phyed dang gnyis pa'o //
translated: Om has a measure of one and a half.

original: yi ge a'a: ni tshad gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge a'a: ni tshad gnyis pa'o //
translated: The syllable aḥ has a measure of two.

original: thugs kyis sa bon h'um ni tshad phyed dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyis sa bon h'um ni tshad phyed dang gsum pa'o //
translated: The mind seed syllable hūṃ has a measure of one and a half.

original: rim pa bzhin du bya ba ni //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du bya ba ni //
translated: The performance is in sequence,

original: sku rdo rje'i sa bon nas brtsams te //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i sa bon nas brtsams te //
translated: beginning with the seed of Body-vajra,

original: thugs rdo rje'i sngags kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i sngags kyi bar du'o //
translated: up to the mantra of Mind-vajra.

original: cig car zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Simultaneously means

original: cig car dus mtshungs par yi ge aom dang a'a: dang yi ge h'um las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i lta bu'i lha'i 'khor lo spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: cig car dus mtshungs par yi ge aom dang a'a: dang yi ge h'um las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i lta bu'i lha'i 'khor lo spro bar bya'o //
translated: that one should emanate the circle of deities, like the five Tathagatas, simultaneously, at the same time, from the syllable Om, the syllable Ah, and the syllable Hum.

original: rim gyis gcig spros nas de'i 'og tu gzhan spro ba lta bur mi bya'o //
analyzed: rim gyis gcig spros nas de'i 'og tu gzhan spro ba lta bur mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do it like the emanation of one after another in sequence.

original: rgyud las kyang 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyud las kyang 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: And the Tantra also says this:

original: sngags rnams thams cad spro ba ni //
analyzed: sngags rnams thams cad spro ba ni //
translated: The emanation of all the mantras

original: dbye ba @179b rnam pa gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: dbye ba @179b rnam pa gnyis su bshad //
translated: is explained as being of two kinds:

original: rim gyis sam ni cig car ro //
analyzed: rim gyis sam ni cig car ro //
translated: in sequence or instantaneously.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de bas na skad cig nyid kyis 'od zer gyi tshogs ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig nyid kyis 'od zer gyi tshogs ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should emanate the assembly of Tathagatas like a mass of light-rays in an instant.

original: nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i skus til gyi gang bu bzhin du nam mkha'i gtos thams cad kun du gang bar byas la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i skus til gyi gang bu bzhin du nam mkha'i gtos thams cad kun du gang bar byas la /
translated: Equal to the realm of space means that the entire realm of space is filled with the bodies of the five Tathagatas, such as Vajra Body, like a filled sesame pod.

original: snga ma bzhin du yi ge mam las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi rtse mo las 'thon pa'i me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / rin po che'i mar me dang / nam bza' dang chos gos la sogs pa mchod pa'i tshogs sna tshogs pas yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du yi ge mam las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi rtse mo las 'thon pa'i me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / rin po che'i mar me dang / nam bza' dang chos gos la sogs pa mchod pa'i tshogs sna tshogs pas yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should make offerings with various offering substances such as flowers, incense, perfume, jeweled lamps, food, Dharma robes, and so on, which emerge from the tips of light rays from the syllable mam.

original: kun du zhes bya ba ni 'od 'byin pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba ni 'od 'byin pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mchod pa bya'o //
translated: All means immediately after emitting light.

original: yongs su sbas pa ni 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbas pa ni 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Fully embracing means embracing.

original: rig pa mchog rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig pa mchog rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme knowledge beings means

original: spyan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa ste /
translated: Locana and so on.

original: de las byung ba'i rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de babs pas gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa des rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams mchog tu dga' ba'i sbyor ba mthar thug par mthong zhing bsams la rnam par sgeg cing rol pa'i sbrul pa sna tshogs pas
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de babs pas gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa des rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams mchog tu dga' ba'i sbyor ba mthar thug par mthong zhing bsams la rnam par sgeg cing rol pa'i sbrul pa sna tshogs pas
translated: By that, one sees the assembly of victors in the ultimate union of supreme joy, and imagines that.

original: 'gro ba'i don byas nas rang gi lus kyi thugs rdo rje'i sa bon gyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byas nas rang gi lus kyi thugs rdo rje'i sa bon gyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the welfare of the world with various emanations of play and dance, one should cause the bodhicitta to enter into the seed of mind-vajra in one’s own body.

original: mthar zhes bya ba ni sngags de re re bzlas pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: mthar zhes bya ba ni sngags de re re bzlas pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: “ In the end” means that at the time of completing the recitation of each mantra,🔽the Tantra Requested by Subāhu also says:

original: sngags ni brjod tshe spro bya zhing //
analyzed: sngags ni brjod tshe spro bya zhing //
translated: When the mantra is uttered, emanate;

original: rdzogs pa na ni bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: rdzogs pa na ni bsdu bar bya //
translated: when complete, gather.

original: zhes bya ba dang / thugs kyi sa bon gyis bsdu bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / thugs kyi sa bon gyis bsdu bya //
translated: And: Gather with the seed of mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: bsgom pa dang bzlas pas dub pa na ngal so bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pas dub pa na ngal so bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When one is tired of meditation and recitation, in order to rest,

original: rang gi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said “one’s essence.”

original: rang gi snying po de kho na nyid rang gi sngags kyi don to //🔽de la nges par rtog pa ni spro ba dang ni bsdu ba dang / gnas pa brtan par byas pa de las byung ba'i skyo bas sems las su mi rung bas sems zhum par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying po de kho na nyid rang gi sngags kyi don to // de la nges par rtog pa ni spro ba dang ni bsdu ba dang / gnas pa brtan par byas pa de las byung ba'i skyo bas sems las su mi rung bas sems zhum par gyur pa ste /
translated: The meaning of one's mantra is the reality of one's essence.🔽There, contemplation is the arising of weariness from the stable performance of the emanation and gathering and abiding.

original: bzlas pa dang bsgom pas yongs su du ba nas /
analyzed: bzlas pa dang bsgom pas yongs su du ba nas /
translated: The mind becomes depressed due to the unserviceability of the mind caused by weariness.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa'i sems zhum par gyur pa de'i tshe /🔽spyan la sogs pa'i rig pa'i lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyis yang dag par glu blangs pas rab tu bskul zhing sad par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor @180a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa'i sems zhum par gyur pa de'i tshe / spyan la sogs pa'i rig pa'i lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyis yang dag par glu blangs pas rab tu bskul zhing sad par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor @180a * //
translated: When the mind of the yogi becomes depressed,

original: lo snga ma bzhin du mchod pa rnams kyis yongs su mchod la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lo snga ma bzhin du mchod pa rnams kyis yongs su mchod la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: at that time, the host of knowledge goddesses such as Locanā, having fully aroused and awakened him with their songs, the yogi should meditate on the wheel of the maṇḍala as before, having fully worshipped it with the offerings.

original: bsgom pas lus nyam chung bar gyur pa la brtas pa'i sbyor ba bya dgos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pas lus nyam chung bar gyur pa la brtas pa'i sbyor ba bya dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the body becomes weak due to meditation, the application of nourishment is necessary. Therefore,

original: sems bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said the mind is good, and so on.

original: sems bzang ba ni yongs su bsgoms pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chu'i rgyun gyi bdud rtsi 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: sems bzang ba ni yongs su bsgoms pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chu'i rgyun gyi bdud rtsi 'bab pa ste /
translated: A good mind is the flow of the nectar of the stream of the water of the thoroughly cultivated thought of awakening.

original: de lus kyi spyod pa skye zhing zhum pa bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lus kyi spyod pa skye zhing zhum pa bsal bar bya'o //
translated: That should be generated in the body, and the depression should be removed.

original: de yang mtho gang tsam gyi steng du spags par zla ba'i dkyil 'khor aom gyis mtshan par bsams la /
analyzed: de yang mtho gang tsam gyi steng du spags par zla ba'i dkyil 'khor aom gyis mtshan par bsams la /
translated: Moreover, one should imagine that above that, at a distance of one hand-span, there is a moon-disk marked with an Om.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'i 'od kyi lcags kyus zhes pa sngar bshad pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa'i tshul gyis bdud rtsi'i rgyun drangs nas spyi bo'i steng du babs par yid la byas nas /
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'i 'od kyi lcags kyus zhes pa sngar bshad pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa'i tshul gyis bdud rtsi'i rgyun drangs nas spyi bo'i steng du babs par yid la byas nas /
translated: Having drawn up the stream of nectar with the hook of the light of the life-force and exertion, as previously explained, by the method of mindfulness of the exhalation and inhalation of breath, one should imagine that it falls on the top of the head.

original: bdud rtsi des rang gi lus kyi phra rab re re nas rkang pa'i mthar thug gi bar brlan par gyur par ji srid kyi skyob gsal ba de srid kyi bar du bsgom bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi des rang gi lus kyi phra rab re re nas rkang pa'i mthar thug gi bar brlan par gyur par ji srid kyi skyob gsal ba de srid kyi bar du bsgom bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should meditate for as long as one is clear about that nectar moistening every atom of one's body, down to the toes.

original: 'di nyid kyi rgyud las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rgyud las kyang gsungs te /
translated: This is also stated in the tantra:

original: mtho gang tsam gyis spags par ni //
analyzed: mtho gang tsam gyis spags par ni //
translated: At a distance of one hand-span

original: spyi bor dkyil 'khor brtag par bya //
analyzed: spyi bor dkyil 'khor brtag par bya //
translated: One should examine the maṇḍala on the crown.

original: aom ni dbus su gnas bsams nas //
analyzed: aom ni dbus su gnas bsams nas //
translated: Having contemplated the syllable Oṃ in the center,

original: bdud rtsi lnga bo dbab par bya //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga bo dbab par bya //
translated: one should cause the five nectars to descend.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar / thang cig ngal bso byas nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar / thang cig ngal bso byas nas ni //
translated: Having rested for a moment,

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bstan pa'i cho ga'i sbyor ba 'dis thang cig ces pas chu tshod gnyis tsam ngal bso zhing dbugs phyung la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bstan pa'i cho ga'i sbyor ba 'dis thang cig ces pas chu tshod gnyis tsam ngal bso zhing dbugs phyung la /
translated: thus, by this method of instruction, having rested for a moment, for about two hours, one should take a break and relax.

original: sngar bshad pa'i cho gas spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa bya ba'i rim gyis gsang sngags kyi dam pa rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i cho gas spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa bya ba'i rim gyis gsang sngags kyi dam pa rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: By the process of emanating and reabsorbing, as explained before, one should continuously recite the supreme mantra.

original: sngags la'ang kun du chags pa med par bya //
analyzed: sngags la'ang kun du chags pa med par bya //
translated: One should also be without attachment to the mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa nyid la goms par byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa nyid la goms par byas la /
translated: One should always practice familiarization with meditation.

original: des skyon bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: des skyon bzlas par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should recite with faults.

original: bzlas pas kyang du ba na chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzlas pas kyang du ba na chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By reciting, one should also benefit sentient beings by teaching the Dharma, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: sngags kyi bzlas pa nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas pa nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the withdrawal of mantra recitation, [the Bhagavān] declares,🔽

original: bstod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the withdrawal of the mantra recitation, [the Bhagavān] declares, “praise,” and so forth.

original: rgyud las mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i bstod pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / mar me la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang bdag byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi @180b 'khor lo gshegs su gsol bar ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud las mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i bstod pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / mar me la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang bdag byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi @180b 'khor lo gshegs su gsol bar ba'o //
translated: In the tantra, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Akṣobhya-vajra,” and so forth, the praise, and the offerings of flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, and so forth, and the initiation and tasting of elixir, and so forth, having been performed, the maṇḍala wheel is requested to depart.

original: sngags pas rab tu 'bad de zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: sngags pas rab tu 'bad de zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa la mkhas pas so //
translated: “The mantrin, having made effort,” is the one skilled in meditation.

original: gang du gshegs su gsol zhe na /🔽aom la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang du gshegs su gsol zhe na / aom la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Where is it requested to depart?🔽[The Bhagavān] declares, “into the four syllables, Oṃ and so forth,” and so forth.

original: aom la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yongs su thim par bya ba ste /
analyzed: aom la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yongs su thim par bya ba ste /
translated: The maṇḍala wheel is to be dissolved into the four syllables Oṃ and so forth.

original: sku rdo rje dang sku rdo rje'i rig pa'i snying po dang / gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ni spyi bor ro //
analyzed: sku rdo rje dang sku rdo rje'i rig pa'i snying po dang / gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ni spyi bor ro //
translated: Vajra Body and the essence of the knowledge of Vajra Body, and so forth, Yamāntaka and so forth, are at the crown.

original: gsung rdo rje dang de'i rigs 'jig rten dbang phyug dang padma mthar byed la sogs pa ni lkog mar ro //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje dang de'i rigs 'jig rten dbang phyug dang padma mthar byed la sogs pa ni lkog mar ro //
translated: The speech vajra and its family, Lokeśvara, Padmanarteśvara, and so on, are in the throat.

original: phyag na rdo rje dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa ni thugs kyi sa bon du'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa ni thugs kyi sa bon du'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, Amṛtakuṇḍali, and so on, are in the heart seed syllable.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje de rnams kyang ye shes sems dpar bsdu'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje de rnams kyang ye shes sems dpar bsdu'o //
translated: Those body, speech, and mind vajras are also gathered into the gnosis being.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis sku la sogs pa zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kun du bzang po'i bdag nyid can rnam par mi rtog par lhag par mos pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis sku la sogs pa zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kun du bzang po'i bdag nyid can rnam par mi rtog par lhag par mos pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by this process, one should meditate on the body, and so on, which is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of Samantabhadra, with nonconceptual imagination.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: Thus, and so on.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bas sems can gyi khams ma lus pa de kho na nyid mthong ba dang bral zhing bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dug gis zin pa rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bas sems can gyi khams ma lus pa de kho na nyid mthong ba dang bral zhing bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dug gis zin pa rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed de /
translated: Thus, by seeing the ultimate thatness, one should generate great compassion for all sentient beings who are devoid of seeing thatness and are seized by the poison of the afflictions of grasping “I” and “mine.”

original: de gdon par bya ba'i phyir smon lam rnams mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: de gdon par bya ba'i phyir smon lam rnams mngon du bya'o //
translated: In order to eliminate that, one should make aspirations.

original: de yang gang gis las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su smon par mdzad pa ste /🔽'khor ba tha ma med pa yi //
analyzed: de yang gang gis las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su smon par mdzad pa ste / 'khor ba tha ma med pa yi //
translated: Moreover, one should make aspirations at the time of being a beginner.🔽As it is said:🔽For as long as the beginningless

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni ji srid pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni ji srid pa //
translated: and endless cycle of existence has existed,

original: de srid sems can phan don du //
analyzed: de srid sems can phan don du //
translated: for that long, for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: spyod pa dpag yas spyod par gyis //🔽phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i //
analyzed: spyod pa dpag yas spyod par gyis // phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i //
translated: may I engage in infinite activities.🔽For the sake of accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings

original: sems can kun don bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun don bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: throughout the ten directions and the limits of space,

original: ji ltar 'jam dpal spyod mdzad pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jam dpal spyod mdzad pa //
translated: just as Mañjuśrī engages in conduct,🔽may my conduct be like that.

original: bdag gi spyod pa de 'drar shog / ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / bzang po spyod pa las gsungs pa'i smon lam dag kyang bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa de 'drar shog / ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / bzang po spyod pa las gsungs pa'i smon lam dag kyang bya'o //
translated: And so forth, and one should make aspirations as taught in the Bhadracari.

original: da ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i sgo nas spyod yul yongs su dag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i sgo nas spyod yul yongs su dag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the complete purity of the sphere of experience through abiding in the application of non-equipoise,

original: langs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: langs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said arising and so forth.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa las langs nas dag pa'i sems zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa dang / rang lha'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba kun du bzang po'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa yid la byas nas /🔽kun du snang @181a * //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa las langs nas dag pa'i sems zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa dang / rang lha'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba kun du bzang po'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa yid la byas nas / kun du snang @181a * //
translated: Having arisen from meditative equipoise, he should engage in the benefit of others with what is called pure thought, and with the pride called pride of being the deity, which is the pride of being Samantabhadra.

original: bar gnas par gyur cing /
analyzed: bar gnas par gyur cing /
translated: He should abide in the appearance of everything,

original: so sor snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi yul rnams la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba dbye ba med par rtog pas so //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi yul rnams la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba dbye ba med par rtog pas so //
translated: and with the thought that the objects, which have the nature of mere appearances, are as before, that is, without differentiation.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify just this,

original: dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa yis //
translated: the glorious Vajra Holder

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: dpal ldan ni rdo rje 'chang ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dpal ldan ni rdo rje 'chang ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The glorious one is the essence of Vajradhara.

original: khams gsum gnas ni thams cad na //
analyzed: khams gsum gnas ni thams cad na //
translated: In all the abodes of the three realms,

original: brtan g-yo'i dngos po ji snyed pa //
analyzed: brtan g-yo'i dngos po ji snyed pa //
translated: whatever things there are, moving and unmoving,

original: de kun de nyid sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de kun de nyid sbyor ba yis //
translated: all of them should be seen

original: rdo rje 'chang ba lta bur lta //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba lta bur lta //
translated: as Vajradhara through the application of reality.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise,

original: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
translated: All yogas are the Bhagavān,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathāgata.

original: de nyid nye bar longs spyod nyid //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar longs spyod nyid //
translated: That itself is the enjoyment,

original: khams gsum pa ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: the entirety of the three realms.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul du bsgom pa'o //
translated: One should meditate in the manner stated in such passages.

original: rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes lhag par mos pas sku la sogs pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes lhag par mos pas sku la sogs pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa ste /
translated: “In order” means that by the superior intention that all phenomena are pure by nature, one becomes a vajra body and so forth.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste, and touch are the essence of Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni don dam par dbye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni don dam par dbye ba med pa ste /
translated: “By nature” means that ultimately there is no division,

original: gang phyir chos dbyings ma gtogs pa'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gang phyir chos dbyings ma gtogs pa'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because there is no phenomenon that exists apart from the dharmadhātu.

original: phyin ci log gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas sbyin pa byin pa dang / bla ma dang lhag pa'i lha la mchod pa byed pa dang / chos ston pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad phyin ci log gi rtog pa bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang bral zhing spangs pas bya ba de thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas sbyin pa byin pa dang / bla ma dang lhag pa'i lha la mchod pa byed pa dang / chos ston pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad phyin ci log gi rtog pa bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dang bral zhing spangs pas bya ba de thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: The yogi/nī should complete all of these activities, since they are free from and have abandoned the conceptual thoughts of error, the manifest clinging to “I” and “mine.”

original: gang gi phyir 'khor bar 'ching ba'i rgyu ni phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor bar 'ching ba'i rgyu ni phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
translated: The cause of bondage in cyclic existence is the conceptual thoughts of error.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
translated: Dharmakīrti’s Exposition of Valid Cognition says:

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes 'gyur //
translated: When there is a self, there is the perception of other.🔽From the division of self and other come grasping and hatred.

original: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni kun du 'brel pa las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni kun du 'brel pa las //
translated: From being thoroughly entangled in those two

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: all faults come about.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa @181b dang ; byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa @181b dang ; byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa mchod pa bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should make offerings to the entire maṇḍala of the bodhisattvas, completely pure in the three spheres.

original: de yang gang gi phyir gsang sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis 'di thams cad nges pa kho nar bya dgos pa yin pas 'di ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir gsang sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis 'di thams cad nges pa kho nar bya dgos pa yin pas 'di ni mchog yin te /
translated: Moreover, since all of this must definitely be done by those who practice the conduct of mantra, this is supreme,
